hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I left for a family emergency & came back to my hotel room given up to someone else & my belongings missing. There was no explanation. Hotel staff & manager Mr. Anish Patney were disrespectful & unhelpful. FYI my checkout date is 5/31. #crisisRN

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I checked into my room Sunday evening on 5/3 and once settled into my room, I noticed a blood stain inside my duvet, covers, and mattress. I called the front desk regarding immediately. She offered a room change or a change of sheets. I had already unpacked and did not want to change rooms as I was tired from completing my 14hr shift as a healthcare worker. Front desk stated someone would come change my sheets. Unfortunately, I was informed the handyman that was available could not change my sheets personally and instead would drop off the new sheets and I would have to change the sheets and make the bed myself. I had waited almost an hour for his arrival, I called the front desk twice because of this.I removed the stained sheets for the handyman to take with and noticed the blood stain had seeped into the mattress cover as well, which had to be replaced.While making the bed, I noticed I was missing the appropriate bedding. I called and requested the front desk to have housekeeping change my sheets the following morning while I was at work. I have called over the phone and asked in person numerous times to the housekeeping, front desk, and the manager about this matter each day and night that it was not resolved. I am frustrated, upset, and disgusted not only because of finding stained blood in my bed but also because no one addressed this matter sooner and it took 3 days to have this matter taken care of. It was resolved on 5/6. Is this Embassy Suites/Hilton’s hospitality and/or customer service experience?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for several days in March. It was wonderful. The room was clean and modern, the service was perfect and the location was minutes away from subways and Time Square. All the front desk people were very helpful, especially Anthony. He went out of his way to make sure all of my questions were answered. I strongly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Excellent check in process, Anita was extremely welcoming and did a great job of helping us pick a room with a view. Property lobby is spotless and room is nice and updated. Overall, great first impression!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: If you are looking for a typical Embassy Suites, this is not it. The rooms are small, we didn't even have room for a couch, so know ahead of time there isn't the typical space. With that being said. The hotel was very nice, well updated. The bed was comfortable, the breakfast was delicious, the staff was very friendly, the evening reception was nice. My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay. The location is great. It is a short walk to so many things. Times Square is close, Union Terminal and Penn Station are within 10 minutes. I would recommend this hotel for couples or smaller groups. One thing I did not agree with is the mandatory $25 daily fee that you must use before midnight in their gift shop, bar or room service. $6 regular Kit Kat, $4 small bag of chips. Most nights we were spending it on stuff we didn't need or use just so the money didn't go to waste.Getting there... We flew into JFK, took the Air Train to the Jamaica Stop, and took the E train to Penn Station where we walked to the hotel. It takes a little over 1 hour total to get from airport to hotel entrance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: What we experienced was different to what was advertised on the website. We felt cheated by a €25 add-on to each room per day. We were forced to purchase items with the €25 add-on and considering one glass of wine was €14 it meant two drinks and tip would screw you further. One or two front desk staff had attitude problem and don't like when someone asks for explanation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The staff, especially Anthony, was amazing and gracious! Rooms are quaint and clean. Breakfast was plentiful and happy hour hit the spot! Greta location and nice choice! Near the both herald square and Times Square. Great views of Empire State Building. Over all positive experience!!
user_name:
tanjers2020
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The breakfast was wonderful and the staff super helpful. The room was very clean, I lacked some cupboard space. The view from 31st floor was a plus. Will definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in NYC

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very new and modern hotel, short walk from Times Square. Great breakfast and happy hour, consistent with the Embassy theme. The dinner restaurant was good, but very small. Total capacity maybe 20? Given the options in NYC, I'm not sure why anyone would eat here other than to use the $25 Urban Destination Fee, which is applied daily and can be used as a credit towards food and beverages in the hotel. However, as I said, with so many amazing dining options in the city, the $25 fee is just another tax. I only ate in the hotel once and the other days, I (and everyone else I spoke to in the bar) was having a quick drink at the bar to "use" the $25 credit. The hotel should discontinue this practice. Otherwise, very friendly staff and a nice hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It’s a place that you would feel comfortable to stay and bring your loved ones and enjoy NYC with near by attractions. Amazing customer service. Parking is Pricey if you have a bigger vehicle. # Thank you!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The staff and location of this hotel are excellent. Upon arrival I was warmly greeted by friendly and professional front desk staff. Check-in was a breeze and my room was ready upon arrival. I had an early morning flight so I was especially appreciative of being allowed access to my room. I arrived much earlier than check-in time. This courteous behavior continued throughout my stay. Kudos to all staff members I had the pleasure of meeting. I stayed in a king room with a view that had a pull-out sofa. I found the room to be tastefully decorated, roomy by NYC standards and most importantly clean. There is a safe and refrigerator in the room. There isn't the usual lobby area normally found near the front desk. There is a recessed seating area off the lobby. The hotel is within walking distance of many major attractions. To name a few, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, Art Museum, Cathedral, transportation and restaurants. The breakfast was very good and the dining area was clean and well maintained. The breakfast area does get very crowded. The bar where Happy Hour is located is also very crowded but staff very efficient. I felt safe staying at this hotel and this will be my hotel of choice when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This location is perfect it was less than 10 minute walk from penn satiation , 7 minutes from Times Square and the theater district. It’s tucked away in the block but it’s such a beautiful location. The staff was extremely professional and friendly and the lobby was immaculate. I will definitely comeback here and stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is fairly new construction and everything was neat and clean. The legendary omelette breakfast was terrific, but the dining areas are very crowded, with disastrous traffic flow.The location on 37th street is not great. When returning late at night from Lincoln Center, the walk from the bus stop is dicey. Space is always at a premium in NYC and rooms were a little cramped, but okay. Wifi worked great. Nice big TV. Huge safe in the closet. I always appreciate coffee maker, small fridge, and microwave and all worked fine.I had a great view from a high floor, and recommend paying a little extra to get that. You'll feel less claustrophobic. The mandatory $25/day fee seems to be taking hold at many Hiltons in Manhattan. You can't accumulate but must spend each day. You can buy from a limited selection at the snack counter or use at the bar/restaurant. But you pay tax and tip at the latter and that doesn't count. I'm told this fee also doesn't count in base points for HIlton Honors. I guess you should just think of it as a surcharge to the otherwise excellent room rate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suites was the first vacation hotel we ever stayed at 30 yrs ago on our honeymoon in Maui. A great chain, the reception and breakfast take the edge off of having to go out multiple times a day. Getting in the room early was a blessing. Thank you
user_name:
teamcarbone
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location easy walking to sites and subway check in was awful it took 45 minutes checked in online but room was not ready so took room on 20th floor big mistake elevator was slow and when you went to breakfast there is not nearly enough seating so if yo want to go back to room it takes a long time rooms are small for embassy suites which we tend to stay in a lot but it is nyc staff was nice in breakfast area nice hotel and clean it’s okay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had 4 nights here and found it a great base for our New York stay. The room had everything we needed and was well appointed. The breakfast omelettes/eggs to order were fabulous and very quick, supplemented by the usual continental breakfast fare.The evening happy hours were outstanding and we really enjoyed meeting new people, there.The location was so convenient to Macy’s shopping, Times Square, and our explorations to all the sight via the nearby subway stop.We will definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: After arriving to what we thought was a quite small room we found the internet would not connect, safe would not lock, and tv so large it was hard to use the hand control. Staff was excellent about trying to fix things and we got to know one young tech/maintenance man quite well. The free breakfast was in a small enough room that omelets to order took over 30 minutes, short staffed, and they refused a request for hard boiled or poached eggs (I had been ill before trip). Fitted sheets would not stay on the bed and the shower head was a bit large for the small shower that had to be turned on from the other end....I got a cold shower wake up each time! However we have to admit location was outstanding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Arrived way too early to check in, but they set me up for early arrival at 2:30 and took our bags so we could start our day. We walked to the hotel from Penn Station. It was an easy walk. Room was nice size for 2 people. It was modern and clean. We were on the 36th floor and had a nice view. Breakfast was good. It was crowded but the food was good. We didn’t go to the 5:30-7:30 reception. Had a so-so burger and a drink at the small bar are adjacent to the lobby. No real restaurant in the hotel. There is a weird $25 charge that you must use in the hotel or lose the money. You can use it at the bar or to buy overpriced snacks and/or sundries. I was told at the front desk I had to use it by midnight or I would still be charged the $25 and not get anything for it. We only stayed one night. I would stay here again. Skyline view is from our 36th floor room at dawn. There was also an incredible view of the Empire State Building from the window near the elevator on the 36th floor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Business trip in the city. Great location to our office across the street. My room had a separate area with a desk and couch where I could get some work done. The bed was comfortable and service was great! Only negative was lack of counter space in the bathroom but I made it work. I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The Embassy Suites may have rooms that are suites, but they are playing pretty loose with the term "suites" if they want to call the room we got a suite. The room was small and was a single room. Not a suite in any sense. It was clean and modern. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was ok. But the room is not a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We went to NY to celebrate a 60th. There were 3 of us, great friends and we decided to stay at Embassy Suites as we have had experience with them before. We went for 3 nights and decided to share a room. Although the room was not large, and there was little space to store suitcases etc, it worked for us. 2 shared the bed and one had the pull out couch which had a very high back, as a type of separator for the room. There was a fridge and microwave. Breakfast and an evening reception was included. The breakfast was superb! We did not care for the wines offered at the reception as they were very limited but, as there was a bar downstairs, we were able to enjoy our choice of wine.The hotel is in a great area close to Herald Square/ Macys as you head to your left, and Bryant Park/Times Square as you head to your right on 6th Ave. There are many shops /restaurants around. We used the subway, it was so easy! The hotel staff were so helpful and always had a smile. We chatted daily and went to the bar a couple of times where Tom kept our wine topped and chatted happily with us like we were long lost friends! We ate there the first night and the food was delicious!All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel as the area, staff, accommodation cannot be beat!Thanks for everything - until we meet again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel offers everything that most of the travelers look for. Very nice position close to times square, offering many dining and entertainment options around. The rooms are clean and well-equiped but if you open the sofa-bed there isn't enough space left. The breakfast is good although it can be crowded. The luggage storage room of the hotel is too small, making it difficult in case you want to store too many things or for long. We do appreciate the help of the front office supervisor who found us a solution. All employees are helping and smiling.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Front desk crew Friendly, upbeat and personable. Great relaxing area with two bars and lounge areas. Rooms spacious and clean. Two TVs in the room which was a plus. Technology all up to date and within the century.
user_name:
mmatthews16
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location. 5 min walk from most of the sights. Managers reception was a bit rubbish. Like a cheap all inclusive with 25% vodka & tasteless beer. Breakfast was fab. Hot & cold, all the types of bread for toasting although how well the item is toasted is pure luck. Omlettes, bacon & sausage.  Front office staff were a bit meh. They seemed more interested in their phones than customers. Tom on the bar was great. He earned his ££ remembering our names & persuading us to have a drink. Lovely to meet you Tom. The $25 a day is great, spend it on the bar or room service (be aware of the food cost + tip + tax). We found a drink each + tax & tip was around $25Nice touch to have iced fruit water in reception. I can imagine the lifts are a nightmare during busy periods.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a great location to get to all of the sights to see through out the city.. Great customer service and rooms! The bartends took the time to get to know you and the food and drinks was great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Internet, room heating and Lifts will be a pain here, if you want a relaxed stay don't go for this hotel. Heating is automatic and keeps reducing the temp if it doesn't detect any moment of a person so you basically die in the cold when it's already 30F in NYC

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is excellent hotel in great location. It’s not your typical Embassy Suits with huge rooms, but it’s very nice and comfortable. They check people in early, if rooms are available. We had room on 39th floor with great views. Breakfast is great. Night reception is very good too. Stuff is very nice and helpful. This was our second stay and we will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I have always been a fan of Embassy Suites but after this stay I am strongly considering never staying in one again. I have never been spoken to and down by omsdone more than the general manger did to me. She wasn't willing to listen or compromise and made me feel extremely unwelcome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As Mariah said below, this is not what you might be expecting. Our room (not suite) was compact. Although on a high floor, window was small, so not great view. Location is very good however, and staff at the lounge and breakfast room friendly. They asses a bogus destination fee $25 which can redeemed at the bar.So comes down the rate you can get (ours was quite good) and how you value the included breakfast (good) and evening reception (a madhouse on Friday, ok the following 2 nights).
user_name:
dkberman
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location is very convenient to everything. We were only there 3 days and could walk to most places. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We loved the complimentary breakfast and cocktail hours! The only complaint is that the rooms are extremely small.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Been to this hotel and love it. Only issue the price is so changing sometimes base price is 110 and other times high as 350 dollars won't stay at that rate. Love the location. Rooms good size could use more easy drawer space. The draw space is mostly under the bed. So I used the safe and luggage holder so I do not have to bend over os much to the bed drawers. Staff right there if you need them. Rooms love the comfy clean crisp white bed. The comforter is so comfy cloud like. The breakfast everything you want plus fresh omelte if you want. Love the choicces of meat, fresh fruit, juices, cold ceral, oatmeal bar with all the fixins, and so much more. The night reception is good enough nothing gourmet but enough to get you through till dinner. The lobby is so beautiful and seating area alos very chic and yuppie but drafty as when the main doors open and close the cold draft comes in . Such a shame to have a lobby and can not use as much as should be used. Lucky for us guests the hotel knows this so they allow you to go to the fourth floor area to sit, lounge, relax, read, and be with other people if you want to be soical or if you privacy then back to your lovely room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel offers an excellent location and great accommodations.My family enjoyed our clean rooms, breakfast, afternoon reception, and room service. We are already planning our next stay to this location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Keep in mind this is NYC so this Embassy is definitely different from other Embassy. The hotel is location is great! Rooms are very small but very nice. Please remember that the drawers are located under the bed and very limited closet space. Food was good and service was great from the staff. Jasmine at the Front Desk definitely represents Hilton at its best! I would recommend staying here but not with kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Trip to NYC. Excellent accomadations. Staff was extremely attentive, helpful, and courteous. We took my daughter for her first NYC TRIP, she loved every second of it and thought the hotel was outstanding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First off, Craig Brereton, the Assistant Front Desk Manager, is amazing and especially helpful. The entrance to the hotel is somehow a mistake- there is no lobby to speak off and all waiting luggage is kept by the bar to the side (not very attractive nor safe). The rooms are smaller than a cruise ship- AND there is absolutely no storage. They are quiet and the bathroom is quite large (really strange) and everything was spotless.The location is wonderful...breakfasts were satisfying (you can bring to your room since there are never any seats) and the bar food was quite good (burgers and wings were most excellent). Will definitely stay here again in the summer when we bring less luggage :-)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Friendly efficient staff, Nice Room size for NY and comforatable bed.Bar was small but great service and friendly atmosphere. Primary visit was to go to a Broadway show and Stepen Colbert show. While a 10 minute walk to Times Square, the cheaper rates more than compensated.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I enjoyed the view from the room. The bed was very comfortable. Didn’t get to experience much of the amenities like evening cocktails as my only interest was seeing the city. But overall I enjoyed my stay. Would definitely recommend

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This particular Embassy Suites was recommended by a friend, for all that it offered, plus convenient location; I'm also a Hilton member, which helped. We had no complaints whatsoever - staff, rooms, meals. . . everything outstanding!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel has it all: location, safety, incredible breakfast buffet, and evening manager's reception! The staff is very friendly. You can walk to shopping, restaurants, Bryant Park, the NY public library, Rockefellar Center, Times Square, and the theater district.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel nearby Times square, a few meters and you were there. Although placed in the middle of the city, we could not hear the noise at night - soundproof Windows and good AC. Very nice rooms, good space, very comfortable bed. Small breakfast area made it very crowdy. Not enough elevators made us sometimes wait 20 minutes to get up/down.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Not a "suite", it was a pull-out bed next to a king bed. Literally no room to walk on one side of the bed. The other was blocked by a humidifier. Hotel charged wrong credit card after receiving the correct one..Took a week to partially resolve it. STAY AWAY

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was an awful experience. We had the smell of marijuana for the entire stay in a nonsmoking hotel. The TV did not work and the sink was stopped up. It was difficult to pull out the sofa bed and I hit my ankle on the corner of the bed no matter how careful I was. Not enough space in the room.
user_name:
Charlene D
Newport Beach, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel for been a Hilton but mostly for the location, walking distance to pretty much every major attraction in midtown. The room was a good size for NY city, with a small sitting area with a pull out couch, divided from the "bedroom" by a half way providing some privacy; there was also a safe, 2 TVs, microwave, mini fridge, great bathroom. Breakfast was great with made to order omelets, plenty to eat, crowded between 8 and 9, happy hour outstanding! And free!!! Bartender at the lobby bar was excellent. Reception staff very good as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It’s easy walking distance from Penn Station' as well as Times Square and Rockefeller’s Square. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff helpful. The rooms are typical NYC size - small. Breakfast was chaotic and hard to find a seat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: How many very comfortable, very clean and very well located, it is only 5 minutes walk from times square. Lots of dining options around. The reception service is very good and the bar at the entrance is wonderful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We are in NYC annually at the holidays and understand small hotel rooms and crowds at check in/checkout. The staff at the bell stand was great with our luggage as we arrived well before we could check in. We left for lunch and upon our return to the hotel after check in time, our room was still not ready. We were given keys but no information regarding breakfast or evening receptions (front desk staff was mediocre at best) and after receiving electronic notification that we could go up, they were still cleaning the room. Our “two room suite” was smaller than a regular hotel room in most other hotels we’ve stayed at in the City. There was only walking clearance around the bed and very little storage - definitely not enough for two adults and a child. We had to request extra bedding for the pullout even though we indicated we had a child staying with us and with the couch pulled out, there similar walking room around it. The shower leaked at the door regardless of how the shower head was pointing. Fortunately, each room had individual temperature controls but no rhyme or reason to its accuracy. Thermostat would be set to different temperatures but it always read at 72 degrees.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just stayed 5 nights at this hotel, which, for us, was not so great. The breakfast area was too small to handle all the people trying to get breakfast. Then trying to find a seat is almost impossible unless you get there when they open at 0730. The 'nightly reception' was a joke. Unless you're gonna gulp down as many drinks as you can in 2 hours, it's not worth paying the extra money to stay here. And every night was either chips and salsa or chips and popcorn to eat. Embassy suites used to have a nice selection during their evening reception, but no more. The room was clean, but we had literally 1 drawer and a small hanging space for our clothes. Shower only, no bath, which was ok. We just kept it in our luggage that we had to put on top of the desk. The elevators were super slow. Location not so good if wanting to walk to Central park, the Rock, etc. I usually choose Hilton brand hotels, and will stay at a cheaper hotel with free breakfast next time. Nothing special here, as far as the hotel or room. And the breakfast and evening reception is a circus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Everything was great except the hidden "fee" and the broken promise to refund it. Terrific staff except rude woman at check-out who insisted they would refund only half of what I was told was a refundable "deposit".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Smallish rooms ( I understand it’s NYC ). Not enough room for clothes, luggage storage. There’s not enough room for two people in the room without bumping into each other. There was too many pillows on the couch that took up space. At the price point, I wouldn’t recommend to anyone with a family of 4 trying to stay in one room

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We visited NYC a few days before Christmas with our eight year old daughter and my mother in law. We were celebrating my mother in law’s birthday and were in town to see The Rockettes Christmas Show. The hotel is perfectly fine but you have to kind of think of it as not an Embassy Suites. The lobby is cramped and you will likely arrive to a throng of people and a ton of luggage. The line to check in was huge and the room wasn’t ready until 4pm. All of this was as expected in NYC Christmastime. The surprise came when we tried to park at the hotel. There wasn’t available parking at the nearby lots. My husband drove around Manhattan for about an hour searching for a garage and eventually found one. The room worked out well but it was on the smaller side. The furniture was in good shape and the bathroom was newly remodeled. We paid for a room with a city view. It was a tremendous view of the Empire State Building. The elevator situation was rough. There was a lot of waiting for available elevators. The other two problems are the lack of seating at breakfast and during the evening reception. Overall, it is a nice hotel in a great location with a warning light about parking and overcrowding. The staff was kind and professional. The view on the higher floor was spectacular!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My stay at the embassy suites was a home away from home. It was five minutes walk from time square, empire state building and so many beautiful places, there are stores where you could shop few minutes walk away, I would definitely visit again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights during mid-December. Arrived in SUV-Tahoe, neither self parking lot would allow us to park in their garages, so we had to park in Myers Garage for additional fee, then pull our luggage to the hotel. The manager, Craig wasn't happy about this and made every effort to make corrections to make us comfortable. Enjoyed all the comforts of a Hilton Embassy and so loved the location, as I travel to NYC a few times a year and this location is one of the best. Hotel clean and nice, personnel fabulous, will say we had two other mild room issues and management got them fixed (broken sink plunger and door bolt lock) but I will definitely stay here again during my next visit if they have space. Breakfast was nice, busy but it was Christmas however, no complaints with that as they kept it moving and the night reception was accommodating also. Quiet room on the 6th floor and for a "sisters" trip we had a blast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Party of two stayed here for several days during the holiday season. The hotel was full and the breakfast room was very busy each morning, but the food selection was great. Our room was small but clean & comfortable and had great views (28th floor). It conveniently had a mini fridge and microwave. The location of this hotel cannot be beat; it is very central and we were able to walk to most of our destinations, including Port Authority bus station. Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This place is beautiful and clean. Looks like it's been recently renovated. The room is very spacious for this price range, with a nice couch as a divider between the bed and the office area. Perhaps the best part is the included breakfast buffet. It has made to order eggs dishes and is simply great value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location! Easy to get to the subway or walk to several neat things (Macy’s, Bryant Park area). Really good breakfast and the evening social is a great snack with drinks included. Rooms are clean and comfy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was looking forward to staying here for 2 nights. To my surprise the room has no drawers and a useless so called closet.The rod for hanging your clothes is without any exaggeration 2 feet off the ground, is this a joke I thought. All my life I've stayed at many hotels and I have never experienced a room with no place for your clothes. Had to lay out my suits on the sofa. How can they get away with this design. I called the front desk multiple times with no response. I literally had to walk down to the front desk to ask questions, how annoying. They claimed they were fully booked and could not give me another room. The only good thing about this room was the bed, it was comfortable.Expedia apologized for this hotel and gave me $100 credit. The hotel offered nothing for my troubles.Never again will I stay at this hotel again.
user_name:
zoopermario
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The stay here started off with a locked garage for the hotel. The garage staff were completely unprofessional the front desk staff was frazzled constantly. Supervisors and lobby staff did not greet staff nor smile it seems it was foreign for them to have basic manners. Book with Hilton up the street or a street over.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am tired of the poor service I am receiving from the Hilton Brand. People need to be aware of the way they bill for your stay....a $25 urban destination fee is charged, and I was well aware of when booking. We were told to use it or lose it and that the best way was with the hotel pantry for beverages and snack, so we did. I had 2 reservations the same week at this hotel and the 1st reservation I was charged the $25 (ok) and also for stuff (less than 25$) we had from the pantry....when I pointed this out to the staff they corrected it and I asked if they would make sure not to do the same thing on the next reservation that I had, apparently that was too much to ask because they did the exact same thing, and I specified what the error was but the just didn't care to do it properly. Upon check out I asked them to correct it and they said they couldn't?My ride to the airport was waiting I didn't have time to argue the mistake they made yet again. So I contacted the Hilton site and they looked into it...they said they don't have a handle on the destination charge yet...funny I don't work there and I figured out the mistake of charging people twice!!! I tried through a few different "Specialists" to explain their mistake and how with the exchange rate I would be losing money (not a lot,but that's not the point). I was given a few Hilton points for my trouble and when I responded that they didn't seem to be getting my point, they just never responded anymore. Terrible service!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Close to everything including restaurants, mass transit, events and shopping. Staff is wonderful, rooms are clean, managers reception is an added bonus. Movie nights in the summer are fun! Centrally located to so many things!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel tucked away in garment district that you can walk to Bryan Park, Rockefeller Center, Macys. Times Sq. Plus hot breakfast and cocktail reception at night. Fridge and micro if needed. DD next door. Very easy to hail cabs right in front of building if needed. Great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: While the rooms are typical NY and small this room was bigger than the Doubletree room i had earlier in the week. Staff was very good and Tom at the reception was amazing..remembering everyone's name. In a pretty good location for subway and other things so a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was excited to try an Embassy Suites, as I've stayed at many Hiltons and other group brands. I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but the evening reception and cooked-to-order breakfast both sounded enticing. Some good points - I liked the location. Away from the serious hustle and bustle of Times Square, but a short walk to loads of points of interest or the Subway. The hotel was very busy with long lines to check-in, but the concierge soon called me over to his desk to check in there instead. The evening reception is a nice idea, but it's much less than an executive lounge you'd find in some Hiltons. There were a few bar-snack nibbles, and drinks on offer - not quite sure what was included, but I had a beer so I know that is. It was very busy and noisy, with few seats available, so we only stopped for one quick drink on one night. Breakfast was really good - nicely cooked and a good selection. The staff were also working hard to keep tables clear. The space is quite small, however, and the hours quite limited - 06:30 to 09:30, with warnings that it's extremely busy towards the end of service. We 'chose' to wake up extra early every day to avoid the crowds. It's all a usual buffet, apart from eggs and omelettes which are cooked fresh - which is what most hotels offer anyway. I was only here for two days, but each day the breakfast choice was slightly different - a very nice touch. The room was comfortable and clean, although the bedroom itself is quite small - just enough room to open the door before you hit the bed. The bathroom is nice and spacious, however. The whole hotel is very modern and clean. Long wait to retrieve our bags when leaving, so we ended up just having to go into the bar area where they're stored to retrieve ours.Generally, I got the feeling there aren't quite enough staff or facilities for the number of rooms or guests. The breakfast and evening reception should possibly increase the hours, so that there's less of a crush at peak times.Overall - not a bad hotel at all, just not quite what I'd expected or hoped for. All the staff are working hard, and are pleasant enough - especially most of the breakfast staff, I thought.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Dirty room. The bathroom was left with someone's hair all over the shower walls and the bathroom floors. No room to enjoy the breakfast or evening reception. Way to many people staying at this hotel to fit into the tiny space they have for evening social and breakfast. There's much nicer hotels to stay at in Manhattan for the money in my opinion.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: If you like Embassy suites for the spaciousness prepare to be disappointed. Smallest room ever! For any Hilton property! Much less an Embassy Suites. I'm a Diamond member so I know my Hiltons. Breakfast area is too small. Had to wait 30 mins just to get access to the buffet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed November 30 over night. The Hotel is amazing. Such a great location. All the staff was so helpful. We were able to check our bags in so we could walk around before our room was ready. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. . Our room was ready somewhere around 2:30. We enjoyed their free social time. Which included light snacks and drinks. (Wine, beer, soft drinks and cocktails). Free breakfast in the morning which was more then just your typical hotel breakfast. It was wonderful. We are definitely returning to this hotel. By far the best hotel we have ever stayed in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First, I cannot say enough about the staff. Everyone we encountered was very happy and helpful. Kudos to the team! The rooms are smaller which is not a complaint because that is fairly common in NYC. However, we had no storage for close except for a TINY closet to hang a few things. Otherwise, no drawer space which meant we had to keep our suitcase out in the tiny space. The location is close to everything you would want to be around including two short blocks to the subway. If you are sensitive to noise be sure to ask for a room that is not street facing. Overall, we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Check in was not a welcome, staff seemed overwhelmed and scattered. Pull outs didn’t work, over an hour to address. No blankets or pillows for pullouts. TV didn’t work properly, kept freezing up. I had two rooms..same problems in both for our family. Elevators were slow and overcrowded, all guests were frustrated. Crammed breakfast area, food was good but no where to sit to enjoy it. We were all called after 10 pm by management on check in questions/errors. One of worst stays ever and I travel a lot! Will never return here and Hilton is not standing by their promise on making it right...1st time I’ve been so frustrated with Hilton after almost 8 years of loyalty to their brand and being a diamond member...this one has me shopping elsewhere!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great hotel for our family of 3. Small, like most hotels in NYC, but enough space for my husband and myself, and a pull out for our teenage son. Great location, staff was helpful and friendly. Provided us with free drinks to compensate for the $25 mandatory NYC fee. Only complaint was at checkout we were looking to store our luggage and they did not have enough staff on hand. Waited quite some time to have our bags put in the bar area which didn't feel all that safe. Other than that, I highly recommend this hotel and check prices -- we found a great one on hotels.com.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room could be in a capsule hotel. The staff made a minimal effort for an early checkin for us after 5 hours on the the road. The free included omelet was dry and thin. The hotel is notreally in Times Square but a short block away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Wonderful hotel close to Herald Square, Bryant Park, 5th Av.Lots to do as soon as you step foot out of hotel. Best to become a Hilion Honors member so you can partake of all the benefits. Lots to do at this location

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: While I expect rooms in NYC to be compact, the space in our suite was poorly designed. The room had a tiny closet with one small drawer. No room for 2 people in the city to hang their clothes or unpack their undies. I have been on cruise ships where the cabin was essentially the same size but had ample storage space.A big plus and thanks to the registration clerk who on check in gave us a room with a view of Herald Square from which we were able to watch the Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade. If you want a room with a similar view our room number was —07.A final note, due to large volume of checkouts or room was not made up until after 5pm making it hard to come back and rest or change before going out for the evening after a day of sightseeing & shopping

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We arrived on Tuesday and have enjoyed our stay. We have a room with a view. The Empire State Building and Macy's are right outside our window. The room is nice, perfect for a family. A king size bed and a double pull out sofa. Breakfast is included, which is great. There is also an evening event. His hotel is within walking distance to all the stores, Time Square and Bryant park. It is also quiet at night. There is no nightclub thank God. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of everything. The hotel staff have been professional and helpful. We will return next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Checked into the Embassy Suites Manhattan and everything was good until we could not get linens for my daughters sofa sleeper. We were tired from the drive but after calling and waiting for over 2 1/2 hours and 3 calls to the front desk we still had no no blankets. This is ridiculous and we have never had such Poor service being Hilton Diamond members for over 10 years

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had to go to NYC on a somewhat urgent basis for a series of meetings at a major hotel in Times Square. Unfortunately there were no rooms in the (massive) host hotel, so I had to find another facility. I saw "Embassy Suites Times Square," on the Hilton Site, so I registered there.When I arrived, I was at first struck with the fact that it is actually no where near Times Square - over a half a mile away. This eventually became completely inconvenient, and really represented nothing less than false advertising.Upon arriving, I learned that there is no valet parking offered, which was a first for me. So I had to unpack my bags, leave them in the lobby where I was told they would "be OK," and was given the wrong directions and wound up in the wrong garage. There was no "handout," telling you the address of the garage or more efficient directions, just verbal directions from a friendly desk person who unfortunately was not a New Yorker.When I arrived, I then learned there was a major problem with my booking. Apparently, I was booked to arrive the night before. Although this may have been a mistake by my staff, there was little of no attempt by management to assist me. I was initially told that it would be removed from the bill, but later was told that was not correct, that I would be billed for it, and that there was "nothing the staff could do." This was from a very nice desk person who had no authority to assist in any way. No one from management ever contacted me to discuss the situation with me or give me any further advice.So after I got to my room, I put the "Do Not Disturb," sign on for a half hour. As the result, I could not get my room serviced for the next two days. On both days, I had to go down to the front desk to ask that my room be serviced.In terms of the "free breakfast," yes it is offered, and one morning when I went early was able to enjoy. But as many other things about this hotel, it is poorly organized, such that from 8AM on it is too busy to actually be able to take advantage of this benefit.It is "Embarrasing," that such a facility by associated with the Hilton organization.There were other problems, but I cannot bother with some of them
user_name:
Frank B
New Hartford, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was Clean, comfortable, professional, complementary breakfast and evening cocktail reception "included" WOW Given the staff, location and for the price there is not a better hotel in New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect spot close to shopping and subway. The breakfast was the best and one of the reasons I booked this hotel. We got a great rate and I would return again. One recommendation is if you want to eat at your leisure you want to be there within the first hour. It can get extremely busy. Rooms are small but that is typical in New York so I wouldn’t think of the room as a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Located this hotel on hotels tonight app and so glad I did!!!! Hotel just opened almost 2 years ago so has many modern updates and amenities that many NYC hotels do not. We stayed for a Fri-Sat weekend getaway to sightsee and this was the perfect location. Hotel is on W 37th just off 6th Avenue so is right around the corner from 34th street, 42nd street/Times Square and close walk to the subways. Our check In was quick, Anthony at the attached A1 parkIng was friendly and helpful, the key operated elevators made us feel safe and our 8th floor room, although not a great view was wonderful!!! We had a king size bed, pull out couch with huge headboard/divider thing that had 2 tv's, a fridge, microwave and coffeemaker... although small the room was maximized for space and amenities and is unheard of in nyc in a room (if you want spacious rooms, don't stay in the city!) Hotel has a nightly reception with free snacks AND drinks, a free breakfast buffet with made to order omelet yes and eggs and a rooftop area that I'm sure is fab in the spring and summer. Customer Service: Manager on duty Craig, bartender Karen, concierge Dinu, and Anita and Vanessa at the front desk we're phenomenal ! The manager went above and beyond with a check in issue that was not the fault of the hotel, Karen really made us feel like old friends, I watched Dinu work hard and providing excellent customer service to every customer he came in contact with (although they don't tip?? What's up with that, please give him a raise!) and the front desk ladies were great! So glad I found this gem - they have a loyal customer!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel, upon check in, told me that there was a "new $25 per night tax" imposed by New York City on them per room as per some date in November that they had to pass onto guests. This is totally, unabashedly false. And it's really not nice to take advantage of out-of-towners like this.There is no tax from New York State, from New York City, from New York anywhere. It's one thing to have a fee, it's another thing to lie and call it a tax from the city to make it look like you're not charging a fee. It's dishonest and I reported it to the NY Division of Consumer Protection so hopefully it stops.Pros: nice hotel rooms, spacious with nice layout. Breakfast is free and pretty spectacular for a free breakfast. Cons: Elevators are a disaster, not enough capacity, guests who seemingly have never used elevators before, you often have to wait 5-7 mins for an elevator.
user_name:
estranger
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Well located near Time Square. Very clean hotel,very friendly and helpful staff. Very good amenities. Every request made were handled promptly. Looking forward to staying there again on our next visit

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am always weary of hotel properties in Manhattan that brand themselves as a specialized chain. Residence Inns or Homewoods not really having a traditional kitchen, etc. While this property didn't have a huge 10 story sprawling atrium, they did a great job delivering what I would expect from an Embassy Suites hotel.Centrally located near Times Square, very easy walk to the theater district, and multiple Subway lines.They unfortunately did not have a true "suite" to offer me upon my arrival, but my room on the 32nd floor was comfortable and had a beautiful view. Because it's Manhattan, the closet was small and stuck in the bathroom, and the only drawers to put away clothing were under the bed, but overall I tend to anticipate these type of modifications in Manhattan.I was not able to enjoy their breakfast secondary to my early morning departure from the hotel, but I did stop by their evening reception each night on the 4th floor. There was always a nice array of chips, dips, and a crudite. The bartenders were friendly, and poured a nice complimentary cocktail. Of note, you can choose to upgrade to some top shelf cocktails and wine during the reception. I found the complementary offerings quite satisfactory.Lobby was welcoming, and there was always a couple of containers with very fresh fruit waters, sometimes with cucumber sometimes with mixed berries, and once with fresh pineapple. A great welcome when walking home from the subway.The front desk staff was not the fastest and most efficient I've ever seen, but also far from the worst.I look forward to visiting this property again during my next trip to Manhattan.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It’s a place to come after a long day and lay down. I wouldn’t want to spend a lot of time in the small room as it’s extremely claustrophobic. No hot water for two days, but continued checking people in with no warning. The last day we tried to go down to the breakfast at 6, when it should have been started, but most of the hot items still weren’t out as we left at 6:30 to get to the airport.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: One of the best combinations of value, interesting space/designs, and great locations you can find. Very modern, this property has a restaurant, a bar, complementary breakfast (which is much better than most other standard hotel breakfasts), and a complementary happy hour. There is a super cool rooftop/ outdoor garden that would be wonderful to relax in. We did not use it because of cold weather, but it is very nicely designed. The staff is professional and friendly. Overall, this is a fantastic option for a short weekend getaway or a longer trip to the city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: In general it was a great lace to stay for New York. Staff was nice, room was beautiful, had a good view, butbthe last night of the stay there was no hot water. It was a known issue and the people staying at the hotel were not notified in any way. After a 16hr day of work and no way to take a hot shower not a good way to end the week. I got some points thrown my way... that’s it. I would stay here again but if something like that happened again I would push harder for for a better reaction!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Wife and I had a night out in the city and enjoyed our stay. Room was very clean. Interesting to find the rooms are not carpeted. Clothes closet is in the bathroom. Spacious modern shower was great. Breakfast area very crowded. Good value and would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was double charged for my 1 night stay. The checkout receptionist was incompetent and untrained. The phone goes unanswered when I try to call to correct this. The one time someone answered someone said hello and then hung up, more indications of the overwhelmed and poorly trained staff. No hot water in the room. Elevators were overwhelmed making entrance and exiting very difficult. Signs indicate it takes 39 to 45 minutes to get the “free” breakfast. So many choices in this area...avoid this one.
user_name:
MaureenG1159
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nov 15 there is no hot water again and the annoying part is that every time we ask they say “ we are expecting it in about an hour.” Do not come here. They did offer us a chance to be moved to another hotel as we were checking in but they also said they fully expected the water to be back on.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Came into town for a college visit. Checked in and noticed no hot water. Called down to front desk and was told it would be on soon. Next day, no hot water. Called down and they said they did not have an eta. Came back at 2 PM to take a shower, no hot water. It has been two days without a shower. Called desk and said I thought I was owed the room comped, was told since I went through a major online site to book the room, they were not sure what they could do. Really???? I called the site’s customer service number and they offered $100 which is totally inadequate for a hotel without a working shower for two days. I understand things happen, but they have to treat guests better than this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: They have no hot water and are not alerting anyone to it. Just keep checking people in and deal with it later. No customer service at all. No idea when or if this is going to get resolved. Just an alert.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We got to our room and Unpacked our belongings and about an hour later they called asking us to switch rooms as they said many of the sofabeds were broken and our room was one. I said I was leaving to go to dance events with my kids so we couldn’t move. When I came back they offered a discount for the night and said I could switch tomorrow since they are sold out of rooms. Next day I asked and they said a room still wasn’t available. I said my son had to sleep on their uncomfortable couch. They called me three times while I was busy with my kids asking I now come back to switch rooms but I had taken a subway to Long Island City and couldn’t and they were spending time trying to bargain a price and not switch rooms. I finally said my priority is my children and I don’t have time for this! When I returned around 6pm, they apologized and emanated to now give me less than $100 off the first night ($58 off a night) and O became upset. The manager said “Well those Europeans came and broke all our beds!” I ended up getting them to agree to $100 a night (so I thought). They said the next night I was required to switch rooms since now I know it is broken. Next day that bill comes and it is $58 a night off not $100 so I went to front desk very upset so they made the change. I stood with my two kids in lobby and they said sorry we don’t have a room available for you but u can leave luggage here and we will put it in your new room. We then went to eat their free breakfast and couldn’t because they had taken our keys and we couldn’t get in breakfast rooms. We then went to more dance events and when we came back, got our new room cards and arrived at the new room and our luggage was not there! I had to call and ask someone to please bring it up. Talk about the worst stay ever! I normally stay at the Comfort Inn where so far after a year it’s always been great (and we go there like once a month) and don’t care to try Embassy Suites ever again! And...I still haven’t gotten over the Europeans comment!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overnight in Manhattan - room was large and comfortable. Dining area/reception area is small, but adequate. Tom at the bar was very good - service excellent. Could not get the room heat to really go on, but room was warm enough and bed very comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Blocks from Macy's, Times Square, Grand Central. Extremely convenient. Rooms clean and well-appointed. There's a sense of suite even in smaller rooms with separation of sitting area and sleep space. Breakfast and evening reception included. Also very reasonable for this quality in NY.
user_name:
wwc345
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I really enjoy my experience and stay at the Embassy Suite I wouldn't change anything about the experience but it would be even better you would change your snack selection at the complimentary happy hour but overall everything was excellent

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in the good location and safe in the central NY city. They offers an excellent free breafast, staffs are very professional. Their Room is clean, my kids were enjoy the hotel very much. We would like to come back in the future

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: in the middle between EMpire State Building and Rockefeller Center and close to TImes Square. The room space in not big but the room is OK and we got a nice view on the Empire State Building! and as well the room of breakfast have small places and is always full of people, but the the food is very good!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Many trips to NYC so we know the hotel value proposition. Had good experience with Embassy Suites in other locations and decided to try this property. Biggest issue was the elevator service. There are only 3 elevators for a 39 floor hotel. The elevator cars are small and elevator traffic management system was clearly not capable of efficiently assigning cars. Wait time’s of 5-10 minutes we’re common. We were on the 25th floor and experience several times when fully loaded cars would stop on the way down requiring additional wait time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was at the one on 37th near Broadway. It’s a great location for midtown and close to subways and trains. It’s tall with 30+ floors but has a narrow profile. It only has 3 small elevators which caused long waits. The free breakfast is good but very popular. I ended up taking my food to the room because it was so crowded. I liked the room which had a nice view and wasn’t too small. It had a good number of power outlets. The bathroom was roomy with a nice size shower. This was ideal for midtown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Ladies trip with six of us celebrating a 50th birthday. Our flight arrival was pretty early in the morning, so we didn’t expect to get checked in right away, but the staff was very accommodating with holding our luggage and making sure we had connecting rooms once they were ready. Matter of fact, the staff was very helpful and friendly the entire stay, taking our pictures, opening up a private conference room for us to sit to eat the breakfast as well as providing great recommendations. As far as the hotel, it’s certainly not the biggest and seems tucked away a little, but was exactly what we needed. The breakfast buffet and cooked to order omelets were excellent, the evening reception provided tasty snacks and drinks and the rooms were plenty comfortable for 3 of us in each room. The area is a little more laid back then being right in the middle of Times Square, but still close enough to walk to it and many attractions. With that said, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend a stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room is so small; with 3rd bed open is impossible to walk around. I discourage more than 2 people to get there.Breakfast room (and access to )was so crowded ; I wonder how minimal safety requirements can satisfied

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Will recommend as a good hotel for Midtown events! Was easy to get to if using GPS. Had no problem without it though. Back entrance and one way streets can be tricky if you don’t know your first time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall I loved our stay, everyone was very polite and courteous. The parking situation was horrible, they could use some customer service training...I'll definitely stay again sometime in the near future

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The staff here is superior. The hotel can be busy at times and the people are unfailingly friendly and supportive to guests. The location is near the Theater District and other attractions. Our room was clean with good bedding and HVAC. WiFi worked well. There was a string area with a screen between the couch and the bed. A small fridge, microwave and coffee maker were available. There were two flat screen TVs with lots of channels. A few of the channels suffered from tiling and sound problems. Bathroom had a shower and was large enough for one person at a time. The breakfast offered has a buffet or guests can also order a freshly prepared omelet. Food was good. In the evenings (5:30-7:30pm) guests may attend a reception with drinks and food. These are popular daily events and can be very busy. Hospitality at this hotel is excellent and could be a model for all Hilton venues. We will go back. If you find this information to be helpful please click the link below to let us know.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Located midway between Times Square and Penn Station, the hotel is walking distance from relevant sights and subways. By NYC standards, the room is spacious and comfortable. The made-to-order breakfast is delicious, with warm and cold options, and the evening reception includes good wine and provides the opportunity for interesting conversation. I would have given five stars instead of four if some of the reception staff were less abrupt in the way they speak to patrons; I wonder if it's a matter of poor training.
user_name:
MIKKAVON
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: When things are not open for the season like the restaurant and outdoor seating area then they should update their website to indicate such. The breakfast area for the size is inadequate to handle the crowd. The breakfast was otherwise fine. Before social hour ended they placed reserved seating signs on tables when vacated for some group or meeting. The doorman and the front desk personnel some of the best in our years of going to Embassy Suites around America.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I need it a room for just a couple hours long layover to Amsterdam from NYC. We found this gem by mistake and I couldn't be happier. Rooms are great for NYC average plus BREAKFAST was bomb.Staff is also A+ and location is perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: location is only a few blocks from Times Square. Rockerfeller Plaza within walking distance. Hotel very clean and everyone friendly and professional. Happy hour nice with wine/beer/mixed drinks, snacks okay, some nights better than others

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. Walking distance to Times Square and all theaters. You can’t go wrong at this location. Modern rooms recently updated. Nice bed and bedding. Fantastic complimentary breakfast. Excellent staff

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This 300 room plus 39 story Embassy is located near the corner of 37th Street and 6th Avenue. The walk is doable to this hotel both from Grand Central and Penn Station. We prefer Penn Station, but a taxi will get you there in no time. The front desk is friendly. There is no problem if you need to store your gear before or after your hotel stay. I did inquire about having a “fan,” as I like the noise and circulation. This hotel does not carry fans. The AC system is cold enough to your liking on those hot days in NYC. The room is smaller than your normal Embassy Suites due to location. The comfort you expect is quite evident with comfortable beds and a modern bathroom. There is even a small refrigerator. We stayed at this Embassy twice over ten weeks. Both times we selected a room “with a view.” Our first experience we were on the 38th floor with commanding views of the Empire State building, World Trade Tower in the distance and you could see the largest store in the world—Macy’s—down below. It was quite an experience to view a storm coming over NYC. We felt totally safe.Our second experience was not so thrilling. We were placed on the 24th floor facing a building. One of the highlights of all Embassy’s is the breakfast. Jorge cooks one superb omelet and even better “eggs over easy.” An Ecuadorian, he is indeed friendly. I am so glad that the computer machine on the wall was not working on our second visit. You could actually converse with Jorge. Ordering by the grill is much better than the computer on the wall. Breakfast has all your favorite meats—bacon and sausage—and different types of cereals and yogurts. It did not have, though, hard boiled eggs or even poached eggs—my wife’s favorite source of protein. I brought this fact up to the manager who called the kitchen. She learned that they do not cook these styles of eggs. The Managers “Happy Hour” is well attended. For a solid two hours, beer, wine and many cocktail drinks are on the house. You may not get a seat if you get there too late! If you are not so lucky, the ice-machine may be on another floor. This can be a hassle. The elevators for the most part, are quick. You may have to wait longer for one of the four elevators in the morning. Overall, we were pleased. The hotel is centrally located to many attractions and to metro stops. You can get a comfortable night’s sleep. The only major complaint is they don’t have my wife style of egg’s—which is commonly carried In Hampton’s and many European style hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed there for four nights last week attending a business workshop. There were myself and three colleagues. Service is fantastic, as is the check in and check out process. If I can fault anything it is the quality of the 'food' at the complimentary Happy Hour, and the low strength beer they provide. I stayed 10 minutes on my first evening there but didn't go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very tiny rooms - not really a suite. We could not even walk around the bed without turning sideways. When the sofa bed is pulled out, there is no room at all. Breakfast area is very crowded - no room to sit. Too overpriced for what you are getting except that it is in a good location. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: While rooms are a little small and prices are not cheap (but this is New York City!), it was very nice to have a complimentary breakfast which included made-to-order omelets & other fresh food. Nice bar with an outside movie theatre (April-October) - not free. Hotel is very clean & staff very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great midtown Manhattan location, and close to Penn Station. Really good complimentary breakfast. Bartender made some excellent drinks at the small ground floor bar and eating area. Only ding would be the breakfast area gets really crowded by mid morning, and could use more tables.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The suites are even more cramped than some regular doubles. The room was very narrow and if you had a 3rd person and pulled the couch out, it was about half the size of most double rooms of comparable hotels. The staff was great and the breakfast very good except the coffee, which was truly horrible. This is kind of important to have at least good coffee for guests in the am.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location and rooms are good for two people. However, if you have 3 people in a studio it will be tight quarters because the NYC rooms are limited in space. Complimentary breakfast is excellent and evening reception is pleasant with a decent drink selection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was clean and staff was for the most part exceptional. Beware there are not too many places to eat nearby especially late night on a Sunday. The evening reception food consisted of tortilla chips, guacamole, crackers and cheese. They did have 3 drinks available plus wine and I think beer. Room was oddly setup with no drawers apparent and closet located in the bathroom.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It was very good to stay there, central, clean, quiet, good breakfast, but the only thing missing to get excellent rate from my side would be more smiling people at the front desk. Still an effort and it will be perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: room was very clean, buffet very nice, check in was a nightmare....staff was on a power trip.....not nice at all....they need a crash course in smiling, lack people skills, location was great. especially if looking for formal or bridal wear. close to subway. I would have given 5 stars except for teh terrible check in staff

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed for the first time at the Embassy Suites mid town in NY. The people working the counter are lazy, not willing to help and not interested in your stay. Please stay at another Hilton in Manhattan as there are many wonderful options.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We primary stayed at the hotel for the location, however if I was again going to the theatre in NYC I would definitely stay here again. Suite was beautiful and new. Service was excellent and the made to order breakfast was delicious.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Service was not great at check-in, especially for a diamond member but fortunately we didn't spend much time in the hotel. We got to breakfast but they didn't have hot options until an hour after they opened. Location is great, only a 10 min walk to Times Square and close to Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location in Manhattan. Fabulous breakfast. Helpful staff. Easy access to lots of attractions, including car rental and Manhattan Fencing School. Only complaint is water pressure is a little low, but otherwise a great place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: At over $500 you’d expect consistency in service and a reservation and check in system that works. We have 2 reservations because we used travel points for one booking and cash for the second. Despite multiple contacts via email and telephone conversations with Hilton to ensure our reservations were linked and we still had to check-in a second time because they deactivated our room card. Then they couldn’t find our reservation and took even more time to fix it. The staff were very helpful but everything that the Hilton’s reservation operator told us was wrong and misrepresented what we would have to do to ensure there was no disruption in our stay. Every day there is something that housekeeping forgets to give us. Day one- no coffee and no sweetener. Day 2- no hair conditioner, bar soap, and Kleenex. We are here for two more days and hoping that they can get things right. Unfortunately we’re staying at another Hilton later on this month in New York which we can’t change! Fingers crossed they are better. We have a future bookings in Florida in December which we will be cancelling. We will not consider a Hilton for a long time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Check in was a breeze! Staff was super helpful and worked around our schedule of shows on check in day, even sending us notification when our room was ready. Our bags were securely stowed even though we hadn't checked in yet. Tim at the front desk was especially awesome throughout our stay. We are Hilton Silver members but were treated like diamond. Room was perfectly appointed, clean and had a spectacular view. The free made to order breakfast was an added perk and one that we had not expected. Free evening reception with drinks and snacks also made our stay all the better. Georie at the bar made evening reception great! He worked magic on keeping the line at a manageable level but not once made us feel rushed. I have worked in all level of food service and hospitality management and Georgie is a prime example of what the future management in this hotel should look like, pure professionalism. We could not have been happier with our stay in any way. Thanks for making us feel so welcome!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I have been a Hilton diamond member for more than 10 years. I arrived to the hotel at 7 and was told that check in is at 4 pm and they didnt have any clean rooms but that housekeeping gets in at 8 am and as soon as they got in they would work on my room to get me checked in as quickly as possible. We left our phone number for them to call. We went to breakfast and came back and our room at 11 am was still not available. It's now 2 pm, no phone call, no email no I'm so sorry your room isn't available yet. The gentleman in the morning was great but then 2 ladies took over that were terrible.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed on the 35th floor and the Empire State Building was right there outside of our window. I really liked that you could open the window a little bit to listen to the sounds of the city. I wouldn't recommend the king bed room with a view unless you are going solo. I really wish I had gotten the king studio because we were constantly bumping in to each other. The room itself was nice and modern and the bed was comfortable (and that is coming from someone who almost never finds hotel beds to be comfortable). The breakfast room was a bit crowded but it was good with a decent selection.The location was okay. Very close to Times Square if that's your thing. It is directly across the street from a strip club. It didn't bother us, but might bother someone else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a grreat place to stay in NY.Nice room, affordable price, great central location and the complimentary breakfast is a real treat in Manhattan. Close to all the tourist mambo jambo, easy public transport nearby, clean and very helpful staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: 10 out of 10 ... From the manager Craig , who is always on site , giving a helping hand , to the cleanliness of the hotel , the rooms and the site in general ..the rooms are spacious , bathrooms spotless and updated .. The bed was beyond comfortable and the pillows were amazing ... Three separate areas to eat or drink , the outdoor-lawn chair movie theater very Uniquie.. .All the staff is friendly and the Am breakfast , include was off the charts delicious ...I highly recommend this hotel , pricing is fair , service spot on and the hotel is close to everything unique about NYC ..
