hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Our room was small but so well thought out. Very cool design. Both the Breakfast and the cocktails were substantial. In our many trips to NYC, we had never stayed in this part of town. We found it a fun location with easy walks to Times Sq. Etc. Subway stations were also close. Thoroughly enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Traveled solo so New York room size was no problem. I think it would work very well for a couple. Front desk was always helpful. The free breakfast and manager's reception (free drinks) both had plenty of time. The room was modern and clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had a confirmed reservation (a month in advance), but at checkin time they said they had no room for me because of "overbooking". As a result I was stuck in New York in the middle of the night with nowhere to go.They didn't even offer me any kind of voucher or recompensation for the inconvenience. Just directed me to another Hilton half a mile away. Then the other Hilton charged me a $200 higher rate for the night.Altogether a terrible experience. I'll be going with Marriott from now on.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is located close to 6th Avenue. It's about a block from Herald Square, 5 minute walk to Bryant Park and a 10-15 minute walk to Grand Central. It's clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good. The rooms are very small. My husband, son and I were on top of each other for 4 days. All I heard was complaints from my family. Once the pull out couch is unfolded, there is no place to walk or sit except on the beds. We could not even invite our older son who is going to college in the city to come up to our room to visit. I will not be staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is well located.Our room was small but very clean.The staff here are courteous and helpful.Complimentary breakfast is great!Our room had a view of the Empire State building.Walking distance to a lot of shops, restaurants, and important sightseeing places in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Enjoyed our trip to New York and the location of the Hotel.Greatly recommend this location and the Hilton brands.Housekeeping went above and beyond to assist any needs.Heist Restaurant is outstanding

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great customer experience! Great location, safe neighborhood and walking distance to parks, including Central Park, Time Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza and garment district. The staff at hotel are professional, helpful and friendly!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My family’s stay at this hotel was uneventful until checkout. I got my car from the garage and parked it in front of the hotel on the loading area. I made several trips from the 12th floor and back bringing my family’s luggage to the car, helping my wife’s grandmother (she has disability and needs help walking), and bringing down my two babies (23mo and 4mo). The manager decided that It was too long and called NYPD Lansing me a $115 parking ticket. I came to the front desk to report the ticket and I was informed the hotel had nothing to do with it. Another guest who overheard the conversation about my car and the decision to call the police told me about it. Not only did the manger called the police to get me fined, but he also lied about it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Manhattan Times Square, Friday 9/13 - Sunday 9/15/2019 and found the hotel to be more than adequate for our needs. The party include my wife and her brother and the room configuration made the stay quite enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Came for our anniversary (37 years!). Location was right in the middle of everything we wanted to do from the Broadway shows to the Today Show and just a couple of blocks from the Empire State building. Free breakfast and reception took the sting out of New York's high prices. Walked to most things saving some money while getting a little exercise. Hotel and staff were great. This was a great find living up to the Embassy Suites name. Will come again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location in walking distance to all the attractions. Nice hotel and good breakfast. The private terrace was amazing. Would stay here again and again!!! The service was good, rooms clean and very comfortable. You can walk to all the sites and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel between Penn Station and Times Square was perfect for our purposes during this trip. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the well designed room, though not large, was larger than many in NY. The quality of breakfast was excellent, and space used for breakfast and evening reception was adequate. The staff here were very friendly as well. The rooftop bar on the 3rd floor was also a pleasant experience. All in all a very nice stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed to visit friends in the city & I could not have been happier with the excellent front desk staff! They were all friendly and helpful despite how busy this hotel was- I want to especially shout out to Dahiana & Anita for always helping & chatting with me & never rushing me- Always with a great big smile on their faces. Often times in other properties, check-in is not always met with very sociable staff!Thanks y'all & can't wait to return to your fabulous hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast was very good and I especially liked how you could order eggs/omelettes on a screen and come back for them.The beds were comfy. However the rooms were small (to be expected in NYC) but they should not be advertised as suites, there is absolutely no privacy from one side of the room to the other. Most of the front desk staff were friendly, not all of them. Location was good... about 10 mins out of the centre of times square.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location was unbeatable, and the accommodations exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel staff were extraordinarily responsive to my requests for assistance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As others have mentioned, as an downtown NYC hotel, the rooms are smaller than an average Embassy Suites. I get that. But to have the front desk trick you into an even smaller room, is severely disappointing to this Diamond. Some staff are less than customer service oriented. Maid service not occurring until 5pm, when you are trying to get cleaned up for evening plans...The pluses...good location. Standard breakfast and Manager's Reception, although the room and facilities are small and crowded. Rooms seem very new or recently modernized. More employees in breakfast/reception area than I have seen in other ES operations, doing a really great job keeping up with the flow. However, bartenders were a bit surly, and weren't fully ready to start serving when the reception started.I doubt we will stay here in the future. There are better Hilton family members in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was a lovely hotel. Very comfortable with great location. Our room looked out at the Empire State Building. Wonderful happy hour and breakfast buffet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This embassy was located in the fashion district, close to Empire State Building, Bryant park and more. Macy’s is within walking distance. This is not your typical suite. It is one room separated by a 3/4 wall with bed on one side and couch on the other. The couch is supposedly a pull out though I can’t see how there was enough room ( it probably was) . I shared the room with two other people. They took the King size bed and I just slept on the couch without pulling it out. It was very comfortable. The hotel had a free buffet which was very good. The staff was nice . I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location close to shopping as well as Pen Station. The room was spacious and a very comfortable bed! Great breakfast and evening reception with drinks and snacks. Will stay again if we go back to NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Second time at this hotel. Not a typical Emb S. Small room with pullout bed divided by a fabric wall which is part of the pullout. OK for 2 adults and young child.Good location between 5th and 6th on 37th a few yards to 6th ave.Cocktail hour on 4th floor is free with decent selection-two bartenders when we were there. Seating for the CH and breakfast is very limited.Breakfast is also free and made to order ( buffet also available with good selection) if you can figure out the on the wall I - pad type ordering system. Took me some time to get it. When I asked the cook, which is next to the ordering system, whether he has egg whites he kept saying press enter-this went on a couple of times. Many others were having trouble which held up the line and added to the situation. On our last day-a Sunday -a very helpful; young lady stood by the ordering system and helped . Be aware that the seating is very - very limited mostly for breakfast. You may end up with trey in hand and no place to sit. Send the kids to hold a table!Tip: when booking ask for a floor no higher than the 6th so you can take the stairs to breakfast and the CH. 3 elevators which are very slow and at peak times packed. You may be surprised on how long you will wait if on a mid to high floor.All in all,a decent place considering that most hotels offer less.Hotel front staff, maid staff were always acomodating. Not sure about the made to order cook-he needs bedside manner training!Remember this is NYC and space is limited.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My friends and I stayed at this hotel in 2018 as we were attending the US Open and we had a great experience. However, this stay got off to a bad start from the beginning. When we checked in, the front desk clerk said they were overbooked and we couldn't have a suite (which is the entire reason we wanted to stay there). We agreed to just have a King bed instead (really no choice). The clerk said we could switch after the first night to a suite, but we were going to be gone the entire day so when would we even have been able to switch? It was just too much hassle. The next day when we came back around 7:30pm, our door was propped open (I assume by housekeeping). We walked in and luckily nothing had been stolen, but of course I made a complaint to the front desk about it and told them to let the manager know. I didn't receive any other communication from them during our stay. The other reason we stayed there was because of the free breakfast, but each day we tried to go it was a literal madhouse; you could barely squeeze by and get your food. It was like the entire city of New York was trying to get breakfast for two hours. We gave up after the first day and never went back. We won't stay here again; the prices were higher than comparable other Hiltons in the area, and attempting to get a free breakfast as part of the deal just wasn't worth the higher price. And as I stated, you cannot count on getting a suite at Embassy Suites! Oh, the only good customer service we received were the bartenders- they were great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I took my son and brother up there for a Yankees game and it was nice. The location was great not too far from the subway or anything else. 3 blocks from time square. The service was ok just wish they had computer written directions to the subway and other areas. Hand signalling is not the best was of directions. breakfast was crowded but the did there best at helping everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Like Hilton Hotels and am a Honor Member, but will choose a different hotel next time. We were on the 28 floor and had a nice view of The Empire State Building & Macy,s! We were, also situated right in the garment district. Close to some great bargains. The hotel offered a morning breakfast. The rooms to sit for the breakfast were very cramped. The room itself had a queen bed with an oversized large useless chair, a desk and small bathroom. For what we paid per night, I felt the room was snug. The hotel staff were very welcoming as was the morning breakfast staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We'll located hotel with a few extras that make a difference. The free breakfast is outstanding with made-to-order omlettes, a buffet, and so many other items. There hotel also has a cool outdoor movie theatre which I've never seen before. Check it out!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Chose this hotel because of the location at Herald Square, where we have stayed at another hotel earlier. Close to Penn Station where you can take the train to/from Newark Airport. Also close to the subway station, about five minute walk, and five-ten minute walk to Times Square. There are some good restaurants in the area, and also short walk to Macys. The hotel is clean. The room was a bit small, but was OK for staying five nights. There is a small frigde plus a microwave in the room. Bathroom was clean, but the pressure in the shower could be better. We also had some problems with the toilet. It wouldn't flush when we arrived late at night, and told the reception in the morning. Still wasn't fixed when we came back in the afternoon. On the positive site, they fixed in fast when we told them the second time. Nice people at the reception, and very friendly.The first morning at the hotel, a sunday, the breakfast area was very crowded. We even had so stand and wait for a table. The room is very small, and way too crowded for a breakfast area. They did not have a gluten free area, and there was noe GF bread (ps. I did not ask for it either - so they might have it in the kitchen), and the food was not marked for allergies. They have a omelet station which was really nice.The elevators was very slow, especially around breakfast times. This was very disappointing, using so much time just standing and waiting. The doors to the rooms also make a lot of noise, so this woke us up a couple of times when the neighbours left/arrived at their room. Would problably try a new hotel next time, even though this was OK.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We like Embassy Hotels, so we chose this one because of location. It did not disappoint. The reviews showed long waits for the elevators, but we never encountered long waits. The breakfast area can get crowded, but in the elevator there is a notice of busiest times. Avoid the busiest times and it is not bad at all. Normal hotel crowds. The breakfast is very good and they had choices. Made to order or buffet. Always very good fruit. The room is not your typical Embassy Suite, but a New York hotel room, but was very adequate. The couch is a high back divider. The room was very clean and surprisingly very quiet. No hall or street noise. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again. They also have an evening reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stay at various hotels in NYC but this was the first hotel where we received great service and a smile from every staff member we encountered starting with Nick and Anaya at the front desk.Guests are greeted at breakfast and evening reception with a warm welcome. Despite how busy both times were, the staff worked hard to replenish food and clear tables while maintaining a cheerful disposition. A special shout-out goes to Freddy the bartender for his upbeat and friendly attitude! We looked forward to starting our evening with him (and the complimentary beverages were an added bonus!)Cheers to all!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We are Hilton loyal and usually stay further uptown, but we tried this location for a change. The reception staff were all very nice. The elevators were always crowded and, and you had to wait forever for them. The rooms were fine, but they were a little cramped. The table was broken in our room, and there was barely enough room to open both of our suitcases. Free breakfast was ok, but it was very poorly designed in there for people to move about without running into each other. They had trouble keeping the food stocked in the chafing dishes. We enjoyed the location for a change.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I read the other reviews and had none of these issues! The hotel location is amazing, right next to subway... 7 min walk.. I never had to wait a long period of time for an elevator... the happy hour was great... the room was small but it’s NY!! Who cares how big the room is, I am not there to hang out in a room...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were warmly greeted, by the front desk, upon arrival at The Embassy Suites, in Manhattan. Our room was a corner location, on the 38th floor with a great close up view, of the Empire State Building and in the distance, the 1 WTC (World Trade Center Building). They also offer a free breakfast and an evening cocktail reception, The hotel is conveniently located a few short blocks from the theater district and Restaurant row. We will definitely be returning for, a future stay.
user_name:
Robert E
East Setauket, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: In the garment district, and only 3 blocks away from Herald Square (short blocks at that), this is an excellent location to both Herald Square as well as Bryant Park (4-5 blocks) and Times Square (roughly 5 to 6 short blocks). The hotel has been recently renovated- grays and purples in the interior, which are beautifully done. The rooms are nice, with microwave, mini-fridge, desk, updated bathrooms. We stayed in a "studio suite", which was a bit small/tight, but was fine for three people. The sofa in the "living room" was a nice-sized pull-out sofa. The only complaint was the comforter on the bed. The material on the back was really slick which made the covers slide onto the floor 5 minutes after getting into the bed. Very annoying, but otherwise, it was a nice room. You couldn't hear outside noise or neighboring rooms at all- 37th street is not that loud in the evening, but it's at the corner of 6th street which is really busy. Our room was very quiet. The front desk staff were nice and they held our bags when we arrived a few hours before check-in so we could explore the area w/o baggage. As with any Embassy Suites, full breakfast was available and a nightly reception with snacks at 5:30. The breakfast area gets REALLY CROWDED, so go early - like 7am. Any later than that, and it's just so crowded. We'd stay here again when travelling to NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: overall hotel was ok, but shouldn’t be an Embassy Suites. Room we had was very small, ceilings appeared low. Bed was very lumpy. Room was exceptionally warm. Called for maintenance at around 9p to check air conditioning but was told no one from maintenance was there. Not enough elevators to service that large of a building. Breakfast staff very helpful, friendly, hardworking and was replenishing food quickly. Omlet station had a computer touch screen to order from which made it less crazy as the breakfast area is small. Did the online check in and arrived at 4p but our requested room was not ready. Opted for what they had available. Disappointing as the view was that of a warehouse window. So that, along with the small, low ceiling room made it very claustrophobic. I love the Hilton brand but I don’t know if I would stay here again especially for the price.
user_name:
Bullmastiffmom2max
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband and I spent 2 nights here. We went to a Yankees Game and a Broadway Show. Complimentary breakfast was good, all the basics available but a bit too crowded to try the made to order food. They also had a complimentary happy hour with snacks and we tried that one night. We each had a beer along with veggies, dip and crackers. We had the king suite. The bed was very comfortable. I asked for foam pillows the second night and they happily provided them. The room and bathroom were both clean. The bathroom was small, but the shower was large and had good water pressure. The bed area is very narrow on the window side so if you require width, this room would not be for you. Overall, the stay was a positive one and a good value for the money spent. The staff was pleasant and I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I’m beyond disgusted with my experience with the Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square! The bathroom had hair in the sink and short black curly hair in the shower, followed by hair in the King sized bed. The pillow had some sort of Chocolate on it or something brown and grotesque looking but,Wait for it, they flipped the pillow over so that I wouldn’t see it! It gets worse. My child pulled out the pull out the sofa bed to finally go to bed after a busy day, only to find it soaked with urine! It’s still wet as I write this review. There was a flat sheet on top of the mattress! So, someone serviced the room and folded a flat sheet and laid it on the pull out bed.My husband and I are Hilton Honors rewards members and went downstairs after discovering that no one would answer the phone at the front desk. Did I mention that I had to call from the cell phone because the room phone only works on speaker phone and no one would answer the phone. Well, Tim, at the front desk said that he would help with temporary fix and changed my room. The new room was stifling hot and was roughly half the size as the original room. The hotel is booked and doesn’t have any available rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: While the hotel was clean the entire setup does not work. We were constantly waiting for elevators and the complimentary breakfast was a disaster. They do not provide enough seating for the amount of people coming down. Even though we followed their recommendation going down during light traffic time, there still was no place to sit. Staying here was more like work than relaxing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I try to stay at an Embassy Suites hotel whenever I travel. We loved this place! It is the perfect location (37th between 5th and 6th). It is a NYC sized Embassy Suites...meaning, the rooms are smaller than what you’d normally expect from any other Embassy Suites, but are you really going to NYC to stay in your room?? Lol! The amenities are PHENOMENAL! The breakfast is top notch and the managers reception is great! My advice for both is to fill up your plates and head down one floor to the rooftop patio that also serves as an outdoor movie theatre at night! The breakfast room can get crowded at peak times, but the deck has lots of tables (with board games in the evening). The staff went out of their way to provide excellent service. We asked a young bus boy how to get to the stairwell from the breakfast room and he took the time to physically take us there himself instead of just telling us! The front desk staff provided us with a room on a higher floor when we asked at check in. Definitely the BEST customer service I have ever received at a hotel. We usually try different hotels every time we come to NYC, but our next trip will be back to this hotel for sure!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice Hotel, great location. Very close to the ESB, Bryant Park, Times Square, Madison Square Park, Penn Station, Grand Central Station, and the D Train (Yankee Stadium).Breakfast was good, great staff, crowded. But, free made to order breakfast should be expected to be busy. We never waited more than 5 minutes to sit down.Rooms were clean, shower was clean, views were great!Rode the D Train to Yankee Stadium to watch the Yankees sweep the Red Socks. :)Would gladly stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel mistakenly charged extra nights from my credit card and never refund me. They never pick up the phone for claims and never calls me back even I left the tons of messages to request the money back.Also breakfast was chaos. No place to sit and dished are messy and food were awful quality.Never recommends to stay there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Location was okay. Lumpy beds. Good service. Great front desk and breakfast. Rooms were not comfortable. Very small. Bed was smaller. Needs more drawers. Closets were small for a room like this. Handicap room didn’t have a bar I’m the bathroom to grab

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The property location was ideal. I really appreciated the friendliness of the staff, from the restaurant and bar staff to the front desk.The rooms were clean and nice. The breakfast and manager's reception were nice and enjoyed outside. My only complaint was that I reserved was promised connecting rooms and these were not available. I was very disappointed my family could not be together.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location was excellent for getting around Manhattan. Wasn’t impressed with the breakfast or happy hour snacks, but if you are into free drinks for a couple of hours you might not care about the popcorn and jelly beans that are put out as a snack! Very nice and helpful staff. Rooms are tiny. Bathroom door only clears the toilet by 1cm. Crazy small.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We are so glad we booked this hotel in NYC! From the moment we arrived the service was outstanding. The breakfast was incredible and much better than all included breakfasts we’ve had at hotels around Europe - the made to order omelettes were great! The rooms were also spacious and comfortable. The evening reception was great. We will definitely stay again and recommend to all our friends. Great location too, so easy to get everywhere!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a nice and quiet room on the 28th floor with an excellent view of the city. It was so nice to wake up every morning to the beautiful view. It was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was outstanding with many choices and freshly prepared eggs and omelets by the chef. The first day was very crowded, but by adjusting the time we went to breakfast that was solved. All of the personnel were friendly and accommodating. We really liked the location in mid-town Manhattan. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband and I visited NYC to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Our stay at the Embassy started out a little rough with trying to understand if the parking garage was for Embassy guests. There was no sign. I got out the car and asked the attendant (only one person) who confirmed. Once inside, we bypassed the front desk (had already checked in via Hilton Honors app) and got on the elevator which required a room key (the digital key was not working via the app). We rode up and down until finally going back down to the desk and got real keys. We got to our room fine and discovered a slow sink drain and some stains on the pull out sofa. We called the front desk to notify them about the drain and they fixed it while we were out. I submitted the complaint about the pullout sofa via the Hilton Honors app and corresponded via email with customer service representatives, but didn’t get too far, so I asked the front desk to have the cushion replaced while we were out, which was done when we returned. The room is nice, small (but hey...it’s Manhattan), the breakfast was good (crowded) and the evening reception was SUPER crowded our first night. We decided not to attend the reception the second night due to the crowd. Overall, the hotel is nice. The front desk staff are nice. We were able to walk (LOTS of walking) to sightseeing attractions and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The good:- front desk was helpful and accommodating- gave us a slightly early check-in- room was very clean- comfy beds- ok size room with King and convertible sofa. Note - this is not the size of most Embassy suites outside of cities- reception with snacks, beverages, wine & beer- full breakfast was great. I like the added electronic ordering for custom made eggs and pancakes.The bad:- we didn't experience any

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My family and I were there for the weekend and again we could not choose a best location. We drove from Boston and as we got to the street the parking facilities were right there, two steps away from the entrance of the hotel. we arrived around 10 PM and check-in was perfect, very professional staff. They immediately welcome us, realized that we were tired and offered water or any beverage that we liked. The rooms were very spacious and clean. Breakfast was included in our rate, and my family just loved every option at their club lounge. Also the evening appetizers and drinks we great. All their team members that we had an encounter greeted us with an smile, my wife was amazed by the facilities and the personal service we received. Great job. We'll definitely plan another trip and the Embassy suites will be our first choice of destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The room was nice and clean, the breakfast have an omelette section that is a favorable point and they hosted an evening reception with complimentary drinks, the bartenders are super friendly. Front desk team are great but don’t follow the Hilton standards at check in time and the bellman have to be more friendly. Great location. I recommend this hotel but they have to improve the Hilton standards.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Dirty, overbooked, inexperienced staff. Chaotic. Waited over two hours to check in and were all put in different floors. It was my mom's 90th bday celebration and nothing was special with this place. Was redirected to park elsewhere due to parking garage capacity, new garage did not have an agreement with the hotel, like I was told, so they did not take validated parking stub, paid full price for overnight parking. The hotel promised courtesy points for problems and refund for parking fees, NEVR received any of that. Breakfast and reception area, dirty and floor extremely sticky my mom almost fell because her feet got stuck. Food was ok, staff at breakfast were very nice and accommodating, front desk staff inexperienced wanted to get rid of us. will not stay here again and will not recommend to family or friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Surprising kind of communal breakfast crowded good fresh food and cosy and informal good room but no hotel slippers i missed that, view out of the window not pleasant but acceptable in general yes i enjoyed my stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Spent 10-days traveling throughout New York and this was by far the most disappointing experience. Here's the short version, save yourself and don't stay here. If you need to know why I would say that, you can read this long post.Hotel staff checked us in early but didn't have rooms ready. They told me that they would call me when it was ready, but they never called.Arrived back at hotel after a day on the town and ready to clean up for dinner. Luckily, I was given our keys and told our two rooms were all ready. Then we were introduced to the elevator situation at this hotel.The hotel has three very small elevators and about 40 floors. The elevator fills up very quickly and then stops at almost every floor because people are stuck and can't get on the elevator. Our first trip up the elevator took 15 minutes, literally. By the end of our trip, we would jump on the elevator going the wrong direction and ride it up 10 more floors, with multiple stops, then ride it back down just to make sure we got in the elevator. It got to be so consistently miserable that we were counting how many stops we made on the elevator, only to have the car completely full and another 6-8 people waiting to get on while they were stranded on their upper floors. One ride we counted 10 floors where we stopped to stranded guests, and our elevator was already full. All of the other guests were frustrated and everyone agreed this was the worst elevator experience we have had. We had a lot of time together crammed in the elevator to compare notes. If you're claustrophobic or you don't want to take 10-15 minutes for simple elevator rides, you can't stay at this hotel.Unfortunately, things got worse for us. After our first 15 minute elevator experience, we got to our room and it was not the room we reserved. We specifically reserved a patio room. The front desk clerk confirmed our patio room when I checked in and talked with me about how they only have that option on one floor. Somehow, they gave me a regular room knowing that it wasn't what I reserved and confirmed on check in. They explained the patio room wasn't ready yet, so they just gave me a standard room. Strange part was, they didn't tell me that and just shipped me upstairs in the long elevator ride there and back and assumed I wouldn't notice I guess? We then learned that room #2 had a broken sofa sleeper. We needed to use it, so we had called for assistance. The maintenance person came to the room and complained that they knew it was broken and it should have been fixed. He told us they would work on it. So we stored all of our bags in the one room we had with the broken sofa and went out for the night.When we returned, we got our keys to the new room with a patio. It was a very nice balcony, but be aware, these rooms are really, really small. We have stayed at countless Embassy Suites, and these are by far the smallest rooms we have experienced. This is not a two room suite, and actually I'm not sure how they even refer to these as suites. I'm quite surprised that Embassy Suites would allow this hotel to be branded as an Embassy, But the balcony was very nice! Our only issue with this room was the air condition did not work properly. We asked for a small fan or something from the front desk and they were not available. NYC in July without proper air conditioning is not good.Back to room two. When returning to the hotel, we noticed the sofa sleeper was still broken, meaning it would not fold out in any way. We went to the desk. The clerk stated the maintenance person said it wasn't broken, although the one who came to the room immediately saw it and knew it was broken. I asked to meet the maintenance person in the room, she said he was on the way and would meet me there; he never showed up. I called and was pretty angry at that point. They then stated we would need to move rooms, which we did. We had been at this hotel less than four hours and already had to move both rooms.The next day we battled exceedingly long lines and elevator traffic for breakfast, even though we went early to avoid the crowds. They have hundreds of people staying here and the smallest breakfast facility I have ever seen at an Embassy Suites. Once again, how is this an Embassy Suites?By day two, we were told there was a water leak in room two and we would need to move again. This is the third room change in two days. So more packing up and battling the nightmare elevators. As a side note, it was pretty obvious from the first day that the shower doors have a flaw in them and a lot of water leaks out onto the bathroom floor. Bathrooms looked really nice, but they have major water issues.In the end, I can tell you that the staff in this hotel are really, really nice people. I would say this about the front desk staff and the food staff. They work in awful conditions with travelers crammed into situations they cannot manage. Whoever runs this hotel needs to come stay in it for a week and reassess their business model.This is the longest review I have ever written, or hope to ever write. I only wise I had done more research before booking this property for our stay. Thanks for listening!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very nice updated hotel in the midtown area. The room was not a typical Suite, but a standard hotel room, on the small side. Bathroom was modern and clean. Fitness Center was very nice, quality equipment and clean. Easy walking distance to Times Square, theater district, Joes Pizza, Macys, and subway station. I would consider staying here again, though I would search for a little more spacious accommodation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Had a visit in July during the heat wave. The hotel is in a good location. The breakfast was expected quality. The rooms are small just enough for maybe 3 people. There's tons of restaurants nearby and Time Square is just a couple of blocks away

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I have definitely stayed at worst hotels far worse than this one I was definitely a little disappointed with the lack of acknowledgement of my diamond status first I arrived and they can't seem to find my reservation and even after I give him the reservation number they still have issues.it took quite some time to get into a room and you would have thought in a case like that whether you're diamond or you have no status at all that maybe they would try to do a little something for you to make up for the 20-minute delay in checking you into your hotel room but they made no such effort to be honest they didn't even acknowledge my status not once you would think after 10 years of holding the highest level that would mean a little something. The room is adequate like I said I've definitely stayed at worse but I've also stated at lot nicer Embassy Suites as well there were a few other little things that did not go quite right I think breakfast is a little misleading it says it starts at 6 but full breakfast starts at 6:30 I don't hate the hotel it served its purpose for the one night that we were here would I stay here again maybe maybe not but with that said overall I don't think it was a terrible hotel and if you were in the area I'm not sure I would go as far as recommending it but I think you'll be satisfied if you did choose this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed mid July and had 2 rooms. My husband and I had a king suite and our 3 daughters had the studio with a king and pull out couch. Luckily, I had read reviews regarding how small the rooms are, and I'm so glad I did or I would've been extremely disappointed. They are SMALL, but we weren't in New York to stay in the room, so it was fine. The hotel lobby bar has about 5 tables and is also small, but each night the bartenders were very friendly. We would typically spend time at the happy hour, but the room where they serve happy hour is so...small that it was packed, lines were super long, and there was no where to sit so we just went to the lobby bar and paid for our drinks rather than fighting that mess. Also, as soon as you walk into the area for happy hour or for breakfast it's sticky all over the floors. I understand that people have spills, but the few times we went it was the same each time. The staff was pleasant, but for the amount of money we paid, I would probably book another location on our next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I searched many hotels for this girls trip. We chose this property because of the location and price and we were not disappointed! The room was clean and functional. It was a bit small, but that's just NYC, space is a premium! Breakfast choices were excellent, with lots of choices of eggs, grits (yes, even in the Big Apple), sausage, bacon, potatoes, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit and an assortment of breads and bagels. Evening reception was just ok, not much assortment, but it did tide us over till a later dinner. Staff were extremely accommodating and polite! They are this property's best asset!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed in a Sky Terrace Suite. The room is small, with only a short wall to divide the bed with the "living" room, but is nicely decorated, furnished. The terrace is amazing, with the Empire State Building right there! The location is great. Subway station is close as is many top tourist spots. The complimentary breakfast is great, but very crowded. The elevator is extremely slow, we ended walking down the stairs multiple times. I would definitely recommend this hotel when in New York City.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just came home from a very hot weekend in NY. This hotel is close where the action is. Subway a few minutes walk, Madison Square Garden, Empire States, Times Square, Theaters.... When I enter to my room, I asked where was the rest of the room. The room is so tiny that reminds me the hotel rooms in Hong Kong. It is ok if you travel as a couple, but if it is 3 or 4 and use the sofa bed... The sensation is claustrophobic.Breakfast is a regular Embassy Suites standard which is very good, however you have to be there before 8 during weekdays and 8:30 on weekends... It tends to be crowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great complimentary buffet breakfast, with great staff.Internet was horrible, even Premium service.Check out staff were untrustworthy, as they recommended a ride for hire service to take us to the airport at twice the cost of a regular taxi.I will not allow these 2 check out employees deter the ratings of this property and other employees exceptional service.Hopefully, Management will take care of these employees and improve Internet service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My family and I had a wonderful experience at this location. Not only was the price perfect, the staff/service and amenities were amazing and the hotel was adorable and extremely well kept! The hotel was close enough to the subway, shopping, and Times Square, without the overwhelming crowds. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is centrally located and close to subway stations but far enough from Time Square that the street isn’t crazy crowded. The room is nice and was clean. The room is on the smaller size which is pretty standard in NYC. We had a king bed and pull out bed. The pull out is kind of small but was plenty big for our 10 year old. The breakfast was good for hotel fare but gets very crowded. The breakfast area is too small to accommodate the crowds. I would suggest breakfast as early as possible. Staff were pleasant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location, especially if you are using the Manhattan Cruise Terminal. Close to the Empire State Building and Subway. Room was comfortable, but not a true suite. Our room had a place for a chair and desk area that I would consider an extension of the room. You have to remember you are in New York City, space is very pricey. This property had 39 floors and 3 elevators, not enough in my opinion because I had to wait several minutes for one. The breakfast room/evening reception area is always crowded. But breakfast was very good and a lot to choose from. Evening reception was nice. Wines, beer, drink of the day and several other alcohols like rum and gin. Great staff all over the hotel. I would stay here again because it is a Prime Location.
user_name:
Peter D
St. Pete Beach, Florida

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed @ the Embassy Suites on 37th St for the second year in a row & won't ever book anywhere else than here! Our stay was amazing from start to finish with holding our bags, easy check in, snacks & water bottles for the room, citrus flavored water in the lobby, Happy Hour & an amazing breakfast! Craig the manager once again took care of us as we had to miss our Broadway show the Prom due to the NYC blackout on July 13th. He offered us wine in the lobby bar to ease our frustrations with the situation. He is a terrific manager & all of his employees are so friendly & professional! We can't wait to stay here again next Summer for our girls get away. Thank you Craig!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Located in a great location in mid-town. Only a tenish minute walk from TS and a few minute walk to the ESB. We could kind of see it from our hotel it was mostly blocked by the building next to us. I was expecting a downtown view out of our room but that isn't what happened . That was my mistake I think. We only stayed over night. We were here for a baseball game and then an event on Saturday. The staff was nice, the room was clean, bed was comfy. The bathroom was clean except the shower which looked dirty. There were black spots that were either permanent and supposed to be there or dirt. I couldn't really tell but they were there when I got in and I was the first to shower. Check-in and out was easy, I used the app. I stayed with points so I can't really complain. I'd come back one day, maybe get a room higher up and actually get that downtown view .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Breakfast is like a cattle market! Way too many people and not enough space! Food is OK. Evening reception is very basic... crisps, crackers and cheese, potato salad and jelly beans! Nice wine but again not enough space for the number of people .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Haven’t checked in the room yet. Been waiting in lobby for 6 hours.Most of the hotels, if guest arrives early tries to accommodate an early checkin. But instead I am waiting beyond checkin time, and no Courtsey to even ask a glass of water.Would not recommend the hotel for sure if you are arriving early then checkin time which is 4PMPlus staff is not friendly at all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great experience!!! Clean rooms ,friendly staff ,great location and awesome complimentary breakfast with lot of variety of foods to choose from.Beds were really comfortable and was able to get a very good sleep after a long day .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre district, it’s also far enough way that you don’t get the same level of noise you would get from a hotel closer to Times Square. The complimentary breakfast and reception are a great value for your money. Make sure to get to breakfast before 10 because even though they serve it until 10:30, they stop refilling the items and your stuck with what’s left, maybe cold cereal with milk if there’s any milk left. I was disappointed in this as it stated breakfast is served until 10:30.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy suites was located close to Empire State building,Times Square,Broadway and many other attractions.Great hotel,every night complimentary "welcome" drinks are on offer as is the breakfast every morning.Rooms are nice sized with good views.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Perfect place to stay with kids. Breakfast was great. Evening reception was fun & they even had a free rooftop movie. Close to time square and subway stations. We enjoyed this hotel so much we will be looking for Embassy Suites in every City we visit

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Well designed room and breakfast area, very efficient with limited space. Just keep in mind that the room is not a suite, good for one or two persons only. The service is very friendly, front desk and restaurant. A good midtown location, easily walk to Penn Station or Grand Central. Will be back again.
user_name:
ahu98
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is great. The check in process was great. The rooms are nice. It is NY spacious. The amenities are good. It has a refrigerator as microwave in the room. At 5:30 there is an evening reception with drinks and snacks. The drinks are good and best of all free. The breakfast in the morning is buffet style. They have hot and cold options. They also create omelets. I would totally stay here again. What a great find in Mid Manhattan!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had booked a suite from Fri to Tue. My credit card was authorized in the afternoon of Friday. I arrived at around 9pm on Fri and after a lengthy wait was told the hotel was oversold and they didn’t have a room for me that night. The offered to put me in another hotel for the night, somewhere far away, which I refused because I had plans near that hotel and couldn’t afford any more delays. While I was waiting and going back and forth with the manager, someone else arrived and checked in, and they had a room for him. I asked how come the person that came behind me got a room while I didn’t and they said it was because of the ‘rate’ and ‘group’ I was with.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Always come back to this hotel. I think I like it. That being said, The stay just wasn't that great. There's not one thing in particular that was bad and no aspect of the stay was outstanding or great. I don't know if that is what you were going for. If it was...great job! If not,... there still a lot of work to be done.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel. Clean rooms, nice people, close to everything. Breakfast was delicious. Only complaint was having to use your key card every time you get into the elevators. All the guests were complainong about it every time we were in the elevators.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The breakfast is insane and also a very weird layout — the food was not very well done. Insanity ensues when food runs out and other guests complain and people start cutting in line. Watching staff members scold guests for asking when food would be coming out. Was very shocked by this.Had to pay a premium to stay here and at least the complimentary breakfast would have been nice if food was better, staff was more helpful and treated you and others with respect as we were trying to give you. Note this is a NYC Manhattan building and the flood space is limited so smaller rooms and expect to wait up to 5 minutes to get to some floors during especially active times — the good thing about this hotel is it is a prime location and some rooms on higher floors have a direct view of the Empire State building!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was on point from the minuite we checked in. The staff in the hotel are all very helpfull and service was great. A iron and ironing board in the room was good so you dont have to ring around for one. The room was slightly smaller than other Hiltons i have stayed at but with not much time spent in the room it was notna problem. Room service was good and fresh towels put each day. The location was brilliant. We walked to all the midtown sights where we could explore more. The stay was memorable with a good variety of breakfast. Subway is about a 10 min walk and you can tour other areas in New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: A very good location and easy access to mid-town, Times Square and subway stops. The room itself is small but adequate. It feels a chintzy but if all you need is a place to sleep it's fine. If you need something fixed, just ask, the staff is very amenable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We rented two rooms for our NYC girls trip. The location was perfect, close to the subway and near to Times Square. The breakfast was amazing as far as free breakfast goes. Lots of options and made to order omelettes included. The fold out couch was perfect. We were 3 to a room but 2 small children could definitely fit on the fold out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Although are reservation was messed up, front desk manager took charge and corrected the mistake with a smile. Rooms were very nice, centrally located within walking distance to just about everything. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: For a hotel suite, it had to be the smallest I’ve ever stayed in! Only 1 chair other than the desk! Hardly any space for clothing! Had to always re-sign up to get on internet! We had to have maintenance up twice to repair the door key! Reception area for breakfast and happy hour is way to small for guests to enjoy! Elevators took forever to arrive!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Front desk staff was rude, housekeepers only seemed to work every other day, basic toiletries were not provided. Elevators were always extremely busy (prepare to spend a lot of time waiting). There was always someone smoking outside the hotel entrance and the hotel staff didn't seem to care. Free breakfast is great but you only get what you pay for, which is poor quality and selection. We only tried it once, it was very busy and just not worth the hassle. The gym is small but adequate. I liked the non-carpeted floor in our room and that we were high up as we requested. The rest of it was forgettable, except the lack of care and the poor housekeeping which was downright appalling. I get annoyed every time I think about how much money we spent to stay here for 7 nights. It was definitely the wrong choice. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Horrible customer service, couldn't find my reservation that was shown on my email. Front desk members were actually laughing at me, rooms are so small you'll think you are in motel 6. Took them 30 minutes to locate my fully paid reservation. Went down to the front desk to get a map and the front desk girl threw the map. Clearly, if you hate your job! Quit! There are thousands of hotels in Manhattan and we will not be staying in this one again, forget the free breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Not satisfied staff did not try to make it right. From the time of check to not having a rooms in the same floor. We stayed for 4 nights and the price was expensive at 3.000.00 for those nights. No available tickets to movie theatre no restaurant open until 5:00.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: If you are a masochist, then this hotel is your kind of place. From the moment you arrive, you realize that this is no ordinary Embassy Suites for a number of good reasons, so pick your poison.1. Where are the suites? Even though each hotel room at an Embassy Suites is advertised to consist of a two-room suite, this exception to the brand consists of one tiny room with the closet in the bathroom that requires a contortionist to use it along with a bathroom sink with almost no counter space.2. Surly Front Desk--The front desk crew clearly does not like their job and they are both unfriendly, unwelcoming and simply unhelpful in meeting your needs. 3. Non-Existent Management--I had a series of major breakdowns including the wake-up call that was never made. Despite repeated requests to the front desk and voice mails to the management team, management never bothered to contact me to address any one of my multitude of issues. The Embassy Suites "Make It Right" policy is a total fiction at this hotel.4. Not Enough Elevators--There are only 3 elevators to service a 39 story hotel which results in 5 to 15 minute waits. No lie--just read some of the other reviews. Talk about traffic. Make sure you don't leave anything behind since you will be spending your day waiting for the all to rare elevator cab.5. Dirty, Dirty, Dirty--The floors and hallways at this hotel are always dirty with trash and food including left-over food and dishes outside of the guest rooms. As a bonus, housekeepers left their cart outside of my room for 5 days and 5 nights despite my repeated complaints to the front desk that is clearly staffed by ghosts. The hotel is short staffed but packed with guests which is not a very good combination from a cleanliness and service perspective.If you like chaos and service breakdowns, then this is the hotel for you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel was perfect for vacation. It is within walking distance to Times Square, the Empire State Building and subways. The Continental Breakfast is very good but very busy with little seating. They have a wide variety of foods and will make omelets with request. The toilet seat and sink stopper in our room were broken but fixed when asked. The bathroom and main room are very small but the bed was comfortable. There was a pullout single bed but we did not use it. The room, bathroom and bed were clean which is a priority. There was not a lot of noise as we were right off the elevator and faced the city street. The front desk personnel were not as knowledgeable about the area as one would think they would be working in Manhattan. I was frequently referred to one employee by the others that said they were from other cities and did not know the area. I would stay at this hotel again due to the location.
user_name:
Charles M
Tampa, FL, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I love the location for midtown fun. Near Macy’s the Empire State Building and a nice walk to Times Square. I like the free big breakfast and the happy hour each night. Ask for a room with a view above floor 20.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were cheerfully greeted and they held our bags until check in. Breakfast was delicious as usual! A beautiful entrance and the room was nice, clean and fresh.The garment district has restaurants and shops and other things to see and do. And not far from Times Square! A nice walk to Times Square!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel with a view over some great tourist spots. There are only a couple of elevators but the staff is super friendly and willing to lend a hand. The rooms are small and can get expensive depending on the time of year and events in the city, but they are always clean and have plenty of amenities. Great for a good night's sleep on a business trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great and the evening reception was also nice. The room was clean and spacious, especially for a NYC hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Although a really nice hotel, this Embassy Suites really needs to be forthcoming and warn their loyal clients this is not a traditional Embassy Suites. The ROOM! Omg, it is tiny compared to the traditional brand of Embassy Suites rooms. It’s almost upsetting. I really believe most of the patrons that have reviewed it based their stay on the room. I was so shocked and upset I had to get over really quick as they along with half of New York were sold out. Pluses: very nice, nice location and at least really clean. The evening reception had real guacamole (so good, 5 stars for that)Location: perfect, the walking distance to all things social is a really good addition to one of the perks of being in midtown. Safety: totally comfortable! I felt very comfortable walking alone and or sitting outside of the hotel. Well lit and accessible to the Main Street. Didn’t have to pass alleys or weird surroundings. I was even able to take the kids out at night and walk a few blocks! Service: I had to be an adult give the staff a chance to do what the Hilton brand always does, makes you comfortable! We are a service driven family and the warmth and understanding received by the staff was much appreciated. I can sense they knew I was dwindling over the room. Their efforts to comfort me and the kids are so appreciated. We just aren’t use to accommodations that were so confined and small! The staff went out of their way to help me “get over it”. They arrange for my car service to pick us up and take us to the airport. I called around and scheduled a Lyft all who wanted $140. Thanks for that, the ride was lovely, nice car and traffic free! The hotel is better suited for couples and single travelers. They have movie night open roof top which makes for a great date night. There is bar service, food and the lovely New York sky. My husband and I will be back minus the kids!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We picked the Embassy Suites Hotel in Midtown Manhattan for several reasons: The price was acceptable for NYC, we had prior good experiences with the Embassy Suites Brand, and we really love the 'free', or better: included breakfast buffet. The nightly reception is an added plus after a whole day of sightseeing.Our expectations were met 100%, this is a very clean place with very friendly staff. Would stay there again any day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located, near most dining and shopping areas. For the price, the rooms are small. Quality of HK is average, the staff forget to replenish consumables and toiletries. Any calls to the service desk take a long time to action

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was UNBELIEVABLE, unclean, in need of repairs and small to say the least. Most of the staff are rushed, and one front desk person repeatedly placed my call on hold for 30 minutes. The breakfast seating area and space was cramped, hard to find a table, and it was impossible to move freely.My elder son rarely complains, however, he said, “what a nightmare!”

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Was slightly worried by the reviews I had read about this hotel but after having a 5 night stay I can recommend this hotel 100%. Fantastic breakfast which set us up for the day, no problems with the lifts, amazing drinks reception every evening, room sparkling clean every day, super friendly staff.Myself and my 2 adult daughter's all had a large size suitcase each, rooms slightly smaller than you might expect but still fitted everything in.Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First of all Embassy Suites is my favorite hotel to stay at, that's why its disappointing for me to write this review. The hotel and location was great!! The housekeeping was not good at all. Sorry when I stay at the Embassy Suites I expect it to be the same at all locations. 1st their policy is every 3 days to change sheets, well I know that didnt happen because the same stain on our sheets were there the entire six days. Also the garbage was never emptied, the coffee was never refilled, we never got anything but decaf and never any creamer. On our 5th day we left at 6am and arrived back at 6pm and the room was never cleaned. No new towels, shampoo, soap and again garbage not emptied. Called front desk and they said they send someone right away....45 mins later the lady at the front desk was sassy saying they just was busy and we can request what we need and someone will bring it up. After explaining we really need it cleaned (sorry when I pay that much yes I do expect my room to be cleaned daily) finally by 8:30pm someone came and cleaned. Just overall not happy with housekeeping not sure if that's managment or lazy staff....who knows.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in Embassy Suites in May and we liked the hotel for its good amenities, cleanliness and staff courtesyThe hotel is close to Times Square and walking distance from many attractions like Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Madame Tussauds, and is also walkable from Grand Central Station. Breakfast options were very good

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very comfortable room. Great location. Central to everything in theater district, Penn Station & Port Authority. Good hot breakfast. Perfect set up if someone wants to work at desk while other person wants to sleep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were here for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend and we had a very nice stay. I usually favor Embassy Suites and other Hilton-branded hotels as I really enjoy the service and amenities. The hotel is in a good location and is walking distance or a short subway ride to many attractions. The complimentary breakfast was very nice. It does get very crowded though so you may be bringing your breakfast up to your room, which we did the first morning. The same goes for the evening reception. The wine was good but the seats do fill up fast so you may be bringing your drink and snacks to the outside patio a floor down or elsewhere. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. The service was friendly and professional. We will definitely stay here again and are already planning on booking the same weekend next year at this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: From check-in to check-out, everything was nice. We had read a ton of reviews before booking. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was a little small but it didn’t matter due to us barely being in there. The breakfast and happy hour was Excellent. The key to both was to get there early!!! (The starting time) There was no wait time for the elevators. The representative even called a private service for our trip back to the airport, and loaded our bags while we checked out. We’re ready to book for New York next year, same hotel!!! 10 Star RatingP.S.... the view from the room was Spectacular you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location was perfect was visiting the city. Easy subway and bus access as well as taxi. Staff was very accommodating. Having a prepared to order breakfast was very nice and very easy. Staff help in any way they could. The evening reception was a nice plus. Who doesn't like a glass of wine after a long day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Friendly and professional staff. Clean hotel and room. If you ever stayed at an Embassy Suites, you will be disappointed with the room. It is not a suite, it is a broom closet. I could not even hang a suit in the closet because it was too narrow. The full length mirror was behind the bed so it was useless to see anything below your navel. Two people in a king room was tight. Very disappointed that I wasted points and cash for this room. As a diamond member I was expecting something better. It IS in a great location to Empire state bldg and Macy's. There are other hotels at same or less cost that won't make you feel like a sardine.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My wife took me to New York for my 50th. We stayed in room 3308 with a perfect view of the Empire State Building. The rooms were small but not bad for NYC. We had a great location that you could walk everywhere. I would say the only downside was the breakfast set up. This location still has free breakfast and happy hour. However the breakfast was too packed and no one could find a seat. When we come back we will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! DON'T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET ROBBED.We thought our stay here was wonderful until we realized we left our belongings in the room. Stayed at room 2007 with my husband for two nights and accidentally left his suit pants and my sweater in the room when we checked out. We were catching a flight so couldn't go back to the hotel to get it. However, when I called the hotel and told them the situation, they told me that they would get back to me. THEY NEVER DID and it's been over a week now. They were informed with my name, room number, address and what were left, and yet we still haven't received our stuff in the mail. I tried to call the hotel 5 times already and no one ever picks up the phone. I wish I could just walk there and tell them to pick up the phone, since they don't respond to email or phones.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We booked five nights on points and had great rooms and even better service. The manager, Craig, went above and beyond the call of duty by chatting with my twenty-year-olds about the cool spots to go, and was extra friendly to some small town Southerners. The bellhops were always available, the front desk staff was kind and helpful, never too busy, and we were especially impressed when we needed a shuttle to the airport that Craig himself made sure that happened for us. The rooms are not huge, but well designed and have everything you need -- besides, you need to be outside, exploring -- great place to walk to many great spots, and subway stop only 2 blocks down. Breakfast was well above average for Embassy Suites as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I'm a Hilton Honors member and definitely loyal to the brand. There are a LOT of Hilton properties in Midtown but I chose this one because of it's location & the breakfast. The location is great. The breakfast is also great... as soon as you elbow your way down the narrow galley through the crowd to get to it that is. That in essence is the issue - this place is TINY. I know a lot of hotels in Manhattan are small but this was exceptionally small. And not just in the breakfast/cocktail reception area. Our room was a King suite and the pullout sofa for our daughter wasn't a full pullout... yet it literally filled the entire space from the head of the bed to the desk so there was no place to put any of our bags or belongings. No shelf in the bathroom. No drawers to be found. TINY TINY TINY It probably would have been okay with just two of us in the room... though still noticeably cramped. With three of us it was laughable.
user_name:
Barb F
Crown Point, Indiana, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel was great! Amazing location for time square, Broadway, subway, EVERYTHING!! Bed was comfortable, we upgraded to a room with a balcony which was AMAZING! we found great restaurants nearby and the free reception at the hotel was perfect

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Needless to say we were a bit apprehensive to stay here after many average to poor reviews. We found the location to be excellent, the room clean, modern, and comfortably sized (for Manhattan). We experienced none of the elevator issues others mentioned, but admittedly we likely left in the a.m. and returned to the hotel at night earlier than most. Housekeeping did a great job and the room was quiet with an amazing view. It was excellent having a mini fridge and the bed was extremely comfortable. Finally, the breakfast was delicious and satisfying. All the staff we encountered was friendly and professional.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very nice location, reasonably priced and overall very nice stay. The service help at both breakfast and the evening reception were all outstanding; very friendly, efficient and professional. They all should be commended! Overall We enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it. On the not so good side, there are too few elevators which resulted in long waits at times. FOX “news” was on 24/7 in the lobby which I found to be totally inappropriate, especially in NYC. There was confusion regarding the parking. My voucher was stamped and told I would pay at the garage. I was at IPark and I later found out the parking fee was to be charged to my room. It was all worked out in the end. Finally, the garage employee took over 1/2 hour to find my car!May 14, 2019

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed there for a week and it was incredible! Location is perfect, near a lot of attractions and subway. Our room was very clean, bed comfortable and fluffy pillows. Of course is not a real suite but is NYC!! Our view was fabulous!! Breakfast is ok but too crowded by the time we got down. Staff very friendly! Great choice!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel is well located just a few steps away from broadway, Time square and the shopping areas on 5th avenue as well . Small stylish rooms in an “underliftet” hotel so you have to wait during “rush hours” to get up or down. Modern self service breakfast buffet with a broad selection of egg dishes fresh prepared on demand.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I’m giving this hotel a 3 out of 5 because I had an average hotel experience!The good: nice room but small, great location, breakfast included and happy hour.The rooms are tight especially after you open the pullout couch to make a bed. I really enjoyed my view on the twentieth floor. The bed is comfortable and the pillows were fluffy. I loved the shower! It was clean, great water pressure and was spacious! I liked that breakfast was included in the cost of the room. The made to order breakfast relates to omelette made to order ONLY! Everything else was pre-made! The breakfast had a good variety of options! No complaints.In the room is a fridge, coffee maker and microwave.The bad: broken bathroom seat cover, busy elevators, crowded breakfast area and room floor was dirty.I was really annoyed with our broken toilet seat cover. It was reported but no one ever fixed it. I stayed in room 2003! I also found what I think to be a vape pen in the pullout couch. We just left it in the room. In the mornings, the elevators are all very busy, especially in the breakfast hours!!! Our room has no carpet and walking on the wooden flooring was a bit gross because dirt would be on your bare feet from lack of proper cleaning. We wore shoes and socks most of the time to resolve this problem.Overall, an okay experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel was chosen due to its proximity in Mid-Town and as an option for included breakfast and evening reception. Let me start off saying the location makes up for the very small rooms. The studio suite with a king bed and sofa literally fit the (3) of us and not much else. The rooms are modern and in very nice shape, but do not plan of having space to unpack and unwind in there. The bathrooms were particularly nicely appointed and up to date.The breakfast buffet was very well stocked and well kept up. The food was fresh and hot and the staff very attentive and helpful, Same can be said for the evening reception. Choices of drinks is as usual, with basic wines, beer and liquors and the "snacks" varied from night to night, but nice option of cold and hot items.The location as I mentioned stands out. Easy walking distance to Empire State Building. Subway was a 1-2 block walk. We were even able to walk down to Rockefeller Center and Times Square very easily. Parking is what you would expect in New York, but fairly reasonably priced for 2 whole days. Just be prepared to have your car locked in for that time if you use the discounted hotel rate. Would recommend location and hotel, but as mentioned before, be advised the room size might be a limiting factor for some.
user_name:
David R
Mont Vernon, New Hampshire

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was my 2nd time staying here. I love this hotel. We arrived early and were told the room would be ready at 4 which is the posted check in time. No worries. We went to eat and grab a beer at the Keg Room and the hotel held our bags. I waited longer on the elevator at Macys than I did here. I’ve stayed at other hotels in the city and you will deal with crowds and wait times everywhere however it did not feel crowded here. (I stayed first week of May) The breakfast was great.
