I usually ate at 6:30 so it was less crowded. The reception was wonderful. Staff were incredible to all guests welcoming them and pre-busing their tables. The reception starts at 5 so we would snack and have pre theatre drinks then after the show get a burger or have snacks in our room. So this is a great option if you plan to see shows which we did every night. This is a great value and good location. Close to Bryant Park, shopping and Broadway. Just far enough away from Times Square but still a good proximity to all the action.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Our room was on the 35th floor which did help with the road noise. Rooms are definitely not your normal size suite but you do have a sofa/sofa bed at the end of yr bed. There is no storage in the bedroom bizarrely the wardrobe is in the bathroom which might be awkward for some, for obvious reasons. The evening complimentary drinks and nibbles is very busy, you get wine, beer and pre made cocktails plus crisps, popcorn, dip and sweets, dont expect to get the same as executive lounge hiltons but still nice to have something with a drink. Breakfast is in the same location but the room could do with being bigger as it gets very crowded. You can order eggs, omelette from a computer screen on the wall and then your order gets made, there is also porridge, fruit, sausages, bacon, grits, scrambled eggs are pre done. The hotel is in a great location walking distance from the sites, times square is only a ten minute walk away
user_name:
karen b
East Grinstead, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Situated a few blocks from the huge Macy’s, the Embassy Suites offers decent rooms with some nice extras in a central location. Let me start off by saying that in NYC space is at a premium and if you’ve never been here before, the rooms are tiny everywhere. If you’ve stayed at Embassy Suites elsewhere, this will probably be unlike any other you’ve stayed at and it’s amusing they chose to open this brand in Manhattan.The rooms are in a more contemporary style that’s popular lately – wood floors & no bathtubs. We had a king studio room which had a cozy design. You enter the room in a little corridor with the bathroom right in front of you. The bathroom was outfitted with a nice big mirror with great lighting and ample counterspace. The shower was disappointing for two reasons – the showerhead didn’t have great pressure and the sliding glass doors didn’t fully close, leaving gaps at either end where water pooled on the floor outside of the shower. I would have preferred a shower with a combo rain & handheld with a stronger stream. Going further into the room, there’s a nice sitting area with a sofa bed across from a TV over a desk. In that area you also had a small fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Behind the couch was a divider that helped separate the space from the bed. The king size bed was comfortable with another larger TV on the wall, and the setup was cozy as the divider provided an inviting somewhat separate space for the bed. When we arrived we noticed a stain on the bedsheets. They looked as if they had been changed, but the stain didn’t come out in the wash. When I called to report it, they apologized and sent someone up within five minutes to change out all the sheets. Otherwise, the room was kept clean for the duration of our stay. In addition, I saw them cleaning the water feature in the lobby on my last day – good to see that they’re staying up with keeping things clean.Breakfast is provided daily and it’s standard fare for Embassy Suites – fruits, breads, yogurt, various eggs, potatoes, meats, as well as made to order omelets that you order from a somewhat hidden (and poorly designed) tablet located on the wall across from the cook. With the exception of Monday morning, each time we went for breakfast the whole area was crowded with no seats. There’s a small seating area the floor below with some food and drink choices that sometimes wasn’t too crowded. The food was good.There’s also an evening reception daily in the same space as the breakfast. You have a choice of wines, beers, well drinks, and a rotating sangria option. There were signs for premium alcohol for an upcharge, but they weren’t available each night and when they were available, they weren’t necessarily the same as was on the menu! The food was good with a rotating selection of popcorn, chips & guac, cheese, pita, etc. It’s a nice little extra and we didn’t have a problem finding a spot to sit down.The onsite gym is nice with your standard selection of treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, and the times we went, we were able to get on a machine right away.Discounted parking is available in a garage directly behind the hotel and when you check out, you can access the garage from a door in the back of the lobby of the hotel. Note that on that block there are two different parking garages, the one that Embassy Suites has a deal with is the second one on the block. The parking charge is added to your room charge. Overall this was a decent choice in a central location with rates that weren’t too expensive. I would consider staying there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Through out our stay (3 days) the room was dirty, the fridge did work, the toilet seat was broken, our bathroom smelled like mold. Hotel staff is not very accommodating and friendly. At the end we were overcharged.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Located between Empire State Building and Bryant Park this New and modern hotel offers a perfect starting point to discover Manhattan. Central shopping opportunities (Macy’s), Times Square and Metro-Stations are close by in walking distance. Rich Breakfast is included and offers e.g. fresh made omelette and scrambled eggs on request. However, during peak hours it is hard to find a free spot in the resty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I spent 5 nights at the Embassy Suites, satisfying stay. he location is great in the hearth of Manatthan. Nice breakfast, it can get croweded but the three of us always managed to get a table and enjoy the buffer. Also I did not experience any wait at the elevator as other users mentioned.Maybe the staff at the reception could be a little bit more friendly but nothing negative to signal.Overall recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Having stayed twice before I was apprehensive but assumed that now the hotel has been open a while things would be betterI checked I at 9 as a diamond member and was told family enough rooms were not available but to give my number and they would call after 10.30 when the first rooms would come available At 3.15 still no call and my digital key not activated I went back to the hotel. Upon asking why I had not received a call I was told by Anita she had just started and shrugged her shoulders laughing at why I seemed annoyed - zero apology given I asked to speak to a manager- the front desk manager came after saying I would stay at the counter until someone came- I believe his name was Cameron. A half apology and rooms are not available until 4. I explained that I had a digital key for room 1902 but was given 1112 even though after asking why 1902 was available. Complete shambles and zero apology We then asked for our bags that were sitting all day right by the front desk and told we could not take them until a bellman came. Eight minutes passed no bellman at which time I gave the lady at front desk my tickets and just took them The last insult was the slow elevators - there are three for a hotel with over 35 floors! You can wait 10-15 minutes for an elevator. There are so many better hotels for couples or business people especially if your diamond that I cannot recommend this hotel. Rather than finding its groove it had fallen into chaos. Anyone wanting their sanity should not expect to eat breakfast after 9. I saw people with a plate trying to balance food as there are no tables available. Hilton or embassy suites this is not
user_name:
luischable
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My sister and I stayed at this hotel due to it great location. This hotel should not be called embassy suites. Every Embassy Suites that I have been to was a 2 room sweet. Meaning that the sleeping area was separated from the living room area. There was a wait for the elevator, and the toilet was dirty. The reception was at a bar (outside of the hotel), which limited the variety of drinks. When I told the front desk about the issue they didn't care. I called to speak with a manager and they never responded, although they requested that I reach out. All in all, will never go back to this embassy suites. However I still love the brand. This was not a real embassy suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Reservation was confirmed city view. Used digital key check in say before arrive of 7pm. Arrived 6pm and digital key did not work. Told room was gone. After 30-minutes on their front desk computer I was finally assigned a room with a view of a wall. Had to ask for my Hilton Honors Gold amenities. No resolution offered to adjust room rate for the 3 nights. Contacted Hilton CS and they said ES would call me either in the room or on my cell. Never heard from them or revived and messages.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Main tourist attractions all within walking distance from Hotel.Plenty of eateries on doorstep hence NYC on a budget is possible.Recommend takeout at PokèWorks near opposite hotel.Metro stations very close by however can be a little confusing in regards to which stops it will go to on weekends etc.Staff efficient and friendly, even able to arrange late checkout for one of our rooms which is great when you have an evening flight.Breakfast times very very busy & sometimes difficult to get a table without waiting. Best to go either at start of service or last 30mins/1hr. Kevin at the breakfast area was great in clearing the tables etc as quickly as he could while keeping a friendly demeanour to the waiting guests.Rooms are small because they have a little seating area however we expected this, being it is New York.Traffic is obviously terrible in the Big Apple and hence Hotel’s location was ideal.Recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The good parts were several: The location was nice (2 blocks from the metro and walking distance to Times Square and most midtown attractions.) I found the staff (front front desk to breakfast to reception) to all be very good in terms of friendliness and customer service. The breakfast, though crowded, was delicious. The reception was very similar. With both, a little patience goes a long way. The downsides were two: (1) the room in terms of upkeep (broken toilet seat, lose shower door handle, broken sofa bed - which we didn't absolutely have to have - our daughter just slept on the sofa and (2) the room size - I honestly thought people were exaggerating, but the 'suite' makes most cruise ship cabins I've booked seem spacious. Still, the good outweighs the bad, and the area and the hotel/staff effort wins the day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just back from a full week staying here, the hotel is fantastic, it's a credit to the STAFF and MANAGEMENT.Arrived Sunday 14th April at 3pm was met at hotel reception by 2 very pleasant, professional receptionist, very welcoming. They both could not be more helpful, Was given key to room 1512 on the 15th floor, the room was beautiful, well presented and SPOTLESS clean, couch with large back on it separated the bed from living area, TWO large flat screen televisions with a good variety of channels, safe, microwave, tea /coffee facilities, iron & board in the closet too. Hairdryer in a bag under the sink in the bathroom ladies !! The room was cleaned daily to a top class shine .YES there was a view of the empire state building but I did not ask for this.The room was beside the elevator but I could not hear any noise or any disturbance from it, the rooms are very well soundproof.I have to say reading some "particular reviews" here of this hotel about breakfast time , YES it does be busy at time but people what do you expect , it's New York city !!!! The hotel is very busy so NATURALLY peak times at breakfast will be busy !!!!! People complaining about the restaurant being busy in the morning is like complaining about the city being busy at rush hour, if you want a quiet breakfast GET UP EARLIER!!!! The breakfast is absolutely amazing, LOADS to choose from to suit every taste , plus the omelettes made to order by the hard working chef (who may I add was working the whole 7 mornings I was there as were the girls on the restaurant floor too) hard working people to make sure us customers got a great service.There are 3 lifts in the hotel and yes they can be busy at times but again its NEY YORK folks, the city of high rise buildings so NATURALLY lifts will be busy in any hotel at times, All in all this hotel was top notch from the minute I walked in the door to check out time , i could not fault it in any way , and anyone who does is just down right fussy looking for notice, this place will not disappoint you i have worked in the tour trade in Ireland and the UK for a few years staying in many many hotels and this one is right up there with the best if them . Plus location is just perfect for whatever or wherever you wish to go in the city.So to finish a very big THANK YOU to the staff and management of the Embassy suites for making my trip to New York a very enjoyable one.Don't be fooled or taken back buy a few fuss pots throwing up bad reviews THIS IS A FANTASTIC HOTEL 100% Enjoy if you stay folks

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Good choice in Manhattan. Convenient to attractions and easy to get around. Smaller rooms but adequate. Good breakfast and afternoon reception. Slow elevators so plan accordingly. Nice outside area but under construction while we were there.
user_name:
Randy P
Holly Springs, North Carolina

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First time at this location. Nice hotel, clean rooms. Reasonably sized for NYC (but don't expect the typical ES layout - it is small, of course). Loved the fact that the rooms did not have carpeting - so much cleaner in a high traffic room. Main criticism is that there are only three elevators for 35+ floors. Expect to wait. Also, breakfast/reception area was very small and congested.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am a Hilton Diamond member and spend 25% of my time staying at Hilton properties including many Embassy Suites properties, by far this is the worst Embassy Suites. I would rate it no star if there is an option. First, from the check in experience, there is a diamond check in line, no staffs are there, and other staff told me nobody there and didn't even offer help to me for check in. Diamond status means nothing here. Then when I get into my room, wow, is this an Embassy Suites or to be precise, is this a "suites"? For those that had experience with Embassy Suites, you will know what I mean. This is a tiny room that hardly accommodate 3 person, why is it calls suites? Are you trying to cheat people? Then when I want to use the toilet, the toilet bowl cover is not installed but leave laying on the bowl. I have to grab a housekeeping outside to help. Why are they letting customer to check in to a not ready room? Also there is no bottle water given in the room, normally it is there if check in online. I thought the worst is over but not. If you plan to use the elevator, good luck, please plan to spend at least 15 minutes to squeeze into the tidy one. I can see 3 elevators but not sure how many of them actually working. My advise is to choose lower floor so that you can use staircase rather than elevator, your time is more valuable than waiting for the elevator. Due to this, I not even able to have breakfast or evening reception. I feedback this to the hotel, but just get an apology without seeing any action to mitigate or even make it right for customer. I had issue in the past with other Hilton properties but the management do take action to help and I do really appreciate that. This hotel is definitely somewhere you want to avoid, good if no issue but good luck with issue. I will be traveling to New York a lot but will not staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Location very good and central. Recently remodled rooms with plenty of space compared to other NYC hotels I've stayed in. Only complaint is that they have 3 customer elevators for a 39 story hotel and for most of my 4 night stay only 2 elevators worked. Very slow going up and down, especially when on a high floor like I was. The wood be lines of people waiting at the bottom to go up the 2 elevators that worked. And not everyone would fit. I was here on business and the slowness of elevators was not a good way to start the day. I'd consider staying here again on pleasure, but not for buisness.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just arrived here after a 12 hour car ride and was allowed early check in . Front desk staff couldn’t have been nicer . We choose this hotel because we had a gift certificate from Hilton due to a horrible stay at the WTC Hilton downtown last year . I am so happy we chose this hotel, free breakfast , free drinks and nibbles at the managers reception 5-7 pm . Room is clean and spacious. I would definitely stay here again . Front desk provided bottled water and snacks to bring to our room .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: When we booked this hotel the rooms were advertised as “suites” with separate bedrooms and a room with a sofa bed. Tuned out to be false. The rooms are really small with none of the amenities of a suite such as a kitchenette or a separate bedroom and living room. The pull out couch that was advertised is actually a weird geriatric chair plopped in the corner about five feet from the bed. Seriously? It’s not even a couch. It’s a chair that flattens out.So if you’re looking for a suite, don’t stay here. Try the Stuart, Affinia or Kimpton. Same money, better rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This s a good, not great, hotel in a good, not great, location. It has 3 annoying problems:First, if you’ve stayed at other embassy suite locations in the past, don’t be fooled into assuming that this one is like all of the others. The rooms are NOT suites! You don’t get a separate living room and bedroom-just a normal, smallish standard hotel room. The typical “suites” do not exist. So the name is a bait and switch tactic to fool those of us who have enjoyed staying at embassy suites elsewhere.Second. You have to allow for at least a 10 minute wait anytime that you want to use the elevators. They are small, slow and too few. Always packed completely full while they stop on floor after floor, too crowded for additional passengers to board. I was here for 5 nights and seriously considered moving to another hotel just to avoid these elevators.Third. Regular embassy guests are used to very crowded breakfast rooms. Their free cooked breakfast are well above average. Unfortunately, this location was far WORSE than any of the 10+ embassy locations I’ve visited in the past. The layout of the room is terrible-just getting off the elevator on the 4th floor is like Times Square on New Year’s Eve! Then after you wait in line for food for 15 minutes, there are NEVER any tables available. People stand up with their food plates while they stalk occupied tables hoping to pounce on a table the moment someone gets up to leave. There is no point trying to walk around looking for other options, because the space is too tight to move. I seriously believe the fire department should investigate this terrible, and potentially dangerous situation!Needless to say I won’t be coming back here on future NYC trips!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Extremely well located, overlooking the Empire State from the room, clean and comfortable, the breakfast was quite regular and the staff very rude and little helpful with the exception of the bartender

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Three elevators is not enough for 39 floors.I've stayed at this hotel multiple times in the past months and there is one reason I cannot give it a higher score: the elevators consistently take too long. Management and staff acknowledge the problem and says it's because of the load at peak times, but I have experienced this slowness at all hours except late at night. Management says they sometimes put the service elevator into use for guests, but I did not see this happen. Otherwise, this is a nice hotel. You'll need to decide for yourself whether it's worth waiting several minutes for the elevator each time between the hours of 7 AM and 9 PM.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The only negative I would say is that the wait time for the elevators was pretty long. Other than that, this hotel was amazing! Beautiful accommodations, friendly and courteous staff, the breakfast and evening receptions are wonderful amenities, and a very good value price-wise, especially in New York. Wolfgang, Destiny, and Mercedes all went out of their way to be friendly and helpful at every turn. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is a joke! I stayed here for 5 days for business last week. First, they messed up with my booking and sent someone else into my room while I was in the shower. No apologies offered. They called me 3 times after that to ask for credit card details. I believe my company has paid. No they can't find any info. I had to provide my personal credit card as it was Sat.On Monday, my company has given them corp credit card and a week later, my personal credit got charged again. What a joke! Our company often use this hotel. 2000 employees. But I don't think we will use you again! No apology. Nothing! Not even a bottle of water. Rude staff and had to wait for 20 minutes for a lift! 4 stars?!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suites is the best place to stay for all occasions. The hospitality was great. Happy hour with filling appetizers were delicious. Our room was perfect for 4 people. It was like home away from home.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel staff were very accommodating (late checkout, storing luggage on check out day, suggesting nearby food and fun options).Room was very clean and typical Manhattan tiny. Breakfast was a bit of a debacle. Small space, limited staff and seating and an elevator nightmare to get down to the 4th from the 25th to eat each day (ended up choosing to take the stairs for most of the journey each way).Overall a great option with a great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Absolutely amazing views from hotel room, was on 37th floor. Breakfast choices really good. Room was lovely and clean . Staff very kind and excellent customer service. Location perfect. All good, no complaints

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is amazing! I would highly recommend. From the first moment we entered the building, the staff really could not do enough for us. The concierge, Wolfgang, provided exceptional customer service, and even remembered what we were doing/where we going and asked questions when we returned - just the little things. We got married whilst we stayed, and required flowers, make up artists, various members of the bridal party to come up to our room. The front desk really helped us to co-ordinate this, and even brought things to our room themselves to ensure everthing ran smoothly. On our return to the room on a wedding evening, we came back to a bottle of processco, cheesecake and other deserts with a little note congratulating us on being married. Again, something they didnt need to do but we really appreciated. In addition the breakfast is great, as is the location and there are complimentary drinks from 5-7 everyday + we had an awesome view of the empire state building from our window. We decided to upgrade to this hotel when we decided to get married and all in all, the hotel really helped us to enjoy New York more. Its worth every penny!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Convinient location, small rooms great Social Hour&Breakfast. Kim,Max,Jorge&Domonique are awesome. Tim at fron desk is rude and needs customer service classes. Very clean worth the stay for a few days.
user_name:
Elizaperfecto
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The original room requested through check in on app several hours before arrival was not ready Housekeeping staff did a poor job cleaning room. Bedding smelled, bathroom had dirt running down the door. Toliet seat was not attached. Floor 4 hot breakfast was ice cold, eggs were burnt and sausage was so hard you couldn't cut it. Soda fountain machine smelled horrible. When I reported the issue I specifically requested a manager. The gentleman didn't say he was a manager just asked what for and when I told him said he could write down the problems. I didn't send a contact in the app. I received a response and told someone would contact me. They didn't I reported again through the app and was told a different person would contact me. Never heard from then. After I checked out and sometime during my flight home, someone finally called and left a voicemail. I was reimbursed in points which I feel more should have been done during my stay, I definitely would not stay at that location again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Our stay here was a disappointing, stressful event. As HHonors Gold members we expected I might have been offered an upgrade -- but no, we ended up in just about the tiniest room my spouse and I have ever stayed in, and that includes Europe where rooms are small… While Room 2208 did face the Empire State Building, it had only one very small, very dirty window through which you could barely see outside to the Empire State Building and Macy’s –very unlike the photos at the booking website for a “King High Floor City View” showing a floor-to-ceiling window and lots of light. Very misleading.Free evening “reception” is a joke, try and find a place to stand, let alone sit. It was chaotic, everyone running everywhere. Food selection was sparse – cubes of cheese, no crackers. They were overwhelmed by the crowds. Nachos and Guacamole with no sanitary measures was disgusting since the disorderly crowd was hand dipping their chips, and there was no sanitary control by the staff. Finally, on Monday, our last day, we were able to use the breakfast service which was good, and the omelet station worked well, staff was great. Positives: Anita at the Front Desk was wonderful. A great bellman who brought coffee up to our room after we had mentioned the issue with no replenishment. The two bartenders in the bar/restaurant were terrific – great conversation and real communication and super drinks. The best part of the stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We arrived end of the morning and proceeded to a pre check-in. The person at front desk was clueless, did not seem to be aware of the email we sent to Cleopatra [-] (who was front desk supervisor back) regarding our room allocation one week earlier. She asked us to come back at 4pm.We then came around 5pm, stood in the queue at the front desk. When it was our turn, we went in front of the first front desk employee who was available. She did not acknowledge us and was staring at her screen. After some time, she checked and told us that the room was not ready. She asked us to go the "bar" and come back 30min later. We went to the bar, first of, she did not tell us that we needed a key to access the lift, so we had to bother guests asking them to flash their card for us. We came back 30min later and went straight to the woman who we talked to 30min before (she was not dealing with customers).This woman, who already had a lot of attitude during our previous attempt to check-in, just did not bother looking at us nor she acknowledged us (once again). I tried to talk to her, but she simply ignored us. Then, another front desk waved at us and proceeded to our check in. This other front desk employee, who will be mentioned in the comments later, was THE ONLY professional front desk employee of the whole hotel.So here we are, checking in at around 6pm when the employees knew we were waiting for the room since 11am.Regarding the room allocation, I asked for a quiet bedroom and a room with Empire State Building views. I specifically paid an extra $200 to be guaranteed a room with a view. I also stated that since we were staying for 10 days, we needed a large bedroom.We entered into a room with a tiny hospital-like window with, indeed, a view of the Empire State building when you flex your knees and turn your head to the left. The view itself was disappointing, but the most disappointing part the SIZE of the room. Yes, I saw management's comments saying that although its Embassy Suites due to its location it's not suites but bedroom and that they consider themselves larger than most rooms in the area. YOU GUYS NEED TO REBRAND THIS HOTEL, it cannot be labelled as Embassy Suites. PERIOD. The room was TINY. We just had space to walk around the bed and that's about it. It was like 12m2, the closest was in the bathroom. Yes, you read properly, our tiny closest was in the bathroom. Everything was sooo small, probably standard size for NY yet this is Embassy Suites and they say their room are on the larger side for NY but it's simply not true. Further, the AC was noisy as hell and just by the bed, there was no way I could have had decent sleep in such room.We complained and were changed to a disabled room on the other side of the corridor. That room was indeed, larger, but had many issues. One the main issue is that the TV cannot be watched from the bed. There is a couch, too small to fit two people so it's like you take turn to watch the TV.The disabled bathroom was odd, shower head super low, it was only designed to cater for disabled guests obviously although there are many disabled rooms (almost half of them) in this hotel and therefore, non disabled guests are constantly allocated to these rooms. But the biggest disappointment was the view, not only there was no Empire State Building views, but a huge condo building was just in front and we could see everything in the apartments so you can imagine that people living in front see everything in our bedrooms. We spent the whole stay with curtains closed which we specifically booked this property for the views advertised.Whenever we emailed the then Front Desk supervisor, who seems to have been promoted to front desk manager - Cleopatra [-] , she took a long time to reply (she actually did not reply or acknowledged half of our emails during our stay). We saw her at the front desk and pointed that out and she just replied to us that she started her day at 1pm (a couple of hours earlier) and therefore had no opportunity to reply (yet this emailed remained answered after). This was ridiculous given the fact we copied several employees of the hotel to ensure a prompt reply.We were shown another room on a lower floor on the second day. We refused the room, we told them that they layout was underwhelming and not worth moving taking the lift and risking having upstairs neighbors. We asked that if the same room on our floor was vacant, that they move us there. We never heard from them again and the room mentioned had various guests checking in and out during the rest of our stay. When we pointed it out to Cleopatra [-] , she just said "we showed you a room and you refused it" end of the story.The rest of our stay, we constantly experienced attitude from some of the front desk employees, and in particular the sassy one from check in that would give us evil eyes whenever we walk by or ask for water (yeah because there is no complimentary water in the room you need to ask for it at the front desk and when you do, half of the time they refuse giving it).Breakfast was okay, but after one morning we just got sick of it. The menu remained the SAME our whole stay, nothing new. It's a very basic breakfast (pancakes, sausages, potatoes) with a nice egg station (they pride themselves to have it as a brand for Embassy Suites but every 4-5 stars hotels have one). After 5 days I just could not take their breakfast anymore.One of the perks of this hotel is the free open bar from 5 to 7 but apparently they lost their license and no longer serve alcohol. Also, one of the bartender was constantly pressuring us for tips and would give us attitude when we tip $1. One night a large group of people rented a room to have a alcohol and possibly drug-fueled party in a room on our floor. Despite many complaints, nothing was done about it. When I emailed Cleopatra [-] about it, her only reply was "they were only here for one night". Below the paragraph from the email I sent her regarding this issue :They started being more and more noisy and were obviously intoxicated, shouting in the corridor, or keeping their door open all night to allow people to get in and out. I cannot emphasize enough how noisy it was. Never in my life I have had such experience in a hotel before. These people were very obviously hosting a party in their room and were probably under the influence of certain substances. We called the front desk at 11:30 for them to stop this. We never heard anyone coming up there to ask them to keep it down or better : not to have a party at all in a small hotel room while other clients are sleeping. And that despite the promises of the person who pick up the phone. We called the front desk around 3 am for the same purpose and were told that they were sending someone up here. We never heard any staff knocking at their door or communicating with them. This carried on all night. We tried to sleep but could barely sleep since this group was shouting, partying and slamming door all night. And despite wearing ear plugs and having a room not sharing a wall with them, it was impossible to get some sleep.And of course, nothing was done, not even an apology bottle of wine. Nothing, nada. Never in my life I experienced such a low level of hospitality.Finally, a few hours after check out, I realized I forgot my usb drive in the room. I notified Cleopatra [-] who found the drive. I asked her to mail it back to me in Cleveland and she had the nerve to ask me to send her a prepaid label. First of, I never had to obtain a prepaid label for an item I could not present to the post office for them to weight the package so I had to guess the possible weight of the package (that was a struggle). Secondly, it was super complicated to obtain a prepaid label on USPS website (took my one week because the website was not compatible with Safari and Chrome (had to download Mozilla) as I could not go past the second page (I would get an error message). You could think that when you spend thousands in hotel room at a 4 stars hotel and forget a small item, they would mail it back to you (especially since it was within the US), but NO, according to Mrs [-] $7 is $7 and they are too cheap to pay for it. That's insane, I forgot stuff in rooms before and they would send it back to me in FedEx at their expenses but with Embassy Suite apparently the customer has to obtain the label and pay for shipping fee. I don't care about paying, but I really struggled to obtain the label it's so ridiculous that they wouldn't get the label themselves then charge it on the card I used for the reservation!Also, room cleanliness was terrible. Not very clean upon check in (hair that didn't belong to me, not so clean mirrors, etc), but throughout the stay so many things were not cleaned (like sometimes they would leave dirty dishes in the room, or for instance they never cleaned the tray despite me putting it on the floor middle of the room to show them that it was dirty).I could go on and on, but it took me 3 months to write that review because I don't want to waste my time over this hotel. Yet I had to address it. I gave them many opportunities to correct the issues, I informed Cleopatra [-] of my dissatisfaction but she could not care less about the reputation of this property. I told her I would review this hotel on TripAdvisor on my third or fourth day (over ten), but she did not acknowledge my email nor did she try to make things up to us. Just sass and eye rolls.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice location but it sure seems like thus hotel has serious infrastructure problem, with huge mismatch between number of guests and the meager number of elevators. We have been waiting interminable amounts of time for elevators, and the breakfast scene is sheer bedlam, with no place for most people to sit. You might be ok if you stayed on the bottom 10 floors and stuck to the stairs and skipped the breakfast. Same problem with the happy hour...sure the drinks may be free, but I would prefer to be in a more hospitable space where we could actually sit together and converse.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: While I appreciate the breakfast and reception, it's so crowded, you'd be lucky to find a place to sit. Staff is somewhat rude. Generally unattentive to details. Your Hilton Honors sy=tatus dioent really get you anywhere with this location.
user_name:
Tony R
Arlington Heights, Illinois, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this property during spring break and my daughter's first trip to the Big Apple. This hotel has prefect location close to attractions. The rooms are not big as other Embassy Suites but it is comfortable and serves the need of a clean comfortable room when you come back from a busy day of sightseeing. Will definitely stay here again given the opportunity.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just back from a 2 night stay at this midtown property. Staff was friendly at check in and check out. ( I was even able to get into my room at 12:30pm. While I realize this is NYC, I don't see how they can be called suites. There is definitely no suite. There was a small desk and chair, another comfortable sitting chair, comfortable bed and a very large wall tv opposite it. However, the bedside table was hardly wide enough for a magazine. The one window (6th floor) faced an office where I could see the workers. The oddest thing was that I had to stand over the toilet to open the closet to hang my clothes! The closet door opened with about 1/2" to spare next to the toilet. Fortunately, I was traveling alone for work. I did go to breakfast which is very crowded but efficient and has the wonderful made to order omlettes! I also used the gym which was quite sufficiently equipped and you could tell it was a newer property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: With so many hotels to choose from we chose this one for the complimentary breakfast and it’s location. And we were glad we had done so as this hotel was in a fantastic location, accessible to many tourist spots. We enjoyed our breakfasts with lots of choices including made to order omelettes. It really set us up for the day sightseeing. The drinks reception in the evening was a real bonus too. It gave us chance to rewind with drinks and snacks before heading out for the evening again. It could be very busy but there were usually seats and always a nice lively atmosphere. We were delighted with our room and after a lengthy delay from the UK we were wowed with the fantastic view from our 38th floor room- the beautifully lit Empire State Building! We never tired of that view! The room was very comfortable and clean. We all agreed we would recommend this hotel to anyone and indeed have done so since our return to UK. When we come back to New York we would look to staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Tom the bartender is by far the best thing about this hotel. He embodies customer service excellence. The location of this hotel is strong if you are in NYC to see Broadway plays or if Times Square happens to be your thing. That is the end of the road of the compliments though. The rooms are absurdly small. There is no where to put your luggage. The breakfast / reception area is also tiny thus always overrun. There is never enough silverware or bowls. The reception was out of red wine less than 30 minutes into the event. The staff tries, but there just isn't enough of them or enough room for them to work. I'm not sure exactly what the housekeeping staff did except throw some clean towels in the bathroom and lightly make the bed. There was a collection of 12 or so dirty glasses in our room when we left this morning. If it wasn't for Tom, this rating would be a 2 at best.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was very convenient for plans for a broadway show and off site dining options, and about a 15 walk from a Grand Central Station. A great overall value, very clean public spaces and rooms, very courteous and hospitable staff

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean & modern with a fridge & microwave. Looks new. Close to our favorite attractions. Friendly staff. Enjoyed having breakfast daily. We had a great view of the Empire State Building. We will be coming back again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is one of the worst I have EVER stayed in. Having been well travelled, and staying in many Hilton hotels, this has to be the worst hotel due to the poor facilities, deceiving room size & shambles of a “breakfast” choice.The hotel claims to be Embassy “suites” but you can’t swing a cat in this room, it’s that small. The shower doors don’t close properly, therefore flooding the entire bathroom area.The fridge doesn’t work & the neither does the air conditioning. The breakfast choice got worse as the days went on. They don’t have enough room in the breakfast area, which meant other guests were taking their food up to their rooms. They ran out of everything by 9/9:15am and breakfast finished at 10. We had to clean up our own breakfast table because there was no one to do it and no where else to sit. No tea making facilities in the room, so you would have to make it yourself downstairs in the lobby and pay each time.The cleaners don’t clean the room, they only make the bed and empty the bins. Even that seems to be a big issue for them everyday.
user_name:
misssophiadin
North West England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Anita’s front desk customer service was a 5star experience. I highly recommend staying at this location. It was very close to a lot of attractions m, the subway, Grand Cebtesl station and walking distance to Times Square .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It is centrally located in NYC - very close to Times Square. The breakfast has a lot of variety and is included. The rooms are small with very limited storage space. You cannot access the shower without completely closing the bathroom door.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We to New York to see a play. The hotel was walking distance from the theater district. Close to subway and buses. A variety of eating places to choose from. Hotel was comfortable and the Embasy Suites breakfast was great as usual.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We just got back from a stay there Friday night. We had a King studio and while it was very clean it was teeny I mean really tiny with a family of 4 we were squeezing by each other. The quilt over the bed was worn and full of pills but I just pushed it off. The pillows need to be replaced but overall it wasn't a bad stay. The breakfast was good but the room where you ate was like an incubator. Would I go back? Probably not but that's because we would need a bit more room for our family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a wonderful weekend stay at the Embassy Suites NY Midtown. This was our 20th wedding anniversary and our very first time to NYC. We were blown away with how beautiful the city & hotel are. Our train arrived first thing Saturday morning and we walked the few blocks from Penn Station to the hotel where we asked to leave our luggage so we could explore the city, much to my surprise they were able to get us into a room! The view from our room was beyond AMAZING!!! It was everything and more than I had hoped it would be! The room itself is beautiful as well. Very clean & modern looking and while not a typical 2 room suite you get w/ Embassy Hotels it was plenty spacious for the two of us. After exploring the city during the day it was nice to come back to the hotel & take part in the managers reception. While they don’t currently have their liquor license they are still serving light appetizers & non alcoholic refreshments as well as vouchers to Blaggards Pub. The snack options were plentiful, rotated and refilled which was very nice (options we had were chips & guacamole, pretzels & cheese, caprese bites, popcorn, crudite, fresh baked cookies, etc...). We enjoyed the vouchers to Blaggards Pub which was 1 block away from the hotel. While service is a little slow at the pub the drinks were plentiful & they included items like Jameson & Guinness which typically wouldn’t be included in the managers reception at the hotel so that was an added bonus. Also the front desk was generous with the vouchers. Everyone worked very hard to ensure the guests were happy & taken care of. Breakfast in the morning was delicious and they had a lot of options that rotated daily. I loved the morning pastries (tasted like they were made in house) & fresh berries which was a pleasant surprise. The eating area does seem small until you realize there is another area off to the side that has more seating, we preferred to make our plates and head back to our room and enjoy that beautiful room. All of the staff we encountered were beyond friendly and most importantly helpful. I was red to make sure to send a special thank you to Nikki & Dominica/Dominique for taking such wonderful care of us! We had such an amazing anniversary trip ❤️

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I arrived after 4:30 PM (check in was at 4:00 PM) to find the room I had chosen on my app was not ready and was told it would not be ready for another 1.5 hrs. I was given another room and the closet was too short to hang my coat. I was shown another room which seem find until I 'moved in.' The closet was not quite deep enough for hanging clothes, the 'desk' was directly under the TV, the desk was barely deep enough for my laptop (I placed the ironing board in front of the desk so that it was barely deep enough too work), the room was smaller than a hotel room I had stayed in a couple months ago which was just a couple of blocks away, and I had to 'shimmy' around the bed to get to the head of the bed. I know this is NYC but I am not sure why this room was called a suite. I do not think I would stay here again when I have to go to NYC for work or holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The sofa bed in pic is this hotel’s plan for creating a suite. In poor taste. The space is small, even for 1 or 2 people. The hotel had no liquor license, so rather than reduce their rates they served mocktails at their reception. Or gave you a pass to some unknown pub couple blocks away. No waffle station at breakfast. Just generally sub par for Embassy Suites. Wouldn’t stay again. Wish I’d stayed at my conference hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Worse experience at an embassy suites and I only stay at Embassy Suites. The reception was offsite and subpar. The room was not a suite and the hotel should not be called embassy suites. There was a wait to get on the elevator. Breakfast was ok. Bathroom was dirty. My billing was also messed up. No one knew anything. would not recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is nice the staff is excellent especially Jackson and Mike, but no Liquor License in the hotel at all? Food was very limited also, hallway was steam bath and room was cold, possibly another season

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: nestled in the heart of midtown was the wonderful hotel. after a long day of working in DC, i arrived in NYC at 12am and was pleasantly surprised that the walk from Penn Station was not very far. Unfortunately, i walked passed the hotel twice and I was using google maps. As a solo female traveler into NYC i was a bit weary, but once i hit the ground walking, i realized its ALOT of people out this time of night. it being located by a Chick fil-a and a Whole Foods was a major plus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Step were very efficient to check in. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Internet was decent speed. Complementary breakfast was very nice. Elevators were busy, but to be expected with this many floors. Check out was effortless

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The service I received was outstanding from all the staff members!!! Everyone went above and beyond!!! They accommodated all my request from early check in to late checkout with no issues. Breakfast and Evening reception staff was great friendly courteous everything keep up the great service!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great experience as always. Very very responsive staff and the breakfast and snack hour really makes it a pleasant trip when you have children.would definitely recommend this hotel it's a bit different than other typical embassy suites but it is New York City so it's understandable rooms are smaller

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay at this Embassy Suites. The rooms were small, but I believe that is just a NY thing. The made to order breakfast is great. They did not have a liquor license when we stayed (the hotel had just been sold), but they gave vouchers for a pub a block away. I think they made a big effort to make your happy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel for the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff, clean rooms, convenient location, healthy and high quality breakfast, and pricing. Only minor complaint I had was the slowness of the elevators, even during non-peak hours.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect Midtown Manhattan location, close to dining, shopping, sightseeing, train station...etc. The hotel staff were very professional & the hot made-to-order breakfast & evening reception is a great plus!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We've stayed for 5 nights end of February.Upon arrival, we received an upgrade for our room, and got moved to the 25th floor, with view on the Empire State Building. The room was very clean and tidy.Breakfast was more then enough, and well varied for everyone to find their preferences.The hotelstaff was very friendly and kind, perfect score there.Would recommend this hotel for everyone who is looking for a central location in NY.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had the most amazing view from my corner room. Empire State Building from one window and the Freedom tower from the other. Everything about this place was great. 39 floors, I stayed on the 38th. Room was very clean with stylish decor. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was great, cooked to order eggs and omelets. Walking distance to tons of restaurants, shopping, Time Square etc. Great value for all the benefits mentioned above.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: People don’t mind dealing with minor inconveniences (no liquor license yet, smaller suites due to it being New York) when the service is great! people make a difference in people’s experience. I’ve been a Hilton member for a while, this is my first time at the embassy suites in New York. The check in process moved smooth. The staff were very friendly. A young lady checked me and my infant in early without charging me. The happy hour was a wonderful experience. Destiny was so lively and personable. I just stopped by to grab some soda. But destinys personality made me go back upstairs and grab my whole family. I wanted all of them to experience this. She’s awesome! Perfect 10

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The Location of the Embassy Suites in MidTown is the BEST THING ABOUT IT...GREAT LOCATION! The Suites part of it is a JOKE. My wife and I stayed there in February 2019. If you are expecting a standard Embassy Suites 2 room suite from this hotel, you will be VERY DISAPPOINTED. Our "Suite" was not ready at Check in time(one hour early,) so we took what was available which was an accessible room on the 22nd floor with a balcony...Was only there for one night, so why not. THE ROOM WAS SUPER TINY...NOT EVEN A REAL CLOSET...THE BALCONY WAS EITHER AS LARGE OR LARGER THAN THE ROOM...RIGHT NEXT THE THE CONSTANTLY BEEPING ELEVATOR AND THE HALLWAY NOISE WAS VERY LOUD...YOU COULD HEAR A WHISPER CLEARLY. WE were told at check in that they were "in the process of obtaining a liquor license" so there would be no alcohol served at the evening reception, but we would be provided some drink vouchers for a local bar. The local Dive bar we were sent to was not what you would think the Hilton Brand would be associated with. The people were nice, just not what you would expect.On a positive note, the hotel is in a GREAT LOCATION with a lot going on around it. The staff at this Embassy very nice as well.Would I stay there again..Because of location, Only if it were for one night where I would not be spending much time in the room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This Embassy Suites is in a great location. Plenty of restaurants and access to the subway. The staff were nice and the breakfast was great each morning. Pleanty of Pubs in the area as well. Great rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This isn't your typical Embassy Suites with a massive atrium, large pool, and large rooms. After all this is New York City, where space is at a premium.First the location. The hotel is located between Broadway and Park Avenue just above Herald Square and below Grand Central Station. It is within easy walking distance of Macy's and Penn Central / Madison Square Garden. So let's give it an A+ for location.Our room was small, but more than adequate with a very comfortable bed, large high resolution TV, microwave and mini-fridge. This is a very narrow hotel, so there were probably only 10 rooms per floor on this high rise hotel.When we checked in, the front staff was courteous and efficient. A full breakfast comes with the room and as is the custom at Embassy Suites, you could have anything you wanted. Supplementing a custom made breakfast, the hotel had a ready made buffet line for those who were in a hurry. The happy hour at night was somewhat subdued because the hotel had still not received its liquor license from the city/state of New York. However they prepared wonderful "mocktails" and their free appetizers were "over the top".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Had a great time at this hotel. From the moment we walked in the door, every single staff member we passed greater us. Very friendly and very helpful in recommending places and thing to do. Our room was clean and nice. And our view of the Empire State Building was awesome. Location was great, we were walking distance to Times Square. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Fantastic place to stay. The breakfast was surprisingly delicious with so many nutritious options. The staff could not have been nicer. The location also was ideal. The bedding and accommodations were also excellent. It is a gem of a place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Thank you to the staff, my daughter and I had a fabulous time at your hotel. The breakfast and drink tickets were a nice touch! Everything is in waking distance to Times Square. The staff was extra accommodating

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed 4 nights over the Columbus Day weekend.Liked:1. Location, but most spots in Manhattan are "very good" to "excellent".Dislike (very disliked):1. Room, off the elevator was tiny (you can't say tiny too often). The foot of our King size bed was about 30" from the wall, so luggage could be located without completely blocking passage. Also, not enough space between bed and street window to place luggage. The sofa bed, when opened, took up all its available "nook space." Basically, the room should only fit a Queen bed with a work area, but they shoehorned a King and sofa bed, and charged room rate 2x as much as a suburban ES. A City ES should be like the Chicago Gold Coast ES - - it reflects smaller city space but still can call it "suites."2. While there, there was a water main beak so no water from about 3PM to 5AM. Fortunately, NYC contractors made repairs by dawn. Not the hotel's fault.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel offers an evening reception every evening from 5-7pm. That was one of the features why I picked the hotel. I even called when I booked it and was told it was available on weekends. When we checked it we were told because the hotel was under new ownership they did not have a liquor license. I would be receiving 1,500 hilton honors points per person (3,000 total) on my account within 5 days. It has been 12 days and 3 phone calls. Each time I was told within 24 hrs. As a hilton gold member I expected better customer service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First time in NYC, I was happy to stay in Embassy Suites hotel for 6 nights. The area is safe, close to metro station and in walking distance from tourist attractions such as ES building, Top of the Rock, Grand Central and so on. Breakfast is good and the service is excellent. Suitable for both business travelers and leisure visitors. Overall, a very value for money option.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Recently stayed here for a girls weekend away. We were highly impressed with the accommodations and more impressed with the staff. Every staff member had a smile on their face and made sure to say hello.
user_name:
M8841AHmeganl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very good location, the complimentary breakfast is really delicious and the items have a excellent variety and the system to choose eggs or omelette in omelette station is outstanding.Staff from breakfast are always pleasant and happy!
user_name:
Voyage33419785590
Sao Caetano do Sul, SP

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location, nice breakfast, friendly hotel staff and free evening reception make this hotel an excellent choice. We will definitely consider staying again when we visit NY. The complimentary internet was plus too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. The rooms have a good size and we enjoyed the breakfast everyday. Good location not far from time square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend for couples and families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location for easy access to all of the hot spots. Very comfortable rooms and the complimentary breakfast and guest reception are a bonus. The beds are really comfortable and the staff is very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed for two nights this past weekend. It turns out that the property was recently sold. While the accommodations were nice they were a few things that were not typical of Embassy suites. The two main drivers for us of staying at the Embassy suites are the cocktail hour each evening and the breakfast each morning. Because of the recent sale, the liquor license had not yet transferred and therefore the cocktail hour had no liquor. The bar downstairs was the same. It would’ve been good to know rather than finding out when we went to go get something. When we did ask they gave us two vouchers for a pub around the corner. It was nice but not the same as something right with in your hotel. Breakfast on the fourth floor was a madhouse. Not sure that there is much that they could’ve done to control that any better but it was crazy. The fruit was terrible. Mushy old and discolored. There are only three elevators to serve the 36 floors which are therefore very slow. However I will say that our interactions with the staff were all positive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel staff was amazing!! Every last one. The downside- we booked it based on the managers reception. We figured this would be great after wandering around in the cold all day it would give us an excuse to go back to our hotel and warm up and have a few cocktails before heading out for dinner. We were told upon check in and after we parked car etc that there wasn't one due to no liquor license. We were given a voucher for a draft beer at a bar down the block. It just didn't cut it. The room itself was nice but we couldn't get the temp to go down until 72 all night even with the window open. Will not stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Checked into this new Embassy suites as Diamond member and found it recently changed owners. The staff was very accommodating and tried hard to satisfy guests even though they did not have liquor license (yet). Room was nice, maybe smaller than average but not an issue for me in a big city. It was nicely laid out for the business traveler.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We chose this hotel because it was close to Times Square and close to where we had stayed before. A really nice feature of the hotel was you were able to park directly behind it in the parking garage and all you had to do was walk into the hotel from the garage.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The staff was incredible and very accomondating. the issue i had was with not knowing prior to that the hotel had a new managing firm and the liquor license did not transfer with the new management, so in the middle of NYC and its grandeur the hotel was a dry hotel, social hour was replaced with a voucher to go to a Irish Pub one block away, a voucher not another site to setup the social hour. Not an alcoholic but sitting in the lobby for a few hours and chatting with my beautiful wife prior to dinner would of been great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I recently stayed at the Embassy suites in Manhattan on 37 th street,I am a Hilton Diamond member and I didn’t feel the diamond experience from my stay,when I was Gold member most of the other hotels I stayed at made me feel like royalty,I didn’t feel that here so I wrote to Hilton honors guest services and explained my feelings and they responded very promptly and made a not so nice feeling turn into a much better feeling I received quite a few extra honors points to accommodate my not so nice experience so that I feel is how you handle your guests to make sure they keep coming back and I would stay there again it was in a great location most of my money stayed in the surrounding stores “Macy’s was definitely one of them.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is very centrally located. Just a few minutes walk to the nearest metro station or Time Square. The front desk staff and restaurant staff members were all extremely nice, competent, and helpful. The breakfast was amazing as usual and it was great to have the afternoon reception. It was like a party each night. The only complaint is that the rooms are really for only 2 people, they are cramped, which is the usual for NYC, but we were 3. The Rooms come with a pull out couch and it is a pain to make it up each night. Just a recommendation for those who are thinking about 3 to a room. The floors are dark wood and seem to show everything. The bathrooms were very clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was in need of a weekend getaway, so I booked this hotel.1) When I first walked in I turned on the TV in the living room area it wasn't working. I called the front desk. After while maintenance arrived and fixed the TV.2)I went to use the restroom. Upon closing the door I saw hair on the back of the door. Feeling disgusted I checked the shower where I then found another hair on the shower wall. I then cleaned the entire bathroom with the Lysol spray and wipes that I traveled with.3)Feeling highly parched after doing so, I looked for the complimentary water I'm supposed to receive on every stay. Unfortunately it wasn't provided.4) I received an email alert about 3:45 in the morning stating the hotel had just charged me a $50 charge. Later that morning I called the front desk to inquire about the charge, I was told it was a hotel error and the money should go back to my account in a couple of days.5) I ordered room service. I was overcharged for a item that showed $21 on the menu. When the bill arrived they charged me $24. The attendant was given the wrong room, therefore once I received my food it was cold and disappointing. I paid $8 for two bottles of water that should've been free. They charge two room services fee. One was $8 and the other was $3.6) Sunday morning I was awakened by loud music being played by the room attendant.7) The cleaning cart remained in front of my room throughout my stay. It was definitely a eyesore.What was supposed to be a relaxing weekend getaway actually turned into a weekend of nightmares. I didn't partake in the breakfast or managers reception because I just wanted to sleep in.The two stars was for the comfortable bed and the friendly staff at the front desk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The breakfast was fabulous. The location of the hotel was very convenient to the public bus line and the subway line. There were many restaurants nearby to choose from. The hotel room was very clean and seemed new. The workout room was very convenient to use during my stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful! The hotel room was quiet for sleeping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel was superb, for the price and location. I would highly recommend this hotel for the service, food, price and location. Unlike other hotel in the area, the Embassy Suites has quality food, especially the breakfast!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suites used to be "suites." These aren't. They are long, narrow rooms. The hotel has been recently re-built (I was told that what was in its place was razed and they built this one).While the rooms are small, it's the trend in NYC. The bed was comfortable, but I kept banging my shins on the platform (it's not padded) when getting in. My room had the closet in the bathroom, which would be inconvenient for more than one person in the room. I think they have larger rooms; this was at the lower HHonors rate. So, look for larger with more than one person.The elevators were very fast, and there were many of them. You won't wait long. The stairs are all over. I was on the 5th floor, and had great access to the 4th floor dining room for breakfast just by walking down one flight of stairs.The amenities are very good for a Midtown hotel. The HVAC was fine, but had a lower limit of 68 in the winter, and even when not on ECO mode, the fan would turn off after a few hours of non-movement in the room.The breakfast was excellent with made-to-order omelet station and plenty of other fare.They have complementary beer/wine in the evening, which was just fine to end the day before a dinner.The location was very good. Great access to Javits and not far from the theaters (although you probably wouldn't want to walk).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is very well situated in midtown Manhattan. It offers nice views on the Empore State building.Rooms are small (but we are in Manhattan!) but clean. It is no luxury hotel, quite basic, but functional. Be aware that there is a fridge in every room, but it is empty, so, if you check-in late and need a snack, buy it at the reception before you go up. I believe that at least a small bottle of water in the room would be a better way to welcome the guest, but the management choice is obviously to save on cost, so all you will have is the small coffee machine that (nearly) all hotels have in the US.The staff is reasonably friendly and professional.Breakfast is included in the room price, but of poor quality (although I appreciated the fresh uncut oranges, thank you for this!).Last thing: if you book a taxi at the reception, they will get you one of these higher end cars, not a normal yellow car, and you will be overcharged: unpleasant!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As a Hilton member, I tried to book this hotel last year but it was still not ready for our stay. We were transferred to Homewood Suites instead ... so this year, I was excited to book at Embassy Suites. It was not bad and the location is perfect - but my next trip to the city will summon me back to Homewood Suites. I booked and confirmed a King Suite with a view. The bad - Check in was at 4 ... we arrived around 3 and were told it wasn't ready. Since it was New Year's Day, we completely understood and said we'd be back. We got back by 5:30pm and the room still wasn't ready. Eager to checkin and get ready for dinner, we settled for a smaller room that still guaranteed a King size bed and view. Small doesn't adequately decribe this room. There was barely room to walk around the bed. The bathroom was tiny - had no fan, little vanity space and a designer sink that splashed water all over the floor. The in-room refrigerator was inside a cupboard and did not have a stable mount so it wobbled; coffee maker was fine but not enough cups provided. There is a small bar - but it never seemed to be open or have a bartender and it isn't really a bar - it is in the corner of the lobby right in the open spot where guests check in. The good - the view was OUTSTANDING. The bed was very comfortable - got a good night's sleep - room was quiet. The 4-7pm reception available to Hilton members was excellent and a nice reward for members - I'm sure it must be wonderful in warmer weather when the terrace can be used. The breakfast buffet runs until 11:00am - unfortunately we got to breakfast at 10:30am and almost everything was gone and wait staff was already clearing out pans, etc. We settled for a few cold scrambled eggs - and some tiny muffins there was nothing else. However, from what we could see - it must have been great had we gotten there earlier. The location is perfect and an easy pick-up for Uber and taxi's. Macy's and Herald Square is around the corner and the walk to Penn Station was fine - was no need for an Uber or taxi. We usually stay at a Marriott or Hilton for our points - and lately used Hilton more than the Marriott. Perhaps the original room I booked would've been better because what I accepted was sub-par. They did however, credit me the difference on cost. Perhaps I'll give it another try but I can't say that definitively - too many other Hilton owned properties in the area to try instead. So as my title said - it was a mix for me but definitely not a write-off.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Service is excellent from beginning to end. Friendly staff. Clean room everyday. Free cocktails every day. First time staying at a hotel in NY city and it was a great experience. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It's our first time stay in an Embassy Suites unit. I had high expectation due to high rating. But sadly it's not the way I thought.We were assigned to a disabled-access-free room, which was not demanded and wasn't found until we went back late and only wanted a quick shower. The installation of shower and the cabin is for disabled person, so we are taller than shower head, and no shelf to place shampoo/soap inside the cabin.Moreover, one side of the mattress has depression that is much more softer, which cause back pain to my husband the next day.I'll stay at other place nearby next time

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Would recommend to a couple or even family visiting New York for the weekend. Easy to get around, breakfast and evening reception can get busy very quickly so choose times accordingly. Rooms are clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Checking-in New Year’s day, in an extremely busy lobby, facing probably not the friendliest of staff, but I could understand because they were understaffed and over-worked. Eventually, I was assigned a room that frankly wasn’t what I wanted. So I went back downstairs, and by then Dahiana was the only person at the front desk. All types of custmers were asking for all kinds of things: a ligher, a chocolate bar, info on breakfast, where to get pizza in Manhattan. (I know, right?). She answered everyone with patience and a smile and also helped me tremondously with assigning the right room. Honestly, without her help, I probably would have given the overall experience a lower rating, but she made all the difference and clearly understands the business of hospitality. Thank you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, new, clean, staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcomed. The rooms were small but different and enjoyable. The waterfall that is in the lobby is pretty cool also. I’m looking forward to staying there again in the very near future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It is with regret and disappointment I find myself having to write directly to you to share with you my family’s total disappointment with the Hilton Hotel Embassy suites Manhattan New York.I have spent 6 weeks organising and arranging with my daughter’s boyfriend asurprise wedding proposal, for this purpose eventwe choose the Hilton Hotel based on his reputation as one of one of the leading hotels. We had flown 5 family members from the United Kingdom solely to share in this excitement and be a part of this wedding proposal, which was arranged as a surprise for my daughter. I personally booked the room, on behalf of my daughters partner, under his details havingspoken to many Hilton agents and the hotel direct to ensure the correct room type was selected for this solepurpose, explaining to them its importance and our requirements as a customer.The Reservation was booked well in advance, 3rd Dec and the Hilton agent reassured me several times the room, had been “lockdown” under our booking and there would be no issues upon check-in.Having had this assurance, and trust built we opted to select Hilton as the venue of choice, based on the fact it had this sky terrace where we could arrange for a photographer, musician etc., which we now deeply regret now.We obtained a “booked confirmation” that clearly reads the room type we booked along with the special notes highlighting and providing details on the event and reservation being made for conduct a surprise wedding proposal.We sought support from the hotel direct who advised us which room would be perfect, giving us the terrace for a terrace rooftop style venue as a proposal , and the view of the Empire state building. The hotel agent supplied theactual room number reassuring that particular was free and she had booked it so ensure no one else could be allocated that particular room. I asked for confirmation of this a number of times and a number of times from 3 separate Hilton staff members at the hotel I was advised everything was in hand and correct.. 12emails were exchanged, with a named contact and the main hotel group email address confirming this, 7 personal calls which I had made from the UK to the hotel direct again to ensure the room type, roomnumber/reservation was in hand and each time I received reassurances the room that was quoted was on file and booked!
