Each time I was reassured/promised everything was taken care off, they understoodthe importance of getting this right and for me to not to worry I was “in safe hands” .On the 5th Jan 2018 before we left from the UK I again made a call, and was again told not to worry everything had been taken care of and an early check-in of 3pm had been notes on file too. (7th Jan 2019 upon check a few hours ahead of the “bride to be’s arrival ,we found ourselves having a conversation with the check in desk advising the room they had confirmed several times , was in fact already occupied by other guests and the hotel had made an error!!! How this error had happened they didn’t understand, neither were they able to provide a valid explanation, in-fact, I heard excuses, which insulted my intelligence, when I tried to ask for an explanation and resolution to the problem Hilton hotel had created . At one point they denied it was their fault and passed the blame to Hilton reservations team, and then the Hilton Honours IT! I HAD TO INTERJECT WITH INFORMING THEM IT WAS THIS VERY SAME HOTELI HAD 12 EMAIL EXCHANGES AND 7 PHONES CALL WITH! .We showed the confirmation print out which stated KING BED STUDIO WITH VIEW & BALONY 518 USD per night. We were left at reception for an hour trying to understand what had gone wrong and advised by the hotelthere was nothing they could do, no other room like for like was available andthey couldn’t ask the occupants to vacant the room! Yet they could leave us stranded, without the room we had booked, received confirmation on, and had based our whole international trip around. We were left with no otherchoice but to cancel the photographer & musician and were left with little choice but accepting a room without a terrace, and room we had all our plans based around, including the layout and floor sixe etc. The hotel offered us a much smaller room, which is no compensation for the upset caused and inconvenience. The space offered was way too small for the photographer and his equipment and the musician , us, and having being left with 2.5 hrs to my daughters arrival it left us with our hands tied and having to accept just anyroom. Had this been the case we wouldn’t have travelled all the way to New York booked this particular hotelhad we known we would have been forced to do the proposal in a hotel room with a terrace, If I was going to do thissurprise in just any room, I could have done this in any hotel, in the UK ! This incompetency by the Hilton hotel has totally ruined what should have been one of the most magical trips, leaving us stressed and very upset that we will not have photos capturing the moment , ambience and moments we had expected and planned for .No amount of compensation will cover the heart break resulted by the Hiltons failure, for which a mere “Sorry” is un-expectable .For the Hilton this is brand damaging and we would never recommend anyone to entrust Hilton gain.  Customer care, trust & confidence totally shattered Not what anyone would have expected from a Hilton

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Unfortunately August may not be the best time to visit this establishment. My previous stays in Hilton hotels were at the Grand Place in Brussels and the Molino Stucky in Venice. Thus by comparison this seemed terrible.However the beds were comfortable and the location excellent. Don't know why the closet was in the bathroomBreakfast was abundant if overcrowded and more like a dinerHowever suppose it reflects the price

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a disaster from start to finish. We were vacationing the weekend before Christmas and choose this location for its proximity to shopping, Broadway and Christmas markets in Midtown.The only thing we enjoyed was the location.First off don't expect Embassy Suite Rooms. They are tiny. Functional but tiny.Second, the toilet was broken and wasn't fixed for two days. They had no other rooms or recourse for us. But really? (I was given points for the issue but really should have been remedied right the first night)Finally, the breakfast area was a mess. Sloppy, disorganized and the staff was not helpful or friendly. Overall a very negative experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Spent the weekend in NYC. I had done some research beforehand, so knew what to expect. Centrally located between Herald Square, and Times Square. About a 15 minute walk from Grand Central Station.Check in was easy, friendly front desk staff.Our room was a suite. Like I said, I read the reviews, so understood the layout and size of the suite was different than most Embassy Suites it is small and compact, but for the 2 of us, it was fine. The bed was comfortable, the couch was comfortable for a nap. There is a small refrigerator and microwave. 2 TV’s. Small bathroom with not much counter space, but a nice shower.The nice thing about this hotel is the expansive breakfast options and evening reception (aka Happy Hour). The area for both of these is tightly packed, but if you figure out the peak times, you can manage the crowds.Now a couple of drawbacks, which prevented me from giving a rating of 5. 1) We were gone from our room from 8:00a-4:00p. We got back from all day sightseeing. Our room had never been made up. We arrived back to an unmade bed, and our used towels still on The floor. Within 5 minutes of getting back to the room housekeeping showed up. We were exhausted, so just asked for fresh towels. 2) We used up the roll of toilet paper. There was not a spare roll in the room. I’ve never stayed in a room without an extra roll of TP. One of the things I read in previous reviews was the wait for the elevators could be long. This was true, esp when going to and from breakfast. Patience required.Overall a great value and would certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very modern hotel but a bit too compact. I felt too crowded for the 3 of us. The storage closet was very small. There was no room to open up your suitcase to unpack. The closet was made for minimal storage.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As expected small rooms like most in NYC, excellent staff service , breakfast was acceptable, sofa bed was the worst we've seen ,super uncomfortable.If it wasn't for the super uncomfortable sofa bed this review would have been a 5 stars because the service we received from the staff was excellent, from the check in to check out experience help was top notch.Next time I'd rather have two beds than a Suite with a separate sofa bed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Unfortunately my wife and I just stayed in this hotel for one night; however, we were lucky to know about it and to find a room for our stay!Breakfast included and really nice!Outstanding location, near Times Square and all the attractions surrounding!Absolutely easy to move to and from Newark Airport, since the express bus leaves you by the Bryant Park, which is just about 5 minutes walking.Highly recommended!Definitely will be our first option to stay, next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here from the 30st of dec till the 3rd of January 2019. We had a room on the 31st floor, that was nice, but they only have 3 elevators, so you have to wait for a while Everytime. from the room we can see the empire State building that was nice! The breakfast area is very small, it's hard to find a table. This hotel is close to times square, so the location is perfect!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The 'new' Embassy Suites do indeed meet the needs of a tourist or a business person; the location, the service, and the benefits are timely and convenients.The staff are friendly and helpful, the chef is amazing and the marketing folks were open to feedback and ideas.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall, I give this hotel a 5 star review. Not a suite, but has divider between bed and living area. We slept four comfortably with a King bed and double pullout sofa. No roll-away beds available. New hotel and everything updated. Best possible location in NYC. We walked everywhere between Central Park and Wall Street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 4 days + 3 nights over New Year's Eve so I feel like some of my experiences may be isolated due to the time of year we stayed (probably busier than "normal"). The Managers Reception from 5-7pm daily is SUCH a nice perk! We got there right at 5 (a little bit before that on NYE) and at 6 another day, and were able to get a table all three days. People pile up the food, so they may run out. But it's a nice, included perk and I was just grateful for a "free" glass of wine and some snacks before dinner in NYC. Some of the snacks were pretzel bites, bruchetta, cookies, etc.The included breakfast was always delicious! But, as other reviews have mentioned, the dining area is small and tables are at a premium. So, go knowing you may have to wait for a table or plan to bring your food back to your room if you can find a tray. Of our three mornings, we always had a spot, but there were only two of us. May be more of a challenge for larger groups. . The biggest confusion for people (myself included on morning #1) is they have a kiosk on the wall where you enter the cooked-to-order eggs you want. There are so many other hot breakfast items (the bacon was delicious!) But omelets are definitely the main attraction. There are only 3 elevators for 35+ floors of rooms. So, be prepared to wait. I was put off by this at first, but my Brother In Law travels to NY regularly for work and said we were lucky to have three as he's stayed at hotels with only one! We were on the 35th floor and decided that if we went back we'd pick a lower floor so we could just use the stairs. We paid for a "room with a view", but I don't think the upcharge was worth it. Attached a picture of our view. You can decide!Our flight was early so we got to the hotel well before check-in and they stored our luggage. When we arrived back at 5PM the room I selected on the Hilton Honors app wasn't available so they gave us a room by the elevator, which I was nervous about, but it ended up being fine. No noise. Our room was tiny (12x18 maybe?) but it's New York, where space is at a premium, so that wasn't a surprise. We had an issue with our bill and the manager was very helpful and friendly and listened to my complaint and remedied the situation immediately. The hotel is SO conveniently located. We walked to everything (Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State Building) and there is a Subway stop around two blocks away. I'd absolutely stay here again! Just, on a lower floor and won't mess with a "room with a view" because we barely spent any time in our room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Booked a quick trip to NYC to see all the Christmas decorations and see the Rockettes. We booked a one night stay for the Embassy Suites. The location was good. We walked everywhere. The rooms are small, but nice comfortable beds and very clean. We were only in the room to sleep. The breakfast is amazing as usual for the Embassy Suites. Made to order omelettes, scrambled eggs, sausage, fruit, cereal, etc... The staff at the front desk were great! We actually arrived very early in the morning before check in time and planned on checking our luggage. Because my husband is a Hilton Gold member, they checked us into our room at arrival. I would definitely stay at this location again! We really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Mixed review on this place. It's newer hotel and the location is ideal. Within walking distance to the subway, Herald Sq, Bryant Park and many other must see places. The cons of this place may be isolated instances and due to the busy time of year (Dec). We are Diamond Hilton members, made our reservations months in advance and when we checked in at 9 pm we got a 3rd floor room in a 35 floor hotel. We didn't receive housekeeping for two days, had to call four times and wait an hour before our room was cleaned up at 7 pm. The free breakfast and manager's reception are hosted in a small area with A LOT of people; we showed up and immediately left. One night we were resting in our room and heard someone fiddling with our bedroom lock. My husband opened the door and saw a man trying to unsuccessfully open our door. My husband questioned the man, he replied he was with the hotel and checking the locks. We went to the front desk to alert them of an attempted break in and they confirmed it was a hotel staff member checking locks. Had we received an advanced notice from the hotel letting us know of the scheduled safety check, or if the man would have showed his hotel ID, we may not have been as startled as we were - the event ruined the rest of our evening. Overall, the hotel is fine, but I will not stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: but the elevators and food service was horrible. My sister booked us two rooms in the hotel that was supposed to be connected but that didn't happen. We had two problems. the first were the elevators. They were slow and you couldn't get on at times. The second was the food service. It was ciaos down there with no seats available. We left and went to pay for breakfast because there were no employees directing the traffic. They should have also directed the elevator flow there too, people kept jumping in ahead of the people waiting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Arriving at the Embassy suites - was surprised to find such a late check in of 4pm - not that the room was ready by then ! Waited around in the lobby for the room for over 30 minutes - we later found some guests that were waiting for over 3 hours for their room. Rooms were clean and functional for 2 people - we were traveling with our daughter so she had the sofa bed - the maintenance man was called as the sofa bed was jammed. We played hunt the sheets / blanket and pillow game - under the main bed. The sofa bed was never put away by cleaning staff - so room wasn't cleaned well. Lack of storage for clothes was an issue - everything was compact - travel light. So what we didn't get told - there is a fee bar and stacks every day from 5 until 7 - prepare for a bun fight to get a drink / table ( we found this out when we sat at the lobby bar 2 days in - we made a fuss and got a drinks voucher for the lobby bar ) . Breakfast was the same - lack of sitting space - a number of guests just piled up the food and went back to their rooms. In all good location, staff could try harder, no airport transfer ( a DIY job ) and over crowded in key areas. For a Hilton chain hotel I would have excepted better. Tom the barman was very friendly - sadly bar only opens from 5pm until late - similar prices to other local bars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Location was closed to midtown attractions. I liked its social hour and made to order omelette breakfast. King bedroom was comfortable, but not spacious for a suite, compared to Homewood Suite we stayed previously in midtown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Please take the time to read my review, because it is very honest and reflects the full experience. Check in, friendly staff and all that. However I don’t understand why the hotel wants 50 dollars/day (?!) reserved on my credit card. The motivation was extremely poor! We stayed for 10 days. They tell you that they don’t charge it, but you still must have the Full amount on your card. For some reason the staff don’t understand the meaning of credit on a credit card and I feel that is very strange. We travel all over the world and we have never the full amount on our card for Security reasons!Complimentary Breakfast: The food was good and the chef made a good omelette. A New built 4 star hotel with plastic cutlery and plastic plates, come on! Are you kidding me? Don’t refer to the Christmas holidays, as You didn’t see that coming! This is Not what I payed for!The Suite:We stayed in a studio suite King, with a view. View towards Macy’s and Empire State Building. Nice view, but not worth the extra bucks. Very good sound isolation, it was silent as a grave. Chargers on several locations = Spot on. When you build a new hotel, please try to add some hooks on the walls to your guest can hang some clothes. I don’t think a couple of hooks blows your whole budget.....A tip from an experienced traveler. There is plenty of space to put hooks behind the door! Cleaning: Trash in every corridor, cleaning trolleys all over the place. This is Not what I expect to pay for in a 4 star hotel!We started to tip the cleaning staff from day one, but the cleaning in our room was not up to expectations! Location in New York/Manhattan: 100% spot on. Overall: Lack of Credit card knowledge. 2 adults and a child in a studio suite without hooks. Plastic cutlery(!!). Trash everywhere. That comes done to a mediocre rating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Came into the city early on Saturday and hotel stored our luggage until check-in. Checked-out Sunday and they stored our luggage until we returned from our broadway show (5pm). Staff were awesome and very helpful. Studio suite was small, but it’s NYC. Free breakfast was excellent but a little crazy. Go early. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 1 night (having stayed in an Airbnb for the previous 4 which wasn't fantastic) as a last night in town treat and boy, were we happy we did!I booked it on my Hilton app and got a great rate which included breakfast (£152).We opted for a standard suite and it was lovely and came with all the expected trimmings.The evening was made all the better as there was a complimentary bar for 2 hours which included wines, beers etc.Breakfast in the morning was very good indeed and buffet style so you could go mental.We checked out quite early as there was no point in clogging up the room from the cleaners.The hotel has a baggage room so we were able to leave our cases and spend all morning continuing our travels around the city until our coach transfer to JFK at 2pm.This was a fantastic end to our 5 day break and if we ever come back to the Big Apple we will most definitely stay here again.100% recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Rooms are small not like other Embassy Suites but not a big deal if they had more storage space like a dresser. We were 3 in the room and managed with the space by inventing our own storage space where ever we could. Breakfast was good but go early otherwise you end up in a cluster of a thousand guests. The flow is a bad layout. Not my favorite place we’ve stayed but great location!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great hotel. Quiet clean and in safe area. Garment District technically so not a lot of restaurants close but easy to get to a lot of sites and locations. Complimentary breakfast was great. Full of options and fresh ripe fruit. Not your plain muffin and old coffee. Complimentary drink at end of day was nice. Fitness center on 2 was good My only complaint.... Hotel, except for lobby is TOO HOT. constant heat. heated floors in bathroom always on. Dry as well. Everyone I worked with said they woke with nose bleeds it was that dry. Luckily casement windows open a crack. Not sure how eco friendly with heat pumping nonstop. I will go back again for business.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: wasn't overly thrilled with this hotel. rooms are really small , bathroom super tight and I had no hot water which was kind of "poo poo'd" when I called the front desk at 6am. She said "you have hot water"....I said "no, i do not"....her response "yes you do"...."no I do not"...etc. Asked if I could wait until 7am for the maintenance guy to come in. No I could not. Took a cold shower. Won't stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed 2 nights before Christmas. we had an updated room with a view and it was amazing. Room as clean and updates were done very well. Only thing is the elevators took forever , which is expected for such a tall building

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First of all I am a kind of picky person, let me say that this hotel totally delivered. You could not ask for a better location. Was just minutes walking distance to times square, Rock fell a plaza and so much more. The staff here was outstanding. The parking was reasonable. We were looking to regain the Christmas spirit, boy did New York and the Embassy Suites deliver. Complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails were a plus and a bonus for you to choose this hotel. Believe me when I say that this hotel is conveniently located near everything that you want to see. Once again great staff. Thank you Hilton for an enjoyable experience!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed here from 21st December 2018 to 26th December 2018, with my wife and 5-year old son. We arrived late afternoon on the Friday and were greeted with a reception/foyer area that was rather busy - the hotel is very busy generally and it only takes a few guests to congregate in reception and it becomes quite ‘packed’ and confusing. There is a magical water feature which kept our son entertained whilst I checked in. Delightful and attentive check-in staff who were aware of the ‘package’ (aka son’s Xmas presents) that we’d had arranged to be delivered to the hotel! We had a ‘room with a view’ on the 37th Floor, Room 3707. It certainly didn’t disappoint, the view that is - we had a wonderful vista of the Empire State Building. The room is what you would expect of New York, quite a lot squeezed in and little room to manoeuvre. There is very little space around the bed and at least one point in the stay the entire family ‘bumped’ feet and/or legs into the side of the bed. The lounge area is nice and alongside the regular coffee making machine there is a big sofa, microwave and fridge. Storage is a problem - there just isn’t enough. One pull out drawer and room to only hang a few items - this is a real let down, particularly as we are travelling for 15 days in total and have a lot of luggage.Bath/shower area is great, spacious and has everything you’d expect. Breakfast is served on the 4th Floor in the Embassy Lounge and has a good selection of items. The made to order omelette section is particularly good - you order your omelette on a digital screen selecting fillings, egg type etc. The downside of breakfast - served on plastic plates with plastic crockery that is prone to ‘snapping’ when you attempt to cut anything. However this changed after a few days and crockery and plates were made available. Drinks also served in plastic and paper cups. We had access to the lounge in the evenings for drinks and light snacks - we attempted to go twice during our five night stay but it was just too busy and we didn’t make it in. The one night we made it in was great - good selection of wines, beers and house spirits. We did have to raise the issue of the cleanliness of the room and the lack of replenishment of coffee, creamer etc on a couple of occasions and this was dealt with promptly. And on the issues people have raised with the lifts - we had no problems. In summary a well positioned hotel (10min walk to Times Square); very friendly and helpful staff and acceptable rooms. With a few minor tweaks to the rooms, breakfast and evening lounge it would have been a perfect stay. Stayed with my wife and 5 year old son. We’ll be back for another stay from 30th December 2018 to 4th January 2019!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room and view were nice, bed comfy. The heat was crazy room would be too hot or too cold, seemed like the thermostat had a mind of its own.Location was good for Times Square but a good track to Rockefeller Center and uptown to Central Park area. Night staff with drinks were great wish the night reception went to 8 we missed it the first two nights. Breakfast was good need some improvement on omelette making timelines and cooked a bit more. Staff replenishes some items and forgets others. Price was high for Embassy Suites, check in staff very good and appreciated the luggage storage and late check out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location is very good near the shopping centre and restaurant,it is difficult to park the car and the room is very compact because having the partition to separate the bed and sofa. Overall is nice

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Spending Christmas in NYC and wanted to give a shout out to Embassy Suites Midtown! Service has been first rate and the facility is absolutely top notch! We have an Incredible view room of the Empire States building. While it’s not exactly the typical 2-room suite experience you expect from Embassy Suites it’s top notch for hotel space in NYC! Special shout out to an outstanding happy hour staff, John and Jackson are as good as it gets and represent everything I have come to expect from Embassy Suites as a premier service provider!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I took my son to NYC so he could apply for his visa for his trip to Austria. I got stuck in the elevator, but the staff got us out quickly and made it right. I would stay there again. It also has a great location!Close to everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room was small, elevators are terrible, consider walking up 14 flights just to avoid the long wait times. Ditto for breakfast and the complimentary drinks. Stay some where else, not the typical Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We enjoy the Embassy Suites brand and the Midtown location in Manhattan lived up to our expectations. Everything from start to end was excellent. Our room was always neat and clean. The view of the Empire State building was beautiful. The hotel's location was very convenient. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Thank you for making our first trip to NYC a memorable one!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was a good choice for three friends traveling together for an early December holiday trip to NYC who wanted to be near Times Square, the Theater District and walk to Rockefeller Center and MOMA. The hotel staff were attentive and excellent problem solvers who provided great customer service every time we had a request. Our room was clean and spacious by New York city standards, with a queen bed and pull out sofa bed. While within walking distance to many midtown/Times Square attractions, the hotel is on a quiet city side street, making getting a good night's sleep easier. Our requests for bedding for the sofa bed and repair of our shower which was leaking water onto the bathroom floor were quickly met. Not easily resolved were the hotel's incredibly slow elevators. During our visit one elevator even broke down and trapped guests for awhile. We often took the stairs and shared the frustration of other guests who would form lines in the lobby waiting for elevators. Hopefully the hotel will be able to resolve this issue. We enjoyed the complimentary full breakfast in the morning which included made to order omelets and a great variety of fruits, cereals, pastry and other options. We did not enjoy the lack of dining space and the often not clean tables in the breakfast dining area. Again the hotel staff did their best trying to help guests by pointing out additional dining space on other floors and offering to go containers but a process improvement is in order with this area as well. This is not an inexpensive hotel to stay in and I'm hopeful that the challenges with the elevators and seating for breakfast will be improved because the location is great and the staff really cares about guest satisfaction. I would still recommend the hotel to families or friends who want a more spacious room and be able to walk to many NYC attractions near midtown but be on a quieter side street, away from the noise and lights of Times Square. Just be ready to take the stairs and head to breakfast early or late.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is our second stay at the hotel in a month. Nice location, friendly staff, comfortable bed. Breakfast good and staff handles it well. Our first stay was nicer than the second.We had a maids cart outside our room the entire stay. Our room had ironing board standing against wall. I guess the hook in closet was broke. Thermostat was out of whack about 10 degrees off. Time on Alarm clock could not be seen. Only 1 drawer in the room!!!!! The evening reception food was disappointing. Room 704 if management would like to address. Maid should make them aware of this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed at location for a conference at the Javitz. Hotel is convenient to Javitz with a quick Uber or Taxi. Hotel is fairly new. Rooms are clean and comfortable but small. This is expected for a NYC hotel. Complimentary Breakfast & Evening Reception are nice perks in NYC where nothing is free and usually expensive. Front Desk employees need better training. They seem slow and confused at times. Also, surprised and dissapointed when Room was not ready at 4:30PM and had to wait 20 minutes in the lobby for Front Desk to get "all clear" from housekeeping. Otherwise would recommend hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I travel a lot for business and leisure and use the Embassy Suites brand when possible. When I saw an Embassy Suites now open in midtown New York City, I booked it, a great NYC decision. The hotel and the staff made it a very nice stay!
user_name:
Mickey F
wsahington, dc, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice hotel but more of a boutique hotel. Happy hour was great and breakfast was great. Only complaints I have are the rooms are really small and the elevators cannot keep up with the 39 floors. If you are at the top be prepared to wait, especially during breakfast and happy hour! Otherwise a nice hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Wonderful experience at the Embassy Suites Midtown. Everybody was very accommodating, specially Cleopatra Brown who was very responsive to my messages & even had a little surprise sent to the room my daughters birthday, which was was the reason of our trip. Breakfast was amazing & the location was the best. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suites is a Hilton property and as a Hilton Honors member I have stayed at Hilton properties all over the country. This hotel just doesn't live up to what I expect from the Hilton name.First the pro: The staff are professional and accommodating. The hotel is spotless, and the location is in the heart of manhattan.The con: If you have stayed at an Embassy Suite property in other areas your expectations of what your room will be are sure to disappoint you. This is Not an all suite hotel. The room is not a suite, but a regular hotel room, and a small one at that.We stayed here on Thanksgiving weekend, so the hotel was full. Our room was on the 32nd floor. Nice for views, but a horror to get to since the hotel only has 3 elevators. In the mornings we waited 15 minutes for an elevator that was not full.Also, because of the number of guests trying to get breakfast around the same time the dining area could not handle it, and people had to eat their food standing in the hallway.Bottom line: I would not stay in this hotel again. There are too many other options in NYC to have to subject yourself to the aggravation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: What a room well worth the money, the views are outstanding. The breakfasts were great if a bit busy. Not only is room 2609 the only room with a terrace it also has a ice making machine outside the door.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Our first visit to NYC from the UK and I am so glad that we chose this hotel. It is newly built, immaculatly clean, and even offers free daily breakfast and complimantary drinks and snaks between 5pm and 7pm every day. The hotles location is fab as it is near to transport links, Macy's, lots of resturant choices and only a few blocks from times square. We were on floor 25 and faced out the back of the hotel with views of Herald square and and amazing close up of the Empire state building. Upon checking into our room we were gobsmacked with the view and how beautiful the rooms are. We didn't get a suite room as such but the room we were in was beautiful with a sofa at the end of the bed and large wall mounted TV. Bathroom is beautiful and ample towels and Neutrogina tiletries changed by housekeeping daily. The free breakfast was a great suprise which saved us a fortune on food and drinks in the morning. Lots of choice of hot and cold drinks, cereals, breads, muffins, pastries, muffins, yoghurts and hot breakfast items such as sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, French toast ect. Much more choice than ever expected and they even have an omelette station where you can get made to order eggs and omelette. All staff from housekeeping and maintenance to managment of the hotel were very accommodating and could not do enough to help what ever the request. I would like to say a special thank you to Glen from housekeeping who we met accidentally in the elevator who went way above and beyond his role. He not only helped us with directions and transport queries but even took us outside and spent 15 minutes trying to flag us a taxi down during New Yorks crazy rush hour. Along side all of the hotels other positive atributes it is the hotels workers such as Glen and others that we met that made our first trip to NYC less scary and very enjoyable. I would highly reccomended this hotel and will definatley be staying with them again when we return to New York. Not a bad word to say about Embassy suites by hilton manhatten.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband, myself and our adult son spent 5 nights here. Once you walk out the front door, you’re in the hustle and bustle of NYC! Most places are only 10-15 minutes walk away. The subway is a couple of minutes away. Plenty of places to eat nearby. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our window, loved watching our for the different colours every night. The breakfast buffet was very good, busy but plenty of food to choose from. It snowed while we were there, very cold but the hotels as lovely and cosy. Reception were very helpful, arranging a late checkout, 2pm, free of charge. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Enjoy New York, a place everyone should experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was checked in by Craig, who was exceptional, very friendly. The room was a little small but it was nicely put together. The only problem I encountered was the fire alarms going off and on at 10:30 AM. It would have been nice to be notified prior that the alarms were going to be tested.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We enjoyed staying at this property. The evening receptions and complementary breakfast along with the great central location in Manhattan makes this a great NYC hotel. Slow elevator service is the only bad thing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights with some friends who had never been to New York before so we chose for its central location.The hotel is nicely decorated, modern.The staff were always helpful, were we had a small issue they were straight on it.Breakfast was good although the eating area is small and gets crowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed from 27/11/18 - 29/11/18 with my wife. Brilliant hotel and room 2609 had a huge balcony and stunning view of The Empire State Building. Really lovely , well located hotel and free bar in the evening (only used once though). Would definitely go back. Only problem was the lack of hot water each evening that I had to contact reception to get an engineer to sort it. That was disappointing. Otherwise I’d recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Being a member of Hilton HHonors, we always try to stay at Hilton Properties and were pleased to get a room at this location. Overall a great stay, yes breakfast was a bit chaotic, just not enough room, never got to the managers reception, but heard in the elevators that it was just as crowded as breakfast.The one irritant was really just no room for clothes in the room. If I may make a suggestion, get rid of the extra chair/bed and put in a unit with closet space, drawers for clothes and a place to sit for business in that space that seemed wasted. All Hamptons seem to have this unit and it is really useful and convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed before the Thanksgiving holiday.The room was very spacious, the room quality was very good. housekeeping was perfect during the stay.What was wrong? the dinning. at the first time of the breakfast - many things were missing. the staff didn't fill many of them. the area was too crowded and it was very hard to find a place to seat. I address that to the reception and all they say they are sorry.At the next days it was better, but the breakfast room was so small for the guests. we had to find tables and no one from the staff really cares about that.Happy hour was nice idea, but as the breakfast - the area just can't fit the guests. many of the guests just took some food and went to their rooms with disappointment on their faces.I would give 5 stars, but what happened in the dinning room reduce the review, I hope the hotel will take that very carefully.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was really happy to find this hotel on priceline and got a great rate! It was in a perfect location for us to walk to many places. And when we decided to take an Uber a few times, because it was so central it was always affordable. The room was very nicely appointed and always very clean. Breakfast choices were wide and even one morning when we came down five minutes before the ending time, food was still being replenished. Yes the breakfast/reception area was small..but we were always able to find a spot, and the staff are really good about getting tables cleared and cleaned. If you are a planner like me and with your family...just some things to note. We were on an eleven day trip along the East coast so we had a lot of luggage and things. The rooms are small...and I understand why. Everything in NYC is small...space is at a premium. When there are four in a family it is very tight so less is more when you are packing. The closet pretty much just holds your coats . I didn't find the two drawers under the bed until the second day. Haha. There is one very small drawer in the closet. There are no self serve laundry facilities in the hotel and the front desk person told me there are none nearby. The parking garage that is attached to the hotel is NOT owned by the hotel. You pay about $60 a day and once they drive your car in you don't see it until you get it out. This was something different for us - another thing I wish I had known. Not complaining about any of this as I totally get it all - just thought I would pass on the info. This hotel is great and I would definitely stay again. I always felt safe and welcome there. Also...I not once heard any noise from any other guests or employees - not from other rooms or the hallway. When our drapes were closed at night it was also quiet. We were on the 24th floor and had a nice view of Macy's and other buildings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location, breakfast and reception were great. Staff was very nice for the most part.... Front of House was great, bell hops great, only issue is with the superintendent who was rude:( We had an emergency to get into our room, and he didnt want to be bothered

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Poor example of Embassy Suites brand. Far too many guests for the space provided for breakfast. No seating and long linesRooms are not suites but rooms with a 4 foot divider separating them. Phone did not work upon arrival

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Excellent staff and offerings. Location is amazing and so close to Macy's and Times Square. Really close to the subway station as well. Great breakfast offerings and complementary evening reception. Easy to walk to all the main attractions in Midtown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, small unit... but nice.... only issue was seating at reception hour and breakfast difficult to find. The lower floor was open due to overflow crowd... I would stay again. The sky lawn wasn't opened that was disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the Embassy Suites in October - the location is excellent - close to the Empire State Building, walking distance to a lot of tourist attractions, and close to several subway stations. The check-in and checkout went smoothly and quickly, all staff we encountered were very helpful and efficient. We stayed in a King Room with View. The room was spacious - as we have previously stayed in a New York hotel that was very cramped, we were worried this would be the same - but it was very comfortable, and the king size bed very comfortable. We stayed on 26th floor and had a skyline view. The hot water was not working one (very cold, early) morning - we reported it to the desk and it was fixed that day. Although we have read comments that lifts are slow, we never had problems with waiting for lifts. The free breakfast was great although the dining room is very small and it gets quite chaotic so we did not use it every day. On the day of checkout we were booked to leave on a cruise which was late leaving port - we were able to leave our bags at the hotel while we went and tried to fill in a few hours - on our return the delays continued but we were able to sit comfortably in the lounge area and wait to go to the port. We have no complaints about Embassy Suites and would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location is great for proximity to Broadway. The hotel is clean and good looking. The bed is comfortable. The breakfast was great, as expected from Embassy Suites and they had a very efficient omelet ordering system with guidance. The reception was nice, could have used a few more snacks but fresh fruit was appreciated. The bartenders were nice and the bussing of the tables was very efficient and kept up with turnover to ensure people had a clean place to sit. The front desk staff was very nice. The bell staff were doing a great job despite the amount of luggage they were toting. Especially impressive to me is that the attitude of EVERY staff member I interacted with was very positive and uplifting and helpful. Best atmosphere I have felt at a hotel in a long time, very much appreciate the positivity. I travel a lot and am generically a cynic and I think this is the first ever all 5's review I have given.
user_name:
doloresh548
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This location was perfect for walking to meetings, and if you want to visit Herald Square, it is a quick walk!The staff was very friendly, and the bellman gave me a Kit Kat, as he saw I had a long night ahead of me!Beds were great, very clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for the first time last week. I was thrilled with the level of service I received. Dominque at the front desk is amazing. I work in the hospitality industry, it takes a lot to impress me, and she did. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the food from Room Service was good. The room was decently sized, but the terrace was HUGE, and I appreciated the gorgeous view of the Empire State Building. I will definitely return to this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is convenient to the Subway and within walking distance of many the City's iconic locations. We had a king room on the 31st floor, with a view of the Empire State Building, Manhattan skyline, and Macy's. Staff is friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean. Note: Rooms are small compared to other Embassy Suite locations but this is New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The good - the staff, the cleanliness of the room, the bed, the locationThe OK - the room, we had a None-suite room, the closet is in the bathroom, little to no drawer space. It was OK for 2 but I'd probably get something bigger next time.The So So - More elevators are needed or the staff shouldn't be using the guest elevators. Lots of time spent waiting for elevators. - The Embassy Lounge for breakfast and the Manager Reception is too small. It was crowded even at the times that were said to be light. I'm use to an Embassy Suites being more open but I guess you have to make due with space in NYC.Overall a nice hotel and wonderful staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall the best thing about this hotel is the staff. Very friendly - especially front desk. The location is also nice - walkable to Times Square and easy walk to subway at Herald Square.Problem is mostly the noise issue. We did not sleep for three days. Each night the room made terrible creaking sounds and the walls were paper thin - you could hear every other door close on your floor and the people next door. Windows were good - you couldn’t hear the outside at all. The staff would sometimes congregate in the hallway and talk loudly as well which was annoying. The thermostat was sensor triggered so of course when you are sleeping it goes off and the room becomes very stuffy.Housekeeping never came once during our stay as we tried to take a nap in the afternoons and put up the do not disturb but there was so much noise from the other rooms couldn’t nap. And housekeeping never came back or left a note saying to call them if you needed anything. Overall the location was nice but we would not stay again as three nights without sleep were too much to handle.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed at Embassy Suites in midtown for three nights while in NYC for work.My room, a king room with a view, was in the 23rd floor and offered a view of Herald Square and also the Empire State Building.My room was quite spacious, with a large comfortable bed, and the room was separated with a high backed sofa, that also had a fold out table. Plenty of storage, two TVs, fridge and microwave, along with coffee making machine. The bathroom was clean and well laid out, with a shower that was a good size, water was a little tepid in my first morning, but subsequently, as hot as I wanted.Breakfast was busy, but this reflected the timing of my meetings, so it was probably peak time. Made to order omelettes on offer as well as a hot and cold selection, plenty of fruit so couldn’t fault that.The room was clean, there was little in terms of disturbing noise, and the reception team were extremely helpful at check in, and at check out, organised a cab for me etc.All in all, a good location, close to the subway, good shopping nearby and the lovely Bryant Park district. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for the first time for my wife’s birthday. Right away staff was amazing. Rooms a little small but very clean. Free made to order breakfast was amazing and i can’t say enough about the staff. I mentioned that we were here for my wife’s birthday and they were so nice. The next day checking out they said, how was your birthday to my wife. Really personable. Please keep up the great job!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Such a fun experience to stay in this hotel. It is brand new with beautiful little rooms. It is small but laid out very well to pack a big punch. We enjoyed walking to many locations and near by areas. The staff was very friendly offering an early check in and a fantastic breakfast - as always - with Embassy Suites. Definitely a beautiful little hotel with a great location. Will stay here again if I'm ever in NYC again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: To call this tiny room a suite is a joke. They started with a small room and crammed so much furniture in it that is was next to impossibe to move around. The street noise was obtrivsive even on the nineth floor. The complementary breakfast was fine but the dinning room was so crowded that it was difficult to find a seat. Most of the buffet items were gone an hour before the service stopped.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The embassy suit in New York City is a joke. There are no any rooms around bed and in the bathroom. Even no self to hold up the soap. The knocking noise kept on all night . There is no service for parking. It took me drive 20 min to find parking lot.
user_name:
Richardksng
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We spent two nights at this hotel and the room and service were excellent. The location is excellent for shopping and Times Square. Our room was very quiet despite the street traffic below. The happy hour and breakfast were great amenities. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We walked to 34th and 6th or 7th to reach each subway and it was only a few blocks. Easy access to get around Manhattan. Cocktail hour and breakfast is a nice perk. The staff is very friendly but the elevators are extremely slow.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a block of rooms for our wedding & this was the best experience ever! Our family & wedding guests loved the hotel. The entire staff was warm & quite welcoming. The rooms have great views of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location. Very friendly staff, Free breakfast. Standard rooms are small. Bathroom was not as clean as it should have been ! Overall a very good experience. I would stay there again. Bed was comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Complimentary breakfast and evening reception make this hotel the best choice! No roaming around trying to decide where to have breakfast, so we got our sightseeing started early every day! The location is perfect, near Macy’s and the Empire State Building, and a short walk to the Herald Square subway station.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was my first trip to New York City and I wanted a hotel that was updated and not in the thick of Times Square. The Embassy Suites was perfect for what I needed. The staff was nice, including housekeeping on the 17th floor and Anabelle, who checked me in. It's a newer hotel with updated rooms and comfortable bed. The free breakfast, which is standard at most Embassy Suites was good and the evening receptions, though not the best were adequate. The only advice I have for breakfast is to arrive early to beat the crowds. So I have no complaints about this facility and I will definitely stay here on my next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Expensive for what it is. Room 503 looked straight on to an old office block just across the street. When we arrived the room had not been cleaned properly - there was a smallish area under the desk covered in rice and crumbs (on the floor). Reception found us another room (1707) from which if we looked to the side we could see the Empire State Building. The rooms are pretty small and there is very little closet space. We were 3 in the room so it did feel quite small. We kept most of our clothes in our suitcases as not enough closet space fir more than one person if staying fir several days. The hotel is very centrally located, between 5th and 6th avenue but the street itself is not very nice. A positive is the reception and bar / breakfast staff are all very friendly and efficient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Have a few issues here, had a 4 night stay there;1) On my first night, it's 11:57 pm when I get back to my room, "maid in room" key is there and there is no maid in sight. No one ever came back to check on the room and I still have no idea how long the room was open for. 2) I use my coffee cups and drinking glasses pretty frequently and was given no new ones after two days. Even worse, I left a half-full coffee cup behind, only to find it sitting in the tray of the coffee machine 12 hours later like I was going to come back and drink it. At least give me some new cups3)No hot water in the shower 2 of the nights I was thereAbove all, I called down to discuss my issue with primarily #1, they said I could get some food comped up....well, that ended up being charged to my card anyway when I checked out but I was in a rush to get to work so I had no time to argue it. Essentially "let us help you, but we are going to charge you for it anyway"This hotel was a preferred partner of the company I work for, which is why I stayed there, but I'm probably going to reconsider this in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great location, great rooms and awesome views! Top notch service at the Heist Bar from bartender Ken Wong. I frequently stay here for business. The service and hotel staff are always great! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Not your typical Embassy Suites room size!! I really felt like I paid a lot of money/points for a Embassy Suites that did not represent very well. We stayed in a Hampton Inn our first visit much cheaper and I will go back there when we come back again or look at other places too. You pay a lot for not getting anything better room wise. Just do your search.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New hotel...great location! Bed was heavenly and comfortable. I have stayed at plenty of Embassy Suites and they were not like this one. This was definitely a step above for this particular brand. The breakfast was sufficient and staff were great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: When I asked about size of room, was told a Urban hotel location so smaller. But Embassy Suites in Chicago is also a Urban hotel location and so much more comfortable. Not interested in this location again, the Hilton down the street much nicer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Front desk folks were friendly and helpful. Location was good. They had an online checkin that was terrible. We had to choose a room that we knew nothing about and was just a room number. Even the checking staff were wondering why we ended up with that room. And they were sold out so we couldn't switch rooms. The room was tiny! We felt like we were in a closet and constantly bumping into each other. The temperature control was horrible. It would swing wildly from hot to cold. It would not permit a temperature less than 68 degrees. The breakfast was okay - the made to order omelette bar was best feature, but what if you didn't want an omelette? We stayed 5 nights. The evening reception was good in that the drinks were free. But the bartender that was there 4 nights was very rude and obnoxious - The snacks were very bad. Mostly chips and cheesy sauces - very poor. It was very disappointing for the high cost and would not stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had great stay here, my husband and I and teenage daughter were in a King Suite. My daughter had a double pull out sofa bed, which she said was comfortable. Our King bed was very, very comfortable! Breakfast was excellent, but don't wait until the last minute as some items will have gone. The chef Jorge does fabulous made to order omelettes.It's a new hotel so everything is lovely. The only suggestion I'd make is that we were stuck for storage space for our clothes and where to put our cases.. The desk and second TV on the wall would have been better used for drawers and more hanging space. Overall, the hotel is in a great location in midtown and minutes from a subway. We'd definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed for a couple days during a work visit to the city. The hotel location is fantastic for Manhattan activities of course, and the room rate was pretty reasonable considering NYC rates. My biggest frustration, which happened every time I came/went, was the time consumed waiting for the elevator either on the bottom floor or my roomFloor. Heck the hotel isn't super super tall, so the wait just seemed excessive. At one point, I even walked down over 10 floors of steps rather than wait. I like the location enough, but if I return, I'll booking a room on a low low floor for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: In midtown, there is literally every brand of hotel imaginable. Not all of them cater to the sub-executive business traveler, and none of them do it as well as Embassy Suites. I stay there because, even for an overnight stay, it feels a little more like home - with the separated couch/bed areas. For longer stays - it's even better. With the 2 eating areas, AND the outdoor theater - there is enough variety that you can feel like you did something after work, without actually slogging through midtown. Also - I will not comment on the quality/availability of the manager's evening reception (I never attend) or the breakfast (ditto).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel is fabulous. It’s an amazing spot and great location. Went to the bar for drinks and a snack and met Kenny. He was awesome! Friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. My work meeting was a huge success thanks to him. He even secured coveted dinner reservations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed at this hotel in October 2018 for 4 nights.Hotel is very clean and tidy, bedrooms are adequate with lovely shower room, wardrobe, safety deposit box, fridge, microwave and coffee machine. Bed was lovely and big and extremely comfortable.All guests get complimentary breakfast - served from 6am until 10am. Everything you want for breakfast - fresh omelette /egg station, bacon, sausage, potatoes, hard boiled eggs, bread rolls, fruit n yogurt, cakes, tea/coffee/fresh orange juice.Also between 5pm and 7pm complimentary drinks and snack bar which is lovely just before heading out. lager / wine and small selection of cocktails - perfect !!! Snacks were nachos/cheese/salsa/dips or carrot/celery/cheese/garlic dip. What a treat :)Hotel ideally located not far from Times Square / Broadway and eaxy access to subway which you can get everywhere you need to. Can't recommend this hotel enough

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here for a week with family. First off the rooms are of a good size, clean and include a fridge, microwave , hair dryer, iron and coffee machine. The views from the rooms were decent with my sons having a view of the Empire State Building. Ours was of the front of the building which wasn't spectacular but we did manage to see Spiderman being filmed on Sunday which was interesting. The breakfast is good with fresh order eggs available but is a bit manic to get seated at times. The evening reception is fantastic with a variety of snacks available and free alcohol including bud, red/white wine and well drinks.The two guys running out are fantastic and I tipped them regularly. Would highly recommend this hotel and would re book on my return to the big Apple.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: When we booked this hotel, we didn't realise what great choice we made! It's only a 10 minute walk from Penn station (from which you can take a direct train on the LIRR to Jamaica station and then the skytrain to the airport) and another 10-15 minutes to Times Square and Grand Central Station. Location wise, it's very convenient. We also had complimentary breakfast included and every evening from 5-7pm, there was complimentary drinks and nibbles. For breakfast, there was a wide selection available and you could even get freshly cooked omelettes! The rooms were clean and comfortable, with a little separate area that had a sofa and t.v. Overall, thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and I would recommend it to others travellers too. We didn't know to keep the metrocard from the skytrain when you arrive in N.Y. as you can top it up and use on subway or for the return journey on the skytrain. Otherwise, it's an extra dollar for a new one.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: If folks are planning theater visits, this property is highly convenient. However, the property did not deliver on what should be a trademark of a four star Hilton property. We checked in at 10 pm after our play and the associate at the reservation desk was openly complaining about a colleague. At the end of a long day travelers should not have to listen to complaints about hotel staff by their colleagues. It does not instill confidence. The room was clean and updated. It was small, but that is what you would expect with NYC. Unlike other Hilton properties we did not see the evidence of a porter who would assist hailing cabs. The breakfast service was good. It may or may not be worth the upgrade from a Hilton Garden Inn type of property. While I am not a Diamond level customer, I have been a loyal traveler, both domestically and international. This one missed the mark.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My colleagues and I stayed at this property for a long weekend reunion. Diana at reception was great and made the check-in process easy and had our luggage safely stowed.The room was very clean and all the requests made prior to arrival were met. The studios are rather small but it's Manhattan. It can accommodate two people, three if you get the studio with the sofa bed. The property is a new construction so there's little tear and wear. Jackson at the bar during the reception/social hour was amazing! He not only balanced a circus of thirsty tourists but did it with grace. He was attentive and provided suggestions for dinner with a great, warm disposition. Johnny also at the bar was funny, kind and on point. The unsung heroes that are there during social hour are also generous, accommodating, and friendly.Craig B, part of management, handled all of our concerns with an unparalleled level of professionalism. I recommend arriving early for the 5.pm reception as it gets busy very quickly. The same for breakfast. This space is on a smaller side but can be maneuvered easily.Highly recommend and will be returning soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 2 night stay here and I made a good choice. There are many options in the Hilton chain in New York and as a first time visitor I wasn’t sure. My stay started with a fantastic check in, fast and professional. My diamond status was recognised and even though I was early for check in this wasn’t a problem. Very efficiently I was moved to a slightly different room on a higher floor with an incredible view of the Empire State Building. The room was modern and sleek. Room size was fine. Very comfortable bed. Didn’t use the coffee machine but it was there. Airconditioning was a little noisy but this seems to be a problem in all hotels. The managers reception drinks in the evening was great, the 2 guys running it are real pros. Breakfast was good, a little busy and the space doesn’t quite work but a reasonable offering and all inclusive. Finally the location is great as far as a first timer could tell. Could walk to Times Square , Central Park, grand central station, Empire State and so on. Subways near by. On leaving I got to La Guardia via an Uber in 15 minutes. Great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a stay at this relatively new property and all of us were thoroughly impressed with the entire hotel. First, I really wish I could remember the name of the young lady who checked us in, as she was fantastic. Very professional and a great personality. We had this same staff experience with everyone we met. Always a "hello" or a quick to ask how our stay was going and if we needed anything. This includes the housekeepers, maintenance we encountered and the breakfast workers.The hotel itself was better than I had expected. I have stayed at other Embassy Suites properties and for being a new hotel in NYC, this was really nice! As a note to others, It's NOT like other Embassy Suites in their traditional "every room is a 2 room suite". The rooms are very nicely appointed and we had a room with a separate sitting area with a 3/4 wall that "separated" this area from the bedroom. Nice dark wood colors and laminate floors. Great sized bathrooms that were modern. Don't expect huge, but don't expect tiny either. Comfortable bed and sofa. Good water pressure. Heating and cooling system was quiet. Location was quiet for NYC. Windows do open slightly. Elevators can be very slow.Common areas were very clean (although I *HATE* how they leave the housekeeping carts in the hallways all day everyday). Rooms were very clean, as well. Housekeeping staff is very friendly and makes sure you have what you need or want!Nice breakfast. All the food was stocked and re-stocked well. Great selection of warm and cold items. Staff was friendly. Gets a little hectic, but it wasn't nearly as bad I was expecting. Enjoyed the evening managers reception for the snacks and free wines/spirits/soda. The pretzel bites were my personal favorite!Location wise, it's an A-Plus Plus. It's in a perfect Midtown location. Can easily get anywhere via walking or subway. Subway line is 2 blocks away. Tourist areas of Midtown are at most 15 minute walk away. Plenty to do right outside your door. Super safe area as we walked back from Times Square area after being out with friends at nearly 1 am. Close to both Penn Station and Grand Central (like walking distance close...both less than 1 km/.5 mile) Overall, this hotel has more of a "boutique" feel to it. There is a certain friendliness to the place that makes you feel at home. It's relaxing. We come to NYC quite often and this hotel will go to the top of our list to stay at again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My room at the Embassy Suites in New York Midtown Manhattan was nice and clean. There was a great view from the room. The staff at the hotel was nice and friendly. Very helpful in recommending restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed here multiple times solo, as a couple and with family. Location is great! Center to a lot of activity that is Broadway/Rockerfeller Center-based. Subway to 34th and Harlold Square and only a few minutes of walking.Views from just about every floor are good, great above the 15th floor. If your room ends in 09,05, or 18 you have a nice view of The Empire State Building. Views can be seen from the elevator waiting area of The Empire State Building as well.Arilisy and other/all staff are pleasant and quite helpful with your stay and other "Tips" for getting around NYC.Very nice evening reception for guests and wonderful made-to-order omelets.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is located a few blocks from Herald Square and closet to Penn Station and Port Authority. Room and public areas are clean with a modern design. The complimentary breakfast is great. But be prepared for busy and crowded breakfast. I’m a Hilton honors member so I did not 8ntereacted too much with the staff because my check in and check out was done through Hilton app. But the few I walked by (housekeepers and servers) were very polite. A couple of improvements they found doo are improve the elevators - long waits and most of the time very crowded; And better room maintenance - walls has scuff marks, some dusty in the corners and the blinds do not open completely (I stayed in room 2516).
user_name:
Leoliveira77
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Super service from all at the hotel made this an exceptional stay - 6/5. Very comfortable accommodation. Craig, Pam and Daniel, our thanks for your hospitality. Will definitely return next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a very nice hotel with great service and amenities. But breakfast is definitely a zoo at 930 in the morning and the street is shady with a cabaret across the street. Great hotel if you love midtown Manhattan. If you don't then it's not the hotel for you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Loved the hospitality of the team, the restaurant and the rooftop movies!! The sustainability efforts were also great to see. I look forward to staying here again. I travel often and see a lot of hotels and this one is definitely a winner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed in NYC over the weekend and we stayed in the Embassy Suites, it has everything you could want in a hotel. Free breakfast & eve a free happy hour segment on the 4th floor daily. I stayed in a room wit a king size bed & 70” Tv. My room was cleaned daily and it was a 10 min walk to Times Square and 5 min walk to 34th street Macy’s. I don’t see any reasons to complain, the staff were friendly and helpful and he’s a fun Fact, there’s a strip club called Vivid directly across the street. No complaints here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed in the Embassy Suites for three nights. The location in the heart of midtown is fantastic. The hotel is brand new, smart and well finished. We found the staff to be very friendly, but the overall experience still needed a lot of work. Check in was efficient, however we were then made to wait 15 mins (well after check in time) for a room to actually be ready. The room was small, but had everything you needed including a big bed and sofa area. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. Every evening there is a free drinks reception with nibbles, which is a nice touch, however it is embarrassing watching some people trying to drink as much as possible and eat as much free food as possible. The service was fast. Breakfast is a buffet style. The area it is served in is waaaaaay too small for the size of the hotel and there is not enough seating when the area gets busy. The food was fine, nothing special but serviceable. Unfortunately the service was what really let the place down. On our first day we arrived back at the hotel at 1800, to grab a quick shower before going out for dinner. The room had not been serviced which was disappointing as we had been out all day and ensured the do not disturb sign had been removed from the door. When we complained at reception a half assed service was done while we were out at dinner, including dirty pillow cases being left in the middle of the floor. On day two the servicing of the room was hit and miss, one bin emptied, the other not, no refills on the coffee and new towels provided but the used ones left in a heap on the floor. On day three the room was again not serviced at all. By this point we were so fed up we didn't even bother reporting it to reception. Overall this hotel only deserves an average rating. The building is great, the room was lovely, the staff are friendly, but the housekeeping was completely and utterly inadequate. For this reason alone I would not stay there again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We paid over $400 a night to stay here. We had to wait for room. They put us in a small handicapped room. We finally got moved to a regular room that was larger. We walk in and the TV is crooked and almost off the wall. Plus, my husband stepped on a piece of glass in the room. The worst was waking up and having a half burned cigarette on a chair on the balcony. It had been thrown out of the open window above our room. Great way to start a fire! We reported all of this to front desk. No follow up. The breakfast is OK if you like using paper dishes. It would be nice if they had real coffee cups in the room and robes. We are going to rethink being Hilton Honors member and move on. Not what we were expecting. We could have stayed at a nicer place for same price. Positives? Centrally located.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I never leave a review but I had to do this. I travel for work (come to NYC a lot) and I wanted to try out Embassy Suites but it was a terrible idea.1.check in was terrible - I had to wait 30 mins because of "Hilton System Issue". The system didn't add the guest name to Embassy's system so I had to wait 30 mins at the lobby. The staff told me "call the reservation office to talk to me" so I had to be on the phone 30 mins to be checked in. I guess the staff didn't feel like calling the corporate office to help the customer out. Terrible service.2. Welcome Gift - I am a gold member. They gave the gifts to all gold/diamond member except me. I am not sure why but these guys in front of me received it but not me. I guess they are selective on their customers. FYI - Unless you are that "selective customer" you are not gonna get any service/amenities.3. Shower room door - doesn't close! so I can't take shower without flooding the area. they didn't fix this until I checked out and did not compensate at all.  probably the worst stay I've ever been in NYC and won't ever stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Shared a suite with my two adult daughters, plenty of room for the three of us as the couch pulls out into a double bed. The complimentary full breakfast was amazing, plenty of choices including made-to-order omelets. Easy 1-3 mile walks to everything we wanted to see.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed one night for business meeting. It is in a great location to get to times square or 34th street. Rooms are quaint but very clean. I don't think one would go wrong selecting this hotel. All staff were very helpful and the manager went beyond.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very well located on the West Side. Near lots of attraction and restaurants. Very comfortable and quite rooms. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Music in the breakfast room WAY too loud and obnoxious. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. We were fortunate to get a room on one of the higher floors with a view of the Empire State Building. The breakfast was outstanding with a lot of variety, lots of fresh fruit and made to order omelettes. We enjoyed the evening reception from 5 - 7. The customer service was great, particularly at reception desk and at the evening reception (Dominique, Jackson and Wolfgang were a few that stood out). The hotel is in a great location and is walking distance from Penn Station as well as many of the attractions in New York city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Clean, well located, great staff, cozy beds, right size rooms, and good breakfast. I didn’t hear street noise,and the bed was so cozy. I appreciated my clean bathroom - it isn’t always the case. Breakfast had healthy options. Fitness room has 3 treadmills - which is great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Loved our stay at this hotel, Everything is within walking distance from this hotel, no need to rent a car. You can always download the trip app and subway app to get around the City. Great experience.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Easy process checking in. Breakfast and nightly reception extremely helpful with whatever you needed. Jackson, the bartender was quick to suggest great places to eat and visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
