review_body: Great hotel for a weekend getaway. The complimentary breakfast is outstanding and the rooms and beds are comfy. A great location for getting to mid-town and walkable from PennStation. Great value when you factor in the complimentary breakfast and the reception in the evening. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Richard Edward M
San Diego, California

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were a family of two adults and a 17yo son. The layout of this room was comfortable for us with the king size bed and queen sleeper with divider between. The bathroom was modern and clean with glass shower, good lighting, and nice towels. The evening reception and breakfast were high quality and generous. The public spaces were well done.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was looking for a nice hotel for a quick anniversary getaway weekend. After reading the assorted reviews on here I was slightly concerned about the actual space and storage of the room. This hotel is at an excellent location just between Times square and Herald Square and just a half block from the subway We checked in and was promptly greeted by the lovely Ms. Dominique who took care of us and quickly got us settled and on our way to our room. The room was on the 35th floor with a great view and was very well appointed. Embassy suites is modern and makes smart use of the storage in the room- the closet is in the bathroom and the bed has drawers under neath. Our room had a couch/trundle and was very well cleaned. I couldn't have been more satisfied. Armando at checkout was quite pleasant as was the rest of the team. The hotel does have a happy hour with cocktails etc and breakfast. in the morning. I will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We went here offseason this summer and had an amazing stay. The room was spacious (for NYC). The hot breakfast was good and the social hour was also delightful. We would go back in heartbeat. I highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First time in this hotel and I would definitely return. The decor was first rate, the staff was helpful, and the location was walking distance to shopping and theaters. Movies on the garden level is an excellent idea.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location of this hotel was very convenient. Very close to subway, walking distance to Times Square/Theater District. Breakfast and evening reception was a great benefit to reduce our food costs during the stay. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. Rooms are on the small side but it is New York after all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room was dirty upon check in, with hair balls and dust on the floor and stained sheets.When I asked for the sheets to be replaced, they sent someone who didn't know how to change the sheets. They initially just handed the sheets from the door, then came back after a few seconds later to ask for the old ones.I asked him to take it from the bed and he started mumbling and complaining that he's not the sheet guy. Re-did the sheets myself after he left.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We traveled as a family group of 9 people. We booked three rooms for 4 nights. Overall, the staff was great. Front desk, breakfast, lounges, etc, everyone was courteous and helpful. We booked three studio suites (two adults, three adults, and a family of four - two adults and two kids). The rooms were very small and "tight". All rooms had king beds, but that left very little room "around" the bed to walk. You almost had to walk "sideways" and often times we were grazing against the TV on the wall. The "studio" portion had a pull out sofa bed which was comfortable, but finding room to place the sofa cushions and throw pillows was challenging. In the room for the family of four, space was even more disappointing. In one room, not all the electrical plugs on either side of the bed worked. The "closet" was very small too. Luckily the hotel took care of storing the empty luggage once everything was unpacked. Otherwise, there would have been no walking room at all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: One of the economical options in Nyc manhattan area. The room size is bigger than many nyc hotels. Its at walking distance from Times Square. There are several eatery halal options nearby. The staff needs training to be courteous.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I was here on business and loved this hotel. The front desk staff were very friendly. The room was modern, smelled clean and had two huge TVs. What I value most in a hotel is cleanliness, modernity and friendly staff. This hotel had it all. The room was small, but the King bed was awesome. The drawers are underneath the bed and in the closet, but I live out of my suitcase when I travel, so that didn't bother me. The free breakfast included eggs, bacon, chicken sausage, fruits, waffles, cereal, coffee, tea etc - so there were lots of choices. I attended one open bar happy hour and enjoyed the wine and friendly service. It's down the street from a Chick-Fil-A (I'm a suburbanite, so this makes me happy.). I intend to stay here in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I booked Embassy Suites as my mother has never been to the stated before and I wanted her to be close to everything. The hotel exceeded expectations. Friendly staff, clean room and lovely breakfast. The staff were very welcoming from the first day and always willing to help with queries. I have recommended this hotel to friends/ friendly in the UK and would definitely encourage you to book.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Check out what you're getting. Not a suite. No restaurants. No dressers, no place to store luggage in room, room not functional. No room in breakfast area. Poor service. Any other place you're considering would be better.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Had a nice stay for our Anniversary in May as part of the Hilton Honors Maren Morris promotion. Concert was excellent at Gotham Hall nearby. The hotel was nice. Lobby and breakfast were standouts. Staff was good. The room was small, but expected for New York. View was of another building and ceiling was around 7 feet tall so even more cramped than other hotels in the city. Location is very nice and convenient except that Uber drivers had trouble finding it. We would stay here again but look to upgrade the room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: From what I understand, this Embassy Suites is fairly new. It was spectacular! The service was excellent and the room was beautiful with floor to ceiling views of the manhattan skyline. The room was smaller than the usual Embassy suites room but one should expect that in Manhattan. The made to order breakfast was excellent as well. They also kept our luggage from about 10 am till check-in and offered to do the same when we checked out but we were headed to Penn Station and leaving the city. The doorman also willingly flagged down a taxi for us in the rain - and this probably took 10 minutes because all the cabs passing were full. We very much appreciated his efforts!Everything about the stay was great. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Went to see the rooftop movie tonight and Tom at the bar was amazing. I honestly would just come back for him. He actually gets to know all of the people that come to the bar and remembers EVERYONES name. Me and my 4 friends only went to the bar once to get a round of drinks and some food and as we were walking out he rattled off all 4 of our names. I mean, in this day and age with short attention spans, seriously impressive. He is more of what the hospitality market needs and where the future of service is going!Definitely check out the rooftop movie and see Tom at the bar!
user_name:
ashleytourso
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Tom and Joe were our bar servers at a recent rooftop movie event. This is the second event where Tom was my bartender and he is friendliness is very consistent. They were friendly, remembered our names and made the night even more memorable!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First of all, this is an excellent location for any traveler who needs ready access to the subway, the theatre district, Times Square, Fifth/Madison/Park Avenues, Herald Square, etc. Next, I will say that our stay here began beautifully. We checked in on my husband's birthday. He is impossible to surprise, but I was bound to find a way. When he stepped away to the restroom, I quickly whispered to Denise, the MOD, "Please do whatever you do for Silver Honors members on their birthdays! And please give us the nicest possible room!" Later, as I was having our luggage stored, Denise came over and whispered, "What kind of wine does he like?" "Rose if you have it; white if not," I replied quickly. Husband went to procure theatre tickets for that evening and I pretended to need something from the drugstore. I went up the street to Whole Foods and purchased a bouquet of flowers, then ran back to the hotel and asked the clerk give those to Denise for our room. About an hour later, husband returned to the hotel and our room was ready. We went up ahead of the bellman to our 30th-floor room with a full, clear view of the Empire State Building and Herald Square, and there in the living room were the flowers in a vase, a bottle of Chardonnay, and not one but two cheese-and-fruit trays! It was perfect and he was completely surprised. And down it went from there. Our second day at the hotel, we returned in the late afternoon for happy hour (5:00 p.m.) to find that our room had not been visited by the housekeeping staff. So we called and reported this, and then went to happy hour. Happy hour the first day was very good, with Shannon running the bar. She's quite personable and allowed me to fetch drinks for both of us (since husband was working on his laptop) even though the sign said one drink per person. The second day, Jackson and another fellow tended bar; Jackson was great, but the other guy was a Nazi about that one-drink rule. Third day, we had George and Jerry, who were just excellent. Then I lost track, but we did have the Nazi again on our last night. There's no need to be as rude as he was about that stupid rule. Happy hour food, as is often the case with Embassy Suites, was hit or miss. The best day had salami, cheeses, and crudites. The worst day had as its centerpiece a liquid processed cheese-like substance that would have perhaps been okay served warm; however, this was more like a melted candle. Husband had to have dinner with colleagues one night, so I opted to stay at the hotel and have bar food for dinner on the lovely Skylawn, where George and Jerry were working that night. I ordered a glass of Cabernet and the chicken meatballs with celery chips and bleu cheese sauce. It was a beautiful, cool night with a glorious sky. I very nearly fell asleep, it took so long for my food to arrive. In fact, it took so long that I complained to Jerry, who comped me with a second glass of Cabernet. I will say the food was delicious, albeit nearly an hour later that I received it. Or perhaps I was simply starving. There were a few other housekeeping glitches, such as not receiving a fresh liner for the ice bucket; failing to understand that it was okay for her to clean the room while I worked at the desk; failure to deliver fresh coffee cups; failure to remove dirty dishes from room service; and complete, obvious failure to clean the floors AT ALL on a particular visit, and not returning to do so after two requests. It gets worse. Because our flight was in the late afternoon of checkout day, we had requested from Craig a late checkout. He graciously granted us a checkout time of 2:00 p.m. This allowed us to have a nice, long walk on our final day in the city, followed by a leisurely brunch. We returned to our hotel around 1:30, thinking we would have ample time to freshen up, collect our baggage, and be on our way to La Guardia. However, after traveling 30 floors on very slow elevators on that Friday afternoon, we arrived at our hotel room door to find that our key cards had been wiped out. Rather than endure the slow elevators for a drip back down, we attempted to reach the front desk on the house phone in the hallway. No answer. So we had no choice but to ride back down. The front desk clerk found that Craig had made NO NOTATION of our late checkout. The clock was ticking. We were on the last flight back to Houston and we could not miss it. New keys, return trip to 30 on the slow elevator, with zero time left for anything except to snatch up our luggage and be off. I can't say that we won't EVER stay at this location again, but it did pose some challenges that are beneath Hilton standards. I will say that everyone was very nice. Well, except for that Nazi bartender. And one host in the cocktail reception area. Oh, and the one staffer (male, position unknown) who dropped the F bomb while conversing with us in the slow elevator.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I really have to praise this little hotel in an outstanding location between 5th and 6th Avenue and just around the corner from the very beautiful Bryant Park. I don’t think until you get to know New York how handy this hotel is. It’s in a very upmarket little part with Bryant Park and an incredible whole foods close at hand, 2 min walk from Macy’s and the Empire State Building. You get a fantastic free breakfast and 2 hours of free drinks at night in lovely modern surroundings. The rooms looks small in you tube but for myself wife and 3 year old daughter it was great and actually very roomy with a couch and 2 fantastic tv’s.The room also had a fridge, microwave, tea/coffee machine, iron and iron board.We will definitely be back and appreciate the bottle of wine and cheese board given for our wedding anniversary.As a travel professional I will be recommending this hotel to many of my own clients.Thanks for looking after us so very well see you again very soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We recently sent our son and daughter-in-law to N.Y. for their anniversary. I found the new Embassy Suites Midtown online and booked it. This was the start of an AWESOME trip. The hotel was beautiful, conveniently located, clean, and the staff was wonderful and made our kids stay a TERRIFIC experience! From cooked to order breakfasts to their evening receptions, to making great suggestions for the best restaurants to visit - Embassy Suites lived up to our expectations! We will never stay anywhere else while traveling!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We came to NYC for New York Fashion Week. I have stayed at Embassy Suites before and was exited about the perks of breakfast and evening receptionist. Breakfast was really just ok. The evening reception seemed very limited too. The room was good but typical NYC room small. Definitely not a suite. We noticed that all of us were suffered allergy like systems and sore throat but couldn’t figure it out. On Sunday night (before leaving Monday) my son thought he smelled a Freon smell and I was shocked when I opened the air system at the horrible condition of the HVAC system in our room. This could not have been cleaned for months. Then I looked at a vent in the bathroom and again complete dust. I was very disappointed about this. It’s beyond not cleaning this is a health hazard. I paid extra to be on a high floor. I would just assume that paying almost $1400 for 4 nights that you would get a room that is clean and safe. Yes I am disappointed. I am including pictures.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I booked here for my parents who were traveling to NYC for the first time. It was my mother's birthday and they surprised my mother with wine and chocolate-covered fruit in their rooms. The receptionist, ARILISY, was so helpful and very sweet. She was patient and was willing to work with me. Please, ask for her when you go and make sure to brag about her. My mom is extremely picky but she loved her stay there. They enjoyed the made-to-order omelets for breakfast. They were in walking distance from the Central Station and Time Square. Best place to stay at the price

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: By any other standards other than NYC, rooms here are small, small, small (nothing 'suite' about it). The reception and bellhop staff were all extremely friendly. Here are my general impressions:Location: great within easy walking to highlights of Midtown. With a Dunkin' Donuts next door and Chix fil A across the street it was perfect for us. Lobby: small and in a state of renovation. Nothing special.Room: Paid extra to high floor with a view. View was great (though didn't get one with an Empire State Building view), the location of the room was right next to the elevator (why I don't know as we didn't see or hear another sole on the floor, guess it was just because we were there one night and not ones to complain). Elevator is a bit noisy so not great for light sleepers.Breakfast: again limited space impacts this tremendously. The place is jammed packed, the lines are long, the food was no better than what I'd get at a Holiday Inn. So greatly disappointed and you start your day off a bit frenzy elbowing everyone just to get a cup of coffee or juice. There is add't seating on the floor below but the space just doesn't work.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We got the kings suite, which had a king size bed with a divider with a couch that opened into a bed. Room wasn't huge but it was very well designed. It fit our needs perfectly. The reception hours between 5-7 was a nice added feature. Free drinks and snacks in the city ,very cool. Breakfast was perfect for our needs. Every employee we interacted was was very friendly and professional including front desk, reception employees and even the bus boy. Everything was very clean. Only sorry we missed the sky lawn area at night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed here over Labour Day weekend for our first visit to NYC. Location is ideal for being able to walk to Times Square and subway stations. Their fantastic breakfast and nightly manager's reception made this hotel a great value. It was fun meeting other guests at the manager's reception and the big breakfast kept us going through the day. Staff were attentive and helpful for all of our needs. Room is not huge by Embassy Suites standards but good for two people. Could have used a few more drawers. View of Empire State building from our window was great. With windows closed and fan off this room was silent at night - something we didn't expect in the city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New property. Good location. Very attentive staff. Very quiet rooms. Very small guest rooms (even for NYC standards). OK for just sleeping if you don't plan to spend any extended time in the room. Very nice breakfast selection, however the breakfast room gets very crowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As this is a new hotel, room was very clean with really good facilities. Living area gets tight when you open the sofa bed. And if you have number of luggage, bags then you really need to plan properly as you dont get lot of space for luggage in the room. Bed sides is good for walking (side by side) and you cannot put any luggage there as well. Surely good for couple but difficult for families. And walls are not thick, as you could hear others talking in the room and walkway. You get good view of Empire State Building if you take city view room.Breakfast area is small so if you want to enjoy breakfast at a table, go early. When I say early, I mean really early, like when they start the breakfast service. It gets crowded very quickly and hotel seriously lack siting space in the breakfast/restaurant area, considering the number of rooms and guests it can accomodate. You have omellete station, and breakfast is good. When you take the elivator, you will see the best, busy, worst times for breafast as they have put breakfast traffic info. Same is for the Evening Social. If you want to enjoy drinks and have good time with family, be there on time and grab a table. You can always go back to your room with the drink. We were lucky to find a table on first evening but on the second we had a small faisco as the table which we took was empty but then we were visited by a guest who was claiming that he was siting at the table (which was for 4 guest), by himself. He started shouting at my mom (I was at the bar at that time) and my wife politely asked him to lower his voice, which he didnt. Then the guests in the next table interveened and when the drunk guest saw that couple of more people are coming over to support us, he backed out and took another table (for 2) in front of us, which was availabel all the time. So you will see all sorts of people in the eveing social :) Location is perfect as its very close to the Empire State Building and walking distance to all locations - Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central, etc. And you can park in garage nearby which is less compared to what the hotel suggested parking lot charges. Everyone at the front desk were helpful during the day time, but the team on duty at night was not so helpful. We requested for an extra comforter for the soda bed (was not present in the room) and we never got it the whole night. We called up 5 times, and it happened once that the front desk person picked up and kept the received on the side without saying anything as I could hear them very clearly but they didnt speak a word. And later, they stopped picking up the phone. I tried till 2 AM but no comforter, so I complained the next morning to the GM and we were compensated. He really took care of the case, and appreciate his willingness to help guests.Overall, it was good stay. I would surely recommend this hotel to couples who are in the city. Families - it will be little tight for you.
user_name:
JaynanA
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed at this Embassy over Labor Day weekend 2018. The hotel is in a great spot. It is a couple easy blocks to Times Square. We were able to walk to see Frozen on Broadway. We walked to our Hop on Hop Off times square bus stop and the bus stop by Empire State Building. Great Location. The complaint we have is The Heist Restaurant/bar. There were 6 of us traveling and 3 were older and after a day of walking, didn't want to WALK to go eat. We decided to eat on 3rd floor which has a bar menu AND they offer the menu from The Heist restaurant. For 6 of us the bill was over $200, which I do not mind for decent food. The food was COLD at best and the drinks (white wine) were WARM! My daughter couldn't even eat her steak it was that cold. When I complained to the staff in the lobby I was told, HAD I done so immediately OR had I charged it to my room they could have helped, but since I waited until the next day AND put it on my credit card....they could only offer up an I Am Sorry! We did tell the staff in the restaurant at the time how poor quality the food was....to which we were offered Buy One Get One free coupons. No thanks, I mean, if it was awful once, why pay ANYTHING to go back???? Overall we enjoyed the hotel. Great location and breakfast bar. Our suggestion, DO NOT EAT OR HAVE DRINKS there (unless part of the complimentary items). $200 Plus tip was way too much for crappy food and drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel to my mind is a classical New York hotel. In view of space limitations, the rooms are tight, yet with good facilities. It has a refrigerator and a microwave as well as the usual facilities. The bed is fine and the place is not noisy. You can get a nice night sleep. The breakfast is adequate yet no much verities for a vegetarian. They have evening reception as well. The staff are helpful. The location is central in Manhattan, so you are a few blocks from the Empire state, Times square and the famous fifth avenue. As expected, the rooms are a bit pricey, afterall this is New York!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel room could be cleaner and breakfast/evening reception could improve in food quality. Overall good value for the money, bearing in mind New York is an expensive travel destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great Location! Fine staff! Happy hour "for free" everyday from 5pm to 7pm (drinks, beer and snacks)!Near Times Square, Bryant Park and Empire State Building. Sometimes the breakfast is a lit bit crowded, but nothing to worry about...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed for two nights and used Hilton Award points to pay for the hotel. The rooms are so small and very basic. The room had a fusty smell to it but was clean. Great location and ok if your not looking to hang out in your room for long periods of time. The ice machine on two of the floors were not working but a really sweet lady from housekeeping saw my frustration and took the ice bucket to the basement and delivered ice to our room. Breakfast was chaotic Sunday morning. And there was spilt food all over the side surfaces. The tables that I saw around me were sticky and had not been cleaned down. Also the configuration of the breakfast room meant that it was a tight space to get so many people in at one time. There was only red apples offered as fruit, more healthy options would’ve been nice. Coffee was good and selection of teas. The staff were very nice at the front desk. Wouldn’t rush back to stay at this hotel but in a very convenient location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Perfect location, walking distance to everywhere. Nice people. Breakfast is ok. Nice bedroom , ask for a high floor! Nice sky bar, also everyday they serve a reception with drinks and snacks.I wil definitely come back on my next triple to NY

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I had a cheap rate because I work for Hilton and usually that means that staff is not as willing to go out of their way for you. Everyone I encountered treated me like a regular guest and were always helpful and smiling. I really enjoyed my time there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a very good hotel in midtown Manhattan. It is close to the Empire State Building, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Macy's, NYC Subways, Path to New Jersey, and Penn Station. My room was quite nice. Somewhat small but since I was out most of the day it was not an issue. It is perfect for one, at most two people per room. This is the second Embassy Suite that I have stayed at where I cannot get the AC to get colder than 70 and this one was set permanently on auto with a motion sensor. It was not really an issue since my room always remained cool. It did get a bit warm in the middle of each night because there was no motion in the room so the AC turned off. I wonder if it's an Embassy Suite thing?The cooked to order morning breakfast was great since I am a breakfast guy. There was plenty of choices plus an eggs/omelette station. The evening reception was very nice too. John and Jack were awesome and engaging bartenders. Not much food served in the evenings though, just chips and salsa.Before my arrival, I read many reviews that said the breakfast would be packed and that there would be a long wait for the elevators. My first three days I did not have any issues. But starting Friday morning, I noticed a much longer wait for the elevators. The breakfast was indeed packed with people bumping into each other everywhere. Plus there were not enough seating so many took a to-go box to their rooms. Overall, I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. This is the perfect location for tourists because of it's easy access to everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel was in the middle of everything we wanted to see. If the walk was a little too far, the subway was right around the corner. Breakfast was good and evening reception helped tide us over so we could rest before we left for dinner. Staff were helpful and very friendly. Rooms were a bit tight, but it worked for a mom and two 12 year old boys. My one son slept on the sofa bed and said it was uncomfortable. He opted to just use the couch and was much happier. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall, complimentary breakfast & happy hour made up for poor/sloppy housekeeping during our stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and quiet. Convenient location to theaters, restaurants, entertainment and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I want to commend the excellent service by Damille (server), Clari (chef), and John (bartender). They provided personal and friendly service during the manager’s reception and made me, as well as other guests, feel appreciated and at right at home. Thank you to all of you.
user_name:
travelerz2018
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This place is fantastic. Location is great - everything is close by - and the facilities are perfect. Make sure to visit the (free) evening drinks where the staff will look after your every request. We went to the Rooftop Cinema night where we had an amazing night and Tom and Joe looked after everyone with their professionalism and polite and perfect bar skills - great guys. The hotel facilities are great, especially the breakfasts, and the view we had was spectacular - the Empire State Building was right outside our window. Would happily stay here again.
user_name:
leonandnats
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at Embassy suites. The location is brilliant; a short walk to Grand Central, Bryant Park and Times Square. The hotel staff were really helpful in all questions we asked about the city, or questions regarding our stay in the hotel. I found the rooms to be a good size. From a previous trip I found the room of a lower floor to have a bit more space for suitcases, but would happily have a bit less space for the amazing view you can get from a higher floor. The breakfast was AMAZING! Great fresh options everyday and always lots of fruit. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It was not surprising to experience the heat at this time of the year, I love New York and the location of the hotel was great, close to Macy’s, Empire State Building and about two blocks to the 35th and 6th Ave. subway entrance of Herald Square station. This central location is unbeatable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It was my baddest hotel experience in my lifeWhere hotel stuff are rude and act unprofessional not politely and the night manager was very busy to talk to me handling other things, I was charged for rooms I didn’t use From the hotel after the manager promised me a refund And when I left back home over seas they send me the bill and charged me for my honest and trust.Bad experience and bad service and management

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Situated in the garment district, this hotel is in an excellent location for all main points in the City. The subway is nearby and cab/Uber is available. High traffic hours are not good for Uber. The hotel is very nice and offers a great breakfast and complimentary happy hour from 5-7pm. The staff are responsive and assist you very well. We will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was a quick trip for me to take my two sons to NTC for the first time. It was a great experience as the room made a great use of space for the three of us it was perfect. The staff was very accommodating and friendly to my two curious little boys. The breakfast was really good and it was close to lots of things to see! Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Everyone from the front desk, to the kitchen, to housekeeping was so polite and accommodating. The room was clean, nice looking and cool on those terribly hot days. Tom, the bartender from the 3rd floor was super! Made our night! You must go see him.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location is pretty convenient. The room was clean and nice. I had zero problems with anything, which is not normal for me at hotels--I usually have one or two things, even if the overall experience is positive. The staff was a delight. Tom and Joe in the bar on the third floor were great--they served a surprise group of guests very efficiently, and they were entertaining, as well. We had a bartender in the lobby bar who was also very friendly and attentive. I wish I had her name. She has blonde hair and is very slender. Always smiling. She gave great service, and I hope you can figure out who I mean, because she deserves recognition, too. She was there on Tuesday night, August 7.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suite NYC midtown is a brand new Hilton property. Everything is bright, shiny and clean. Front desk staff is all smiles and very accommodating every hour of the day. Nothing bad to say, bathroom/shower - very nice, the room however was a tad small, but it’s NYC and I’m only one person, so that’s ok and I got an excellent rate. I did not have an issue with breakfast since I’m an early riser and understand the issues the hotel(s) have to feed so many people in a short time in a tight space.Definitely return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was a weekend trip to see a Broadway show. It was also the first NYC visit for two of the three in our party. Hotel was close to everything. Felt safe walking everywhere including to Miskoff Theater. Lots of dining and shopping options nearby. Short walk to Empire State Building. Staff was very friendly, especially the bell staff. Was too tired to partake of the evening reception on day 1 and was out and about day 2 so I cannot comment on it. Cons: 1)Check-in was not efficient. Hotel was apparently overbooked. After roaming around the city until 4:00 pm check-in time we were still not able to check-in until about 5pm. Seems like everyone got a candy bar and water at check-in except of us. Guess Hilton Silver is low on the totem pole. 2) Had to ask 3 times for extra blanket/pillow. 3) The windows were dirty(from the outside) which prevented the taking of great pictures of the Empire State Building, Macy's and city scenes.When booking any hotel in NYC one must remember that the rooms will be smaller and/or more compact. Overall this was a great stay for us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was a first time trip to New York for my girlfriend and myself. From the time we made our reservations to the time we left to head back to the airport, we were treated with respect. Could not have asked for a better stay!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy Suites tend to vary a lot from location to location so one never knows what one is getting. This was a solid one with decent sized rooms, but in general this hotel is small and the public areas tend to be kinda small, at least in the midtown Manhattan area. No gripes or raves here. It was solid and worth staying at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The positive was that the shower was a nice size and the staff was friendly. The bad is that the elevators are soo slow. The FREE Breakfast in the morning is a joke, while there is a great selection, they have only a hand full of table for this hotel with 39 floors and a 3 hour time window. We had to get the food each day and take it to our rooms to each because there wasn't anything. The layout of the food place was ridiculous too, very small area with everyone crowding in, not fun at all. The room was basically clean, there was some dirt on the floors when we came in. The rooms are extremely tiny, for them advertising that it was a suite hotel, that's a joke!!!
user_name:
Christine A
Falling Waters, West Virginia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: After a disastrous flight - we checked in at 3 am. The key machine would not work and we had to be escorted to our room. The next morning - we tried to go to the 4th floor for breakfast and realized you had to have your key to gain access. So back to the first floor; wait in 10 min line to get our keys ! Oh - did I mention that their were lines everywhere with people trying to get access to the elevator. Apparently one of the elevators weren’t working (1 of 3)! We get to the breakfast floor and I’ve been in locker rooms and carnivals that haven’t been that crowded. A sign clearly said occupancy over 100 could be dangerous and I counted almost 200 people there. Good breakfast if you could find a table to sit. Just too many people in too small a space. And the workers advised this happened everyday !The rooms are small. (Ok- what isn’t in New York) but their is no drawers except one small one in a vertical closet. Two people for the weekend did not have enough space. This hotel is fairly new so the design will not get better for a long time. For the 36 hours we were there - we never saw housekeeping. The maid on our floor said we were not assigned our room; I saw two other rooms’ occupants begging for towels because of the same reason and I went to the Hilton Honors desk to ask for 2 sets of towels when the floor maid ran out. Lobby has very few public seats and part of it is under construction. World never stay there again and a hotel to miss.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Superb brand new hotel in the best location. Our room was excellent with floor to ceiling windows looking out onto the skyline of Manhattan. We were lucky to get a good size room as I heard that some are quite small. The bed was super comfy...I had the best sleep! The breakfast was great with a good generous selection to choose from. The omelets were yummy which filled us up for most of the day. The staff were very professional and always showed pride in what they did.The only downside is the elevators.and the breakfast room. Although there are four lifts, they are extremely slow. I was glad my room wasn't far too high, as I was able to walk down the staircase. Also the breakfast room can get extremely busy, and a tight squeeze to get to the food display. These issues really do need to be addressed for the size of this hotel. In all a fantastic hotel....would definitely go back and certainly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed with our small son here. We visited NY to renew our wedding vows. Armando at reception was brilliant! He give us a lovely room on the 39th floor; hotel for 39 floors! View amazing! Studio was clean and big enough. Jackson at the bar, displayed excellent customer service and is quite a lovely fella. Robert made sure our internet was up and running smoothly. In all, the hotel staff are friendly and professional. The hotel is in a prime location and shares beautiful views with a higher room. Free breakfast and open bar with snacks between 5-7pm. Only issue worth mentioning is the lifts; gets very busy and you could be waiting a while to hop in one. Overall, stay at this hotel :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Excellent location. Everything was within walking distance. The Hotel staff was very frindly and helpful. My only complaint is the size of the rooms. Rooms are meant for only 1 or 2 persons to stay comfortably, more than that is a little tight.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great experience at the Skylawn at Embassy Suites by Hilton in New York-Midtown Manhatten. What a wonderful place and super neat atmosphere. Destiny M. was the best server and made our evening enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed check in was a breeze. Hot/warm lobby and elevators. Room SUPER tight and small, not a suite, barely a sofa/couch!! NO room to move around with just two of us.NO storage except a tiny closet, with safe and a few hangers, 2 drawers under the bed, that's it!! NO where to put luggage! My kids were in adjoining room and the door was not hinged correctly and we needed this fixed 1st day. A/c also broke in their room/ was fixed next day! That same day, NO MAID SERVICE- in kids room. By this time I was OVER IT. Breakfast option was good although it ends early. Baggage storage was also a plus. Staff tried to be accommodating and were very nice. I won't be booking this again tho, sorry Embassy Suites... this one doesn't cut it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel complimentary breakfast was excellent staff was very friendly great location near Times Square They offered 2 hour complimentary manager reception but we were out sightseeing and did not use Def use this hotel again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My "Suite" was approx. 12X16" 1 bed, 1 chair ...nothing else. Smaller than a Motel 6. The room was 100% clean. A 30-plus floor hotel with 3, YES 3, elevators. Shocking that Hilton allows this property to be called "Embassy Suites."AVOID.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a clean hotel with very helpful staff. While the rooms are small, there is adequate space for a lone traveler. Two areas they should address are the slow elevators and the overcrowded dining space.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I've stayed in so many different brands and styles of hotels in New York, with Hilton hotels it's always a hit or miss with me. Now this was a hit!!! I really enjoyed my stay here. One of the best, if not the best experience at a Manhattan hotel. Ok, yes rooms are small but come on its Manhattan, as a traveler you should expect that. Its improtant you do your research on the cities you are traveling to before hand.There was 4 of us in this room, 2 on the big king size bed and 2 on the sofa bed. We were fine and comfortable. Favorite things: 1. Clean2. Breakfast buffet, omelet station was a little confusing at first but well worth it. They had a great variety of meats as well.3. Staff, I made the mistake of coming to breakfast with just socks and the manager quickly went a fetched me some slippers instead of sending me back to my room . It was really busy but she was very nice about it. 4. Evening hour, included trail mix and veggies and free wine and alcohol. I have never been blessed with this at a Hilton hotel in Manhattan it was nice, bartenders were awesome to talk to.Dislike: if I have to pick something it would be thin walls. Thanks again for an amazing stay. Dislikes

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel was very disappointing for an Embassy Suites property. We checked in early and our room wasn’t ready. No problem, they stored our luggage and we left. Came back around 6 and room still wasn’t ready. Came back at 7, and same thing. They finally found us a better room to have to which we were thankful. Our new room was still small but manageable with just me and my young daughter. My parents room (and especially bathroom!) was even smaller. Staff had to leave towels on the closed toilet lid as there was no place to put them. Next day we were out from 6:30 am until 5:30 pm. We rushed to our room to get ready to go to Broadway and housekeeping was just starting to clean the room!Breakfast was tasty and changed throughout our stay but fighting for a place to sit was horrible. Only time it wasn’t an issue was when we went right at 6:00Elevators are horribly slow and crowded. As mentioned in other posts the service elevator was broken and apparently has been for some time. Staff frequently had to tie up the elevator with large carts Finally we stored our luggage at checkout because we had a later flight. Oh boy, finding it when we needed it was a disaster! The luggage room was overflowing and there was no organization at all. Luggage was also stored in the bar and “downstairs”. The staff even noted everything in this hotel was made TOO SMALL!!I realize this is NYC but I was very disappointed and won’t be staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed this hotel greatly. The rooms are not typical "Embassy suites" rooms but we knew that beforehand. The room was perfect for two people. Our 23rd floor room had a great view. Breakfast was superb. Happy hour had beer and wine.We were in town to see Bruce on Broadway. That wonderful experience will always be associated with this wonderful hotel. Would come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Love the modern design although room is small and tight. Breakfast buffet is excellent.- they have an omelette station. Location of the hotel is good - walked a few blocks from the Bolt Bus terminal . Also close to a Catholic church - we were able to hear mass on a Sunday!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. For the most part, this hotel was great with a few exceptions. Here is my breakdown:Location: Great location! If you want to be close enough to timesquare but not exactly in the thick of it, this is a good spot. Status of hotel room: Pros: Room was bigger than average room for family of 3, it was very clean, smelled nice and up to date. The room has a divider between the bed and couch and so it was perfect for us - sort of like a separate bedroom. Cons: Walls are thin. Elevator is painfully slow. There were many times we ended up taking the stairs from the 12th floor because the elevators were very sluggish. Water pressure was the worst I have ever experienced. Barely a trickle sometimes. Customer Service: Excellent. They were so very nice and efficient and friendly. They went the extra mile as when we had already checked out, my husband realized he left his hat. We called housekeeping and figured we wouldn't get a call back - and we did. They found his hat and kept it safe for us until we returned. Overall - this was a great hotel. It was super crowded and so we didn't take advantage of the free, customized breakfast omelet because the lines were tremendous - but staying there during an off-peak time would be better. If they can fix the elevators and water pressure - it would be the perfect stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We being a loyal Hilton customer booked this brand new Hilton hotel in New York. Hilton generally has always taken good care of their customers. And with the name Embassy Suits we expected much more. But honestly I was put off with my 1st impression. We had reached late night and was there with our 5 year old and a lot of luggage. But they did not have any staff to help us take the luggage (neither from the taxi nor to our room). We had to do it ourselves. We stayed here for a week and on repeated request for some vegetarian/ vegan breakfast all we got to eat in our breakfast for 7 days was fruits and cereals. As we stayed here for a week within 2 days we understood that it was more of a bed and breakfast kind of hotels where you do not expect any much of customer service. Also we had booked this brand of Hilton in New York as it was brand new and there was a promotional offer telling that they offered double bonus points to Hilton Honours members for booking in this before a certain date and we had done that. But we did not receive any bonus points for the same and now they claim that there was no such offer. Overall personally I did not get any good customer service but to be honest the rooms were decent and the location was excellent. Very close to the Time Square. Would definitely recommend staying here if you are ok to help yourself with your luggage and are non-vegetarian. Just a tip: Ask for a wheelchair access room as they are bigger than normal rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Not sure how this hotel qualifies for a Tripadvisor "Certificate of Excellence." Room was small (as are most modern hotel rooms in Manhattan) and challenging for two people to move around, but pretty well appointed. We had a King room (you can get either that or a two-room suite, which I believe is too small for a King) on the 30th floor with a nice city view Bed was good. No dresser - instead, two decent-sized drawers in the frame under the bed. Good-sized bathroom and closet. Armchair and shelf acting as a shallow desk, but with two chairs! (But not adjustable, just chairs.) Good lighting.Floor was wet between A/C unit and bathroom when we walked in. Problem was condensation from A/C. They came and dried the floor, but problem recurred throughout our stay, and the finish on the floor was clearly beat-up because of this. Bathroom good, but insufficient counter/shelf space - we had to keep our toiletries in the under-bed drawers, which was a nuisance. Good hairdryer. The problem is that some elements of the hotel are poorly managed: 1. The front desk was understaffed when we got there, in part due to one of three computers being used for accounting purposes rather than check-ins. Honors desk not staffed at all. Desk staff inefficient (long conversations helping guests with non-check in issues - should have been handled by concierge or other staff - we had to wait while one of the check-in staff explained the NY subway system to another guest) and not particularly friendly or welcoming. Lots of side conversations between check-in staff and other employees while we waited.2. Elevator access a real problem (also an issue in many newer hotels). There are three passenger elevators, and during busy periods (check-in, breakfast, evening free cocktails) there were lengthy waits (>5 minutes) and sometimes the cars were so full that we couldn't get on. In addition, the service elevator was out of service for our entire stay, and according to staff had been that way for longer than they could remember. As a result, we often shared an elevator with housekeeping carts and large bags of trash. (Housekeeping personnel, who were uniformly friendly and helpful, would step out if necessary to let guests on.) Management made no effort that we could see to limit this activity to off-peak hours.3. On our second day, we slept late. As we went out in the early afternoon we asked a Housekeeping manager in the lobby to have the room made up. He was too important to discuss this with us, and referred us to another housekeeping employee. We gave her our information. When we returned to our room at least three hours later, it hadn't been touched. When we spoke to the front desk, they asked us what we wanted them to do about it!! We went back out and the room was cleaned up when we came back a few hours later.The included free breakfast was very, very good, and the staff, who were welcoming an friendly, did an excellent job of keeping everything well-stocked, and quickly cleaning off tables. We did go either early or late - it's definitely a scrum in the middle of breakfast (both in the breakfast rooms AND the elevators).The evening reception was also great - we missed most of the snacks, but the guacamole was tasty, and the real, made-to-order cocktails were made by friendly, competent staff, with a generous pour.Don't know whether or not we'd stay here again. If we did, I'd definitely request a lower floor so that we could get back and forth to breakfast, and walk out without waiting for an elevator!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay at this Embassy Suites. The staff was friendly and helpful. It’s in a perfect area. The room was very nice. However the highlights were most definitely the happy hour reception, with free cocktails and hors d’ouvres, and the extensive breakfast. You’ve got to stay here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very friendly staff. Rooms are clean, nicely appointed and good sized for NYC hotel rooms (we were in a Studio King). The free breakfast is well above what I’ve seen at “free breakfasts” at other hotels. Selections are varied and the food is very good. Likewise for the Manager’s Receptions each evening.Now for the bad:1. Requested some needed extra pillows/towels with online check in. They were not there upon arrival. It took three phone calls and after 6 hours (and a call to Hilton Honors customer service) I finally received them. 2. I stayed for two nights and my room was not touched by housekeeping (despite three requests through the day). At least I was able to take some towels from a linen cart in the hallway. I don’t know if they are understaffed or poorly managed (or both) but this was a first for me.3. The elevators are SLOW at peak times and it can be a problem if you are on a tight schedule and cannot take the stairs. For example, I was waiting over 20 minutes for an empty elevator on checkout. I ended up carrying my suitcase down 10 flights of stairs to the lobby. At least I wasn’t on the 39th floor!The friendly staff and good food quality do not make up for long lines for slow elevators and non-existent housekeeping services. There are other non-Hilton choices on the same block that I’d consider next time. I won’t be returning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I hate to give poor ratings and usually prefer to not rate at all than to be negative but I felt I had to warn people. First, the property is newly constructed and generally clean and well appointed. Also, the location is very central in Manhattan. The biggest disappointment here was that these rooms are advertised as suites when in fact (please be warned), they are tiny even by Manhattan standards. I travel to NYC on business usually a couple to a few nights nearly every week. I usually stay at the Hilton Times Square or a handful of other properties in midtown. Every other room I’ve ever stayed in Manhattan was larger than these rooms. I switched to this hotel for this trip because I was traveling with some family members. We reserved 3 rooms and so I saw multiple layouts and they were all terribly tiny to the point of being uncomfortable. Moving on from the size issue, the elevator service was horrible! The elevators were hot (moreso than the hallways, lobbies, or rooms) and it took a full 10 minutes most times to get downstairs. The lobby layout is awkward and on this day, it took all the way until the 4pm checkin time for most rooms to be ready. On a positive, there is a parking garage where they offer a discount and good price of $45 per day. The staff was friendly in person as well. For a family, I would recommend you go to the Doubletree Suites on Broadway and 47th. Those are real suites all of which are two room suites. I’m sorry Embassy suites but I just wanted to warn people. Your property is nice looking though.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Check in was horrible. My profile states high floor away from elevator. When checking in I was offered a room on the 6th floor. Really,because supposedly they had no more rooms. Strangely a room showed up on the 30th some floor with a handicap shower I said yes but when I saw it I really didn’t like it. Then miraculously another room appeared . I was given a room by the elevator and lower floor. The noise of people in and out was unbearable. I said nothing as I was tired from my long flight. I say rooms because non are suites. That should not be called Embassy Suites. My stay was pathetic. The only thing that made a difference was the professionalism, great customer service and charisma of Jackson the bartender during happy hour. This gentleman made everyone feel at home and went above and beyond. What a great asset for the Hilton corporation. His colleague John was also awesome. Two employees that cared. Breakfast was good but disorganized. This hotel needs to improve customer service and treatment to their Diamond members. That check in day was my birthday and wasn’t even acknowledged. First Hilton property that didn’t even wish me a happy day. It was noted on my reservation so it tells that no one read my preferences. Overall I’ll give it a seven as Employee Jackson made a difference. Once again don’t get fooled because rooms are just regular rooms. They might call some studios but they’re really deluxe rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were here for seeing the sights and this place was great. Good location for Broadway and Time Square and great hot breakfast. The rooms were on the small size and the elevators were SLOW because the service elevators were out of commission and the cleaning staff had to try to use the same ones as the patrons. Everyone was nice and helpful and we only had one small problem. We had the cleaning staff walk in on us at 7 o’clock because they were told we had checked out. He actually said “ you shouldn’t be here? You checked out” i just said “I’m sorry, you’ve made a mistake. We haven’t checked out yet” then I put the security thing on the door. I heard him call down and apparently it was the right room but wrong floor. No big deal! This will be our go-to hotel while in the city. We really liked it. Comfortable beds and nice bathroom. Surprisingly quiet for being in the city. The biggest negative was parking which was around the block and in a public garage.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Well i would normally wait for my return home before submitting a review, but im that impressed with this hotel i decided to post it now. Hotel is in a brilliant spot, close to Times Square but away from the hustle and bustle. Check in was quick and impressed with the room, really good size for New York and clean, bed is one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in, and views were great, we were in room 3218 which unfirtunately didnt face onto the empire state building but none the less the views were outstanding. Staff were great too, very friendly. Only disappointment was we had contacted the hotel prior to our holiday, as we were going to celebrate my birthday and asked if there was any chance of a free upgrade or a view of the empire state, just to add that little ‘special’ to our visit. The woman who replied stated they would surely be able to do something, which built our hopes up but in reality nothing happened. Other than this we can not fault the hotel and our trip, the fact it includes a great breakfast and even free drinks from 5-7pm makes it amazing value and i could not recommend this hotel enough!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel lacked a basic level of cleanliness. The shower smelt of sewer. There are better options available. Hopefully the staff will pay attention to some basic Hilton standards and get this corrected. Breakfast options were great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great contemporary hotel. Convenient to subway, Macy's and other attractions . The king suit was great with a divider between the sleeping area and work area. Bathroom was effectively laid out. Air conditioning worked great on 90 degree weather. Complementary reception was ok.The staff was very friendly and onw noticed that I had injured my ankle out on th ed street and offered me s bandage. How wonderful that was!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I'd read this property is different from the "typical" Embassy Suites so I thought I was prepared. I wasn't. It's New York City, so I'll count that as part of the reason my entrance was disorienting: the lobby was packed full of people (and I mean a LOT of people in a small space) who seemed to be sitting around doing nothing, but you have to be careful not to step on their feet as you walk by. The good news, there wasn't a line at the check in desk, so I was soon given my key to room 1505 and headed off in what I assumed was the direction of the elevators. I was wrong. The elevators are to the far left of the big room they call the lobby and check-in area. You'll need your key in order to press elevator button for the floor your room is on. But where the elevators are, and how to use them, isn't information I was given at check-in. After rolling my suitcase around around many feet of the sitting lobby people, I found the elevators, got into one, pressed my floor number, and nothing happened. That's when I learned about the key thing, from one of the maintenance men, who kindly used HIS key to activate the button to the 15th floor.I found the room down a couple narrow hallways. I was able to wave the room key in front of the sensor thingie and the door opened to a room that was even smaller than I thought I was prepared for. In fact, it's a little bigger than our master bedroom at home, including the bathroom.The room has some of the usual Embassy Suites amenities (coffee pot, 'fridge, safe) but, in this case, there's a pull out chair (rather than a pull out sofa) and nothing to separate the "living area" (which doesn't really exist) from the bedroom area. In short, this room is just a hotel room (not a suite) and I wasn't made aware of that when I reserved the room or when I checked in. Since it's only me (hubby stayed home), it'll work. If there were two of us, this wouldn't have been good. The room is okay for one person. It took me a full 10 minutes to find the closet ... long enough for me to conclude there wasn't one. I went looking around for other places to hang my clothes (over chairs and such) and finally found the closet behind the open bathroom door. The closet is also tiny. So tiny, I guess, that the ironing board isn't in the closet: it's to the left of the pull-out chair, leaning against a wall.The bedside "tables" are the kind you might find in an RV: narrow.For sports fans, the television, which is mounted on the wall at the foot of the bed, is HUGE. It has a black frame around it, so it looks even bigger than it is. I'd let that slide, but there's no mirror on a wall where you can pull up a chair and blow dry your hair, so the wall space taken up by the television seems out of balance to me. The bed itself is on the firm-side. Not wonderfully comfortable, but not awful either. If there's any warmth (such as plants) in the hotel, I haven't seen it. As I write this, it's too early for cocktail hour (which is on the 4th floor), so I haven't scouted the whole place out yet. Speaking of warmth though, there's a nice plus here: the air-conditioning works really well ... and it's hot today.Suffice it to say that for a senior rate of nearly $350/night, I had other options and now wish I'd taken one of them. This property is so-so. It's fine. But it's not the kind of cool you want when you're in Manhattan. This hotel would be perfect in Omaha, or Des Moines (no offense to those fine cities). But for NYC, not so much.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: 39 floors, 3 elevators. You can grow a beard waiting for one. Rooms are tiny, with no room for suitcases. If you open the sofa bed you can’t get to the desk. The digital key is a good idea, but you have to open the app to get to it. Pain. Also, sometimes takes several seconds to register at the room and elevator, so the doors close before you can select your floor. Won’t stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Don’t stay here thinking you’re staying at a real Embassy Suites. The rooms are tiny even by NYC standards. The width of our room hardly accommodated the length of the bed. You can tell in the hotel pictures the sofa-rollout bed is adjacent to the main bed, which we expected. However what the picture doesn’t show is how small that space is. The bathroom shower leaked water out onto the floor and we had to take hand towels to jam in the gap. The housekeeping staff were very nice, however our room was never cleaned properly. They didn’t empty the ice bucket, leave clean liners or take out dirty towels. Finally, on our last day they didn’t bother to do anything to the room. Elevator service is a disaster- very long waits. Breakfast is a disaster, we went at various times and no matter when you go they have about half the space they need.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was by far the smallest room I have ever stayed in at an Embassy Suites hotel and they called it a suite, iit was barely a room.The closet was in the bathroom, which you could hardly turn around in.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We always stay in Embassy Suites because, well, they are actually suites. At this location, the rooms are falsely advertised as suites. What they actually are are smallish rooms with a 5 foot high "divider" between the king bed area and the sofa bed. I get that this is New York City but this hotel does not live up to the name Embassy "Suites"!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am a long time Hilton customer and this Embassy location is in mid-town, close to the Empire State Building and to TimeSq without being in the busy heart of it. Just a few blocks walk and you are right there. The staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are city size but clean. Breakfast on the 4th floor is good , but get busy as you can imagine, so avoid peak times. The only downside is you have to wait a bit for elevators. Some rooms have great view of the Empire State Building...this was mine from the 25th floor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The cafe here is amazing- the food & drinks are great (def not your typical, boring cafe fare), but it's the staff that make this place so fantastic, particularly Destiny Montalvo, a server there. The sexy bartender & manager are not only cute as hell AND bent over backwards to make sure we felt like VIP guests, but Destiny made us feel like we were old friends and catered to our every need. And this place was packed, so not an easy feat. I highly recommend this place. And ps they've got outdoor rooftop movies every might!
user_name:
wwwLoveLustorBu... c
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed the week of July 4th and yes it was very busy. Our room was good enough with a king bed and comfy chair, a large TV and a surprisingly large bathroom with shower. The food is excellent and the waffles at breakfast was my favorite!. We got to know the chef, the front desk, the bartenders, and they all were so friendly that we felt like we were among family. We highly recommend this hotel. Thanks for a wonderful experience in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Lets start with the pros: Very good location (37/6th), very good breakfast.Now to the Cons: Dinning room floor was sticky and dirty for the whole week we have stayed there. Dining room was too small to fit the number of guests. Also, the three elevators of the hotel were not enough, and we found ourselves waiting for a very long time before one arrived -especially in the mornings.Our room wasn't cleaned for the whole week.More than that, the hotel has a weird policy of adding $50 /day for your security deposit. And last but not least, Service at front desk was bad: We ordered a package to the hotel, and it seems that the hotel employees lost it . only after two days they finally found it.To summarize, its a pity: the hotel has great potential as far as location, and price. it seems that most of its problems are managerial ones that can be solved easily.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Close to javits, right in midtown. Handy location. Excellent outdoor cinema, really cool. Tom is the nicest bartender in manhattan, hands down. All staff are really nice and helpful. Big free breakfast, though crowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed three nights in June/July on 21st floor. Room was small, but very adequate for NYC. Huge TV and nice, walk-in shower. Could see Empire State Building and Macy's from room window. Room was very clean and well appointed. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was crowded and cramped--but delicious, and one morning we decided to take the stairs down (from the 21st floor) to avoid the long elevator wait. Such a long wait only happened once, though, and is to be expected at peak times in such a large building. Overall, we had an excellent stay, and we would gladly stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Customer service of front desk was poor. Spoke to them repeatedly and it was like I said nothing. No action taken until second attempts. Second attempts were resolved in some cases and ignored in others. Having to contact on multiple issues was disheartening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: 我的臥室寬敞很安靜，足夠讓孩子們玩耍，房間非常適合睡覺，乾淨整潔，清潔服務很好，熱的bfast食物和定制煎蛋捲, free refill of 飲料或 水，但是他們甚至提供取出盒子讓你帶走，，週末很多人' 服務不多但總是很好的支持，在5分鐘的步行路程內輕鬆訪問所有數字或字母地鐵， 我的兒子在夜間突然 胃補救，我們打電話給911，但後來取消沒有收費，前台通過撥打3次檢查和幫助甚至在午夜免費提供兒童藥片顯示了他的真誠和呵護

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Expected typical Embassy Suites room. Hotel room was a small single room! Comfortable, clean, good wireless and HVAC but still a small single room. Usual so so fare for breakfast. Rather slow elevators. Staff very accommodating and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I took my nephew for a 10th Birthday trip! The staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for a great stay. Everything was clean and well kept and all requests were accommodated! Keep in mind, this is NYC and the rooms are compact! :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed here after a crazy night of having our flight cancelled and scrambling to find a hotel only to find it wasn’t booked and was redirected to this hotel that had room for us! So glad we ended up here. Hotel was clean- staff was friendly and kind, and the free breakfast in the morning was great. No complaints. Would stay here again for sure. Loved the location too! Close to Empire State Building and some shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel back in August 2017 when it was still being renovated but the reviews never gave us any reason for concern.The hotel is lovely and the staff are great - Denise Suero, the Front Desk Supervisor was an absolute superstar, responding to my enquiries, pre-allocating us 5 rooms together and helping us book our transfer from JFK. She really helped make our stay.We had 5 great rooms, all of which were clean and well stocked, two of which had a view of the Empire State Building! I would say that the smaller ones would have been tight for more than 2 people though but then you don't go to NYC to sit in the room! The only other small problem is that the wardrobes don't really accommodate long dress hanging but I just put mine in the hooks in the bathroom, so no biggy.Breakfast was great but heed the traffic light warnings as it can get chaotic at the peak times. Every breakfast need was accommodated and regularly replenished, so very fresh.We did attend the Managers Reception a couple of times which is a nice idea but you have to queue individually at the bar for your drink, which when there's a group of you is a bit of a pain. As you can't get to that floor without a room key we didn't really understand this and we found the bar man quite moany, especially about those who didn't tip! I've seen a couple of comments about the lifts being slow, we only encountered this in the peak breakfast times though.Overall we found the hotel to be a great base with some fab amenities and I would definitely recommend it and stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a nice hotel, decent location, not too far from Subway lines. Had a unique issue of running water coming out through the ceiling lights in the bathrooms which it was a very akward and unsafely situation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall great experience and premium location. Public transportation and cabs were always nearby. Staff was very friendly and helpful and displayed excellent hospitality. The complimentary breakfast is an absolute value for families!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed for two weeks in this hotel and chose it because of its location. Location is great, it is very close to Bryant Park where you can find some relax in NY craziness. The room was clean. Although the hotels are ridiculously expensive in NY, the deal for this hotel was ok. They have cinema nights on their terrace. Although I didn't benefit, they have happy hours when they provide free snacks and drinks. Breakfast is always the same and you may wish some change if you stay longer. Their meal menu that you can order to your room is pretty limited and the pasta I ordered was more than 'al dente':) But overall, it is a good option considering the location, service and price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New hotels are cropping up in Manhattan like mushrooms in a forest in the Fall. The mid thirties west of Fifth Avenue is not a fashionable district, but could be considered part of the Fashion/Garment District, center of the longstanding "rag trade". It certainly is convenient for exploring, working or sightseeing in Midtown. Also, the tariffs tend to be a bit lower than more glamorous or hip venues. This tall and thin 39 story hotel has only a handful of rooms on each floor, shoehorned around a catwalk hallway.Three elevators might speed or more likely slow you to your room. Our room, on the 32nd floor, had a stunning view of the Empire State building and Macy's Herald Square. Typical of a Hilton Brand, a very comfortable bed, good lighting, including in the bathroom, a mini-desk, large flat screen television and a few pieces of generic furniture. Typical of the city, everything was crammed into a very tight footprint-so much so that the closet was actually through a door in the bathroom! A nice sized shower, and a sink and toilet that were practically on top of each other. For a "free breakfast", they did a very good job, better than Hampton Inns, but the size constraints of the floor plan,even though the dining and serving areas were most of the fourth floor, made getting that breakfast close to a scrimmage. During the peak of breakfast time (8-10) seating capacity can be maxed out. I have tried three or four dozen hotels in New York, never finding one that was 100% of what I am looking for. But in the category of mid range "chain hotels", this one is worth considering if you want to be roughly half way between Penn Station and Grand Central and are looking for a clean good value place to sleep.There is limited seating in the lobby and a minimalist restaurant/bar which I wouldn't suggest trying unless there was a blizzard or the city was under siege.The staff is cordial and efficient. Check in time is 4, and getting your room before that time is iffy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The staff is so nice and helpful, over the top. Well located and rooms are clean and nice. Even the restaurant was pretty decent if you are there for work and do not have time to go out. Will stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This Embassy suites hotel has much smaller facilities and rooms than others of the same kind, for individuals this may be suitable but for larger groups you may want to look elsewhere. The room I stayed in was basically a small bedroom and also did not have access to tap water aside from the toilet sink.The morning breakfast buffet is good, but you may frequently find a lack of seating if you arrive after 9:00am.At the evening reception you'll be served with drinks and can pick up some light snacks. One of the bartenders, Jackson is very friendly and will help you find the right drink you're looking for. He was the best part of my stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband and I enjoyed a one week stay in a balcony non-suite, room 2220. The balcony was nicely sized and shared with the next room with plants serving as a privacy barrier.
