We never heard or felt invaded by the guests in the next room, it was great. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Not sure if this would work in the city but I would recommend some type of umbrella on the patio as on sunny days with the direct sun the patio was too hot to enjoy for long periods during the day but we definitely enjoyed early morning and in the evenings. I reached out to the hotel prior to our stay with a couple of questions and Diogenes responded promptly with information. I mentioned that we were celebrating a couple of things while we were in town and wine and cheese try were waiting for us upon arrival, that was a great touch and wonderful welcome to NYC. After reading some of the reviews I was afraid that the room would be extremely small but the room worked well for the two of us. We had two large suitcases a piece which we kept beside our sides of the bed. We lived out of the suitcases for the week as there was not much closet room but that didn’t hinder of affect our stay at all. We attended the complimentary breakfast once and the complimentary happy hour twice both were great. Breakfast offered wonderful options, it did get crowded towards the end but we followed the advice of the flier in the elevator and made sure we were down before the peak hours so we were finished eating before the crowd arrived. The happy hour was equally wonderful a choice of red and white wine and the bartender also made cocktails by request, that’s a value you just can’t beat in the city. We will definitely consider Embassy Suites again on our next trip to the city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Pros: walking distance to Penn station, times square, empire state bldg, Rockefeller center and several subway stations.breakfast: cooked to order omelets, full hot buffet plus usual muffins, waffles cereal etc. Evening snacks and drinks 5 - 7 pmFluffy pillows, fluffy towelsCons: if you are familiar with the tiny house concept, this odd the TINY hotel room concept. We had "suite" with sofa sleeper. The back of the sofa divider was about six inches from the left side of bed. Right side of bed barely had room for the luggage stand between bed and window. no tub, shower appeared to be 4' by 4'. Heat lamp stayed on if light was on, heating up the room if you like to leave bathroom light on at night.And further floor space once sofa sleeper is open, you literally have to crawl over the bed to reach the wall plug.This was room 806. I could recommend only for small people or average folks who will not be opening the sleeper. There was no place to open second suitcase except on floor or bed. It's the most crowded hotel room I've ever stayed in. It was pretty pricey on a Friday and Saturday night. But the location and breakfast were excellent. Location was deciding factor for us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great stay in NYC! Terrific location, Happy Hour, Comp breakfast cooked to order & wonderful rooms!!! Please book a stay @ this nice Hotel on 37th St and see for yourself! Craig the manager is terrific in every way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great hotel, in Midtown, convenient to walk to Times Square, 5th ave shopping, 34th st, Penn Station and Empire State Building. Views were impeccable from our room and we took advantage of free breakfast each morning! Breakfast had lots of options for me being gluten free! Staff was friendly!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Every staff member, no matter what their job, was welcoming, efficient, and friendly. The hotel is very well kept and in a perfect location. Bonus - reduced parking fees at Icon Parking. It was a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed in the hotel over the weekend and my room on the 7th floor faced the bar and an outside movie screening. Even with all the windows closed a level of noise until 2:00 am was too much to try and sleep. They should have worn me when they gave me the room.On the other hand they did check me in at 12:00 pm instead of 3:00 pm which was very helpful. Over wise the hotel is very conveniently located, clean and has larger rooms than normal for NY.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: stayed in this hotel Mon to Fri and it was very good .our room had one small problem its size it was just a little small .great hotel great breakfast and drinks. location was spot on and staff very friendly

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy is always my first Choice whenever I can. This one is right in the middle of the everything, close to subway, shopping and the service everything is super good as well as manager happy hour. The best complimentary breakfast with many fresh fruit you can’t get from other hotels. I would stay again if come back to NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed on a Monday evening for business. Staff was courteous and helpful. Room and Lobby were clean. They offer 2 small bars open util around midnight, and breakfast is included. Somewhat typical Hilton Brand fare, although they offer make to order eggs and omelettes! Room is typically tiny as you would expect in NYC, but pretty quiet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: After reading the reviews of the hotel - I might have had unreasonable expectations. The check in process was extremely slow - and the reception person was surly at best. After waiting in line for over 10 minutes while she was helping another person - she walked away. When I asked her if there were other employees that could assist - she said yes - then kept walking away. None of these other employees were in sight. She returned to the desk - and called for help. After she called me to the desk - four additional people appeared - why this could not have been done sooner is beyond me. She was not welcoming in the least - perhaps because I questioned her?? I am a Hilton Diamond member - so maybe expecting a little more - friendliness? Had a small / average room. Clean and quiet - but small (no upgrade offered). The hotel seemed full. And busy as was the case for the breakfast / afternoon snack area. Decent breakfast offered - but busy / crowded space. The afternoon snacks were - will minimal snack offering - although drinks available. Might return - but would keep expectations in line with this past visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I’m a business traveler and the embassy suites in midtown is the standard for comfort, quiet, good value and the added pleasant surprises of very good food in the restaurant bar and the check in experience that i’d rate with the best hotels above their class. The staffing throughout this hotel is attentive, efficient and friendly. Regardless of how how early or late I arrive, or how long the check in line is, the reception is genuine and warm (no fake smiles). And even on a high floor during rush hour, the elevators are quick.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am so grateful for the staff at this hotel. I cannot stress how amazing the staff at this hotel is and has been. Front desk, Dominique and Armando helped me and made me feel welcomed and special. Shout out to Crystal for making me feel known.Breakfast, Sekou is very friendly and cares about the guests and their experience. There are amazing chefs making delicious omelettes (met two during our stay). Ana and Maria I believe are the staff members making sure breakfast happens smoothly, they are kind and warm. Reception, I LOVE the bartenders here! I am sorry that the three names are escaping me but know that your drinks will be made with love and care. There are countless others who really made our trip special. Housekeeping who kept the rooms spotless, the concierge who gave us great recommendations and greeted us daily. Thank you all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Close to Time Square, Bryant Park, Empire State Building. Great complimentary breakfast and Happy Hour is a plus! This is the only place I stay when in Manhattan. higher floors really block out the city noise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Good, quick and friendly check in. We had a room with a balcony, and unlike some other reviewers did not find the room size a problem. We had three cases and, ok, if you wanted to unpack all of them and hang up everything, you couldn’t, but the seat at the end of the bed was fine to put the cases on, and an iron and ironing board meant there was no issue with not having much wardrobe space. The balcony was great to have. Evening reception spot on, and friendly bar tenders. Breakfast had a good choice. Downstairs bar good, too, as was the bar tender. And I didn’t get the issue some reviewers had with the lifts. Occasionally I had to wait for two or three minutes, but that’s all, and how you could get more than three into the space, I don’t know.Two quibbles. Housekeeping was patchy and one day out of five non-existent. Also, one night a couple were eating take away pizza and ice cream at their table in the bar. It didn’t seem ideal in a hotel of this sort. If it hadn’t have been for these, I’d have rated the hotel a 5.Great location, and I’d happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The first thing I want to say in this review was that the staff was mostly very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very pretty and in a great location - within walking distance of Broadway shows, tourist attractions, a cute park, and great restaurants. The area seems very safe and there are tourists and business folks everywhere. The complimentary breakfast was rated very good by my family members who tried it. The coffee was so good. From 5 to 7 there was complimentary drinks and snacks. Everyone liked the wine choices. In the rooms there were lots of convenience outlets to plug in your stuff. Our room was a suite and my son slept on the sofa and said it was very comfortable. Now for the issues. The rooms were cramped, which we expected in NYC. There was no place to put your stuff. There was a tiny ledge around the sink and I kept knocking off my personal items. The bedside tables were so narrow I literally could not fit my phone, e-reader, glasses, and a bottle of water on it at the same time. But what is hard to understand is the poor use of space. There was a lot of space to make the bedside tables wider. I kept looking around and there were many places where small shelves and drawers could have been added to make it easier to put belongings out within easy reach. I know this isn't the managers' fault but the designers. Also we stayed at the hotel a week and twice our rooms were not cleaned. We were gone from early morning until late at night except maybe to change in the afternoon. How does this happen? We travel all the time and stay in all brands and price range hotels from modest to luxurious and they all manage to clean our rooms. We came in late from a play on our last night and our room had not been cleaned even though earlier in the evening I ran into the supervisor on my floor and he said our room would definitely be cleaned. They did send up towels when we got in from the play but it took a while so I went ahead and showered using no washcloth and drying off with a hand towel. I know if a manager replies to this review he/she will say, "Thank you for your input and I will share this with our management team." Which will tell me nothing. I would really like to know why this hotel cannot get the rooms cleaned or at least change out the towels. That would have been better than nothing. And I most certainly did not leave the do not disturb sign on the door as the lady at the front desk implied. We never touched it the entire trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a great location, we had room 2909 with a great view of the Empire State Building. The food was great, everything went well, including elevators, room cleaning, etc. This embassy suite is smaller than anyEmbassy suite I have stayed. It was fine for two people, but not anymore. I would chose a different property if you want room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My sister and I planned a short trip to NY and decided to stay at the E Suites because it was close to all of the major landmarks and shopping. Not only did we have a wonderful time in NY, our accomodations were outstanding. The staff went out of their way to ensure that we had everything that we needed. A special thanks to Sandra, Ciera, and Angelo.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The Embassy Suites was the BEST choice for our stay!! We already knew about the breakfast, but didn’t know about the evening happy hour. The staff and the facility were superb!! We had a great time meeting people who were visiting and meeting the staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Took a last minute trip into the city and stayed at Embassy suites. Great location in midtown. Insane view out the bedroom window of Empire State Building and Freedom Tower. Breakfast was ok. Room is small but they all are in NY.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I and my husband second time to visit NY. We wanted to stay midtown, so location is parfect. Room is crean, staff is very friendly But room so ittle smallI like embassy’s free breakfast and dinner drink .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I have stayed in at least 15 different Embassy Suite properties and several of them multiple times. This is the single worst one I have ever stayed in, and it is fairly new. The bathroom shower leaked; there was hair in the shower when we checked in; the ice makers are on every 5th floor and the closest ones to us didn't work for our entire stay; the halls are not air conditioned and were stifling; our air conditioner was not working well the entire time; we set a reservation for 5:40 a.m. the morning we were leaving and they messed up and kept calling us at 4:40 a.m. (repeatedly); and the bartender during the free nightly reception was beyond rude. On top of all of that, the rooms are beyond tiny and there is nowhere to put luggage etc. I would never ever stay here again. We come to NYC regularly and normally stay at the Hilton on 42nd or the Doubletree Times Square - both are fabulous and a thousand times nicer than this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a 4night- stay and I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised. I choose the hotel for a birthday trip with my sister-in-law because of its location and the fact that it's just opened recently.We stayed at one of the Sky Studio suites and while the suite itself was quite small (basically a normal size double bed elsewhere), it was a decent size for NYC and the sofabed was full size and also acted as a divider. We stayed on the 37th floor and the view was simply breathtaking and I mean Empire State Building full frontal view, Freedom Tower and the financial district in the distance, even caught some glimpses of hudson river :).Staff was extremely kind, breakfast was delicious and gave enough choices, evening reception was great for drinks, food was limited though, I don't know what it's like in other embassy suites. It was tasty and plenty if you only want an evening nibble and given the fact that it was complimentary.The hotel was walking distance to anything in Midtown and herald square which is like 2 mins on foot is a great hub for the subway. There were some construction on 37th street but they practically finished them during the night. No noise at all. All in all, great new and clean hotel (unlike most midtown hotels) with a fresh concept, and friendly staff, that really exceeded our expectation both in terms of quality service and the extras as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very clean, smart design, nice front desk staff, poor floor to floor sound proofing, and about 200 sq ft, not a suite, so that was unfortunate! Good location in NYC, cost was 300 + per night, thankfully we had points.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Conveniently located (when street isn’t being demolished and repaired) with excellent breakfast options and very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are smallish but I hear not unusually so for New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Lovely hotel in the fashion district. The purpose of the trip was to celebrate my youngest daughter's 14th birthday. The staff was kind enough to put together a birthday surprise for her while we were out -- a bag of goodies, a piece of cheese cake and some soda. So very nice. The room was very clean and sleek and of typical NYC size. We very much enjoyed out stay. Thank you very, very much.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a pleasant lobby and a great location with a friendly staff. The elevators can be a bit slow. Our room was nicely appointed but tight on space. There was no dresser, and the tiny closet was located in the bathroom. Curiously we could never find an electrical outlet in the bathroom so my wife dried her hair in the bedroom. The stall shower with glass doors was great except the doors were not sealed to the bottom and leaked onto the bathroom floor. However they gladly provided us extra towels to sop up the mess. The bed was comfy, the a/c worked well, and the room was quiet. There was a great flat screen TV with a good remote and extensive choice of free on-air TV. A breakfast buffet was included with a reasonably good selection on all 3 days of our stay, but quite crowded and noisy if you go during the “rush hour,” the times of which are listed on a placard posted in the elevator. As a bonus, the hotel is only 2 blocks from the closest subway and just a short walk from Penn Station.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great 4 night stay in room 2609, We had booked a suite with a view and balcony and were given the only suite in the hotel with its own private balcony and the view of the Empire State was just amazing. The suite is a bit tight and low on storage and could have been designed better with a bit more thought, but the staff were wonderful, ever so friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean and a typical Embassy Suites breakfast, mmm, mmm, mmm! The only criticism I have is, the dance music at 6.00am in the breakfast area was far too loud, at that time of the morning you just want a quiet relaxing breakfastbut when I asked for it to turned down, it was straight away. Overall an enjoyable stay and would return and we saw Springsteen on Broadway for the second time, an amazing evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: If you are used to the large Embassy Suites, well this one was very tight. Once you get over that it is an excellent choice. The breakfast was excellent, and good food. My only regret, I didn't get the name of the nice young lady who helped me get what I needed to tend to my toe when I had a blister on it. Everyone was very helpful at the Hotel. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Fabulous location in a safe area with lots of dining, shopping and close to subways. Nice staff were always helpful. The breakfast was a good value with a chef cooking ready made eggs and omelets hot and delicious

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: 5/30/18-1 night. The Embassy Suites is my go-to hotel when out of town for the extra amenities included in the price and the space. Although the room was smaller than I’m use to in other cities (since its New York), I was thrilled with the service, location, facility. The breakfast was better than many of the ones I’ve stayed. We had an issue with the room and the manager and support staff were VERY accommodating and understanding, resolving it quickly, and with a smile. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: When you compare the usual size of a typical Embassy Suite, these are tiny. Our room had an unusual sofa that spits the room into 2. The king bed took most of the sleeping room with a large television in front. We were upgraded to a corner room which had views of Macys and the Empire State Building. The included breakfast was typical but offered a variety of fruits and pastries. At times there were crowds but the staff was efficient and cleared out the tables quickly. The big plus is its location which is central to all the touristy spots.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I got in touch with the hotel prior to our arrival to let them know that my wife and I were staying in New York to celebrate a wedding anniversary. I exchanged emails with Alana, one of the duty managers and she could not have been more friendly and helpful.Upon our arrival, I was pleased to actually meet her. She had pre allocated our room (2609) and told us that we had some complimentary drinks at the lobby bar which we could have whenever we wished. Thank you Alana!The room itself was a little on the small side, but it was clean, new and comfortable nonetheless. After all, we knew that this wasn't billed as a five star luxury resort, so we had no complaints. The best bit about the room was the huge corner balcony which directly faced the Empire State Building, which was only a couple of blocks away. We could also just about see the top of the Chrysler building and we looked down towards Macy's, Broadway and Fifth Avenue. It really was a great view! It had a table, chairs and some big, very comfortable sun loungers, which we used one evening to enjoy the last of the sun. This was the biggest and highest balcony on that side of the hotel, so if you can pre book it, I would recommend it!The location of the hotel is really good, on 37th between 5th and 6th Avenue. Consequently, a short walk to some great shopping, the Empire State Building and about 15 minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square. We also walked to Central Park, which took around half an hour.The only issue we had during our stay was with the power tripping out when we plugged something into one of the headboard sockets. However, the maintenance guy was at the door within five minutes and flicked the breaker back on in the hallway, so no big deal.We made it to the manager's cocktail party each night to find that there was a decent selection of beer, wine and spirits on offer, all in good measures!The breakfast was also good, with a variety of hot food, fruit, yoghurts, pastries and cakes. The chef made some great omelettes too.We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but whenever we did, we were struck by the politeness of the staff. Everyone, from the reception to the bar tenders, the cleaners, maintenance guys, restaurant staff and chef were always happy and friendly, making us feel welcome and at home. A big thank you must go to them all. They have pushed this review to five stars!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had booked a King Balcony Suite and were very lucky to be given suite 2609 with a huge balcony and an amazing view of the Empire State Building All the staff were very friendly, breakfast and manager's reception were great. Great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I stayed here in May 2018. Room was very clean (#1511), and although it was near the elevator was very quiet. Floor of room was some sort of wood/tile which was very nice. Bathroom slightly cramped, but workable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Like all Embassy Suites we’ve visited, this is in a great location, just blocks from the Empire State Building and less than a half mile from Times Square. It also features a great breakfast, including made-to-order omelets, lots of fresh fruit (including watermelon, honeydew, cantaloupe, and pineapple), and special recipe home fries. The big 60 inch HD TV impresses, as do the bathroom fixtures. But the room is small for a suite: our king bed filled half the room, the closet was small, and there were only two drawers. The view out our 12th floor window was a small grassy area below, with brick walls to the left and right. Those two issues—room size and view, make this an average Embassy Suites, especially considering the price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had no idea where to stay for our first visit to NY but as we had some Hilton points to use, decided to stay here due to breakfast and evening reception. Only here for a short stay (2 nights) but needed somewhere accessible to Times Sq. The hotel was great as far as walking distance, about 20 minutes comfortable walk.We choose a balcony room as I am a keen photographer and wanted to take some photos here from our hotel room without glass obstructing the view. The balcony was terrific...I can imagine in Summer this would a a sort after room as the balcony was possibly the same size as our room. As someone else mentioned, the bed was very close to one wall, and not much room to get into bed. A few stubbed toes but we managed. Expected a small room in NY but I think if the furniture was configured a bit differently, there would be more space. What was disappointing was when I sat on the chair to put on my shoes, I happened to notice all the “debris” that was around the base of the mattress (the bed is on a solid base). A bit off putting when the hotel is only a few months old.The breakfast was great, however, we could not find any water....juices coffee tea, but no plain water. The reception was capacity on the one night we were able to access it but very cramped.Big plus was the bar! The staff there were excellent...shared their knowledge of NY and were 5 Star. Very friendly and are a credit to the hotel.One suggestion to the hotel, we were given free bottled water the first night of our stay... why not the whole stay? Would save a visit to Macdonalds around the corner to buy cheaper water than avAilable in the hotel. Not a bad hotel, but would look at other options next time we visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Had a wonderful stay weekend of 5/16 to 5/21. Location was great, staff very friendly. Reception and breakfast were spot on.Really thought everyone took excellent care of all of our needs. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Would definitely come back again. Great view of the Empire State Building. It felt like you could reach out and touch it! The 37th floor view was great and the room was lovely and quite. Overall a very pleasant experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We called to get our room cleaned everyday (after 11am), each time they said they were sending someone right up, and each day it didn’t happen. 2nd night we asked for a blanket, and it took 3 hours to arrive. On the weekend, there was no seating for breakfast

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: As you might expect in the heart of NYC you're not getting a giant 2 room suite at this location. In fact, the room sort of reminded me of the show about "tiny houses"! That said, everything was in great shape - everything seems like it's nearly brand new. The room isn't really that small but when you cram a king bed, sleep out sofa and a desk (with a divider in the middle) into it there's not much "walking around" space. I will give them credit because they made use of every inch and despite the lack of open space the room has pretty much every amenity you need (refrigerator, microwave, ironing board, desk, two tv's, etc...). The only real issue I can see is that if you had a lot of luggage there's really not much space to store it and the closet/drawer space would be inadequate for a long stay.Other than the room size we had no complaints. Breakfast was excellent with cooked to order omelettes and a wide variety of hot and cold items as well as various juices and good coffee. The evening reception featured a couple of appetizers and a wide selection of mixed drinks and wine and comfortable seating to boot.The location is right near the Empire State Building and it took about 10 minutes to walk to the heart of Times Square. One small negative is that parking is 1 block over - not much of an issue in good weather but I'd prefer valet in bad weather. The staff were all friendly and professional and the value add of the Embassy Suites breakfast/cocktails is hard to beat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Daughter and I went to NYC for 3 nights and wanted hotel walking distance to Times Square but far enough away. This hotel was perfect. Quiet hotel at night, very little street noise. We used points for our stay and could not have been happier. We arrived at 11 am and the room was ready. Breakfast was fabulous and the room was very clean and comfortable. We were on the 28th floor, next time, I would ask for a lower floor so that we would have the option to walk when not wanting to wait for an elevator. Thanks for a great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. Our room was ready early (2pm) which really helped our limited time in NYC. The staff were super friendly and helpful. We had a king suite on the 28th floor with a nice view of the Empire State Building (even in the rain). The midtown location is ideal. So many things to do in easy walking distance. We made it back in time for the managers reception which was much better than previous reviews have noted. Soft pretzels and beer cheese. Tortilla chips, cucumber dip, and vegetables as well. The wine was good and generously poured. Many other options were available. There were plenty of dining options nearby. I will say that the elevators were slow, but the staff opened up use of the service elevators when usage was high. The breakfast this morning was very good. Lots of options and extra seating was opened up in an adjoining room. We could not have been more pleased with our stay. It was very economical considering NYC standards. We hope to stay here again on our next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We recently stayed here for 4 nights. The first night as we plugged something into a headboard outlet (there were 2 on each side of the headboard above a shelf that served as a nightstand) and it immediately sparked. At the same time, the TV went off. We called the front desk to report the issue and asked for a different room. We were told they were totally sold out. They sent "the engineer" up to our 31st floor room to fix the issue. He told us that there were problems with the outlets in the headboard and that the hotel was in the process of fixing them but they hadn't gotten to our floor yet. The "engineer" flipped the circuit breaker in the hall and told us to use the outlets to the outside, but not to use the ones to the inside. While we were waiting for "the engineer" to arrive, the row of lights above the window went out and then came back on a few minutes later. We told him about that problem, too, and his solution was to not turn on those lights, just use the other overhead lights. We also noticed a similar problem in the bar area when partaking of the happy hour one evening. A row of lights in the bar area went out and/or dimmed several times. There are issues with their electrical system and that needs immediate attention (we shared our concerns with the front desk). Don't mess with the safety of the people staying in your hotel.The happy hour was supposed to be from 5-7 p.m. A couple of evenings, because we were out being tourists during the day, we didn't arrive until about 6:20-6:30. The minimal snacks were about gone. Another person asked about the snacks and the response was "what's left is over there". If they're not going to keep the snacks replenished the whole time of the advertised happy hour, they should note on their sign "first come, first served on snacks". It's not like the snacks were food that had to be prepared, there were tortilla chips and a snack mix that came directly from a bag.We expected the room to be small as it's a NY hotel. The bathroom was much like a bathroom on a cruise ship. The shower was good. The bed was comfortable. The location of the hotel was its biggest asset. Would we stay there again? Absolutely not.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We got there in the pouring rain and luckily they had a room for us before 4 pm because we were drenched and needed to change our clothes. The room was clean and very cozy. Watched a recap of the Royal Wedding on a huge TV.Went to see a play, came back, had a drink at the hotel bar and met people fr Dallas & Africa.Complimentary breakfast was really good & the staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is quite new, we had suite 2309, quite adequate for us , medium wardrobe for clothes etc with drawer and shelf ,and under shelf for shoes etc. There is more storage under the foot of the bed plus night stand storage, we brought little boxes for shelves nr bed. Shower room quite large . View from room not to good wall one side and view of apts and Macey,s across road. Rooms are sound proofed from outside noise, sound from televisions when persons are watching different shows rather annoying. Break fast plenty of choice plus eggs omelettes to order, didn,t have problem getting a table. Managers reception was very good plenty of different types of drinks and nibbles, met many people there and enjoyed their company The bar staff worked non-stop to serve all who were in the bar and food replenisher never stopped.The reception staff great friendly and professional, attending to all our queries.And not forgetting the backroom staff thank you all for making our vacation so good The location is one of the best for all sights and transport links( subway 34 st). See you soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just returned from a,week in New York with my husband, stopping in a double room (3418) at the Embassy Suites.Firstly the great things about this accomodation are:-1/ Bed very comfortable and no noise from outside in our room on the higher floor which we requested in advance.2/ Breakfasts are included and these are very good to set you up for a hard days enjoyment of New York. Do take notice of the sign in the lift advising of quiet and busy times. We always managed to get a table but it does get busy at peak times. The staff assisting were very helpful and friendly. Particular credit to the guy who made omelettes to order-so busy but very efficient.3/ The free cocktails between 5 and 7pm were wonderful- a lovely way to meet other travellers, and bearing in mind New York prices, a great way to start an evening. Nibbles are also included.The staff on duty were all friendly and helpful (Jackson and Destiny to name just two), thank you guys...you made each evening so enjoyable. As stated most drinks are free but we did contribute regularly to the tip jar. I don't agree that everyone in the States should get tipped for the very least thing that they do (they should be paid a decent wage by their employers instead) but in this instance we were happy to spring a few dollars as we certainly drank a few!!4/ The location of the hotel is great-perfect for ma as I was surrounded by beading and button shops and a roll out of bed into Macys. Our room didn't have a view of the Empire State building -others did but I don't know what size they were.And now to the less great things which would deter us from returning.1/ The room was very small in comparison to others in the States that we have stayed in and for a week, storage was absolutely terrible.There was a tiny wardrobe in the bathroom which was so narrow that clothes hangars didn't fit in straight, making it very awkward to hand clothes. Aside from this there were just 2 drawers under the bed, one of which contained a safe. The lack of storage meant that our room was always very cluttered. In addition there was a full length mirror but half of this was hidden behind the bed. on my side I had a very narrow gap between bed and wall to get out. I'm a UK size 16 and I was squeezing so guests on the large size would find this very uncomfortable.2/ Similarly on design issues, the hotel reception is very overcrowded due to its size and there is nowhere else for departing guests to hang out . There is a huge water feature at the most crowded spot-if it doesn't disguise a structural necessity I would certainly get rid of it.There is also a bar area with tables-again given the crowded nature of the reception I'd remove these and replace them with more easy chairs.Would we stay here again? This is a great hotel for a short stay where you don't need loads of storage but for longer I think we'd look elsewhere just for this reason.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Good location but the rooms are tiny. The “suites” are suitable for 1 person or at most a couple. Elevators can be very slow in the morning. Breakfast is average. Overall, the room rate is double what it should be.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Clean, new rooms with great mattresses and pillows for good night's rest. Nice walk-in shower in bathroom. Room was quiet. Fantastic complimentary breakfast with a ton of choices. Staff was helpful and efficient. Good access to subways. Can be a wait for elevators.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was my first time to NYC and I will say the hotel stay was nice and clean considering the city itself is so very nasty and dirty. I do recommend this hotel, staff was friendly and as busy as they were they seem to keep things moving both at breakfast and their evening reception. We came in for a girls weekend and stayed in a suite with a king bed and pull out couch. Now you must keep in mind that this is NYC so even though a suite it is still very small. It served it purpose of providing a clean sleeping environment and the hotel has a nice outside seating area if you felt a little cramped in the room. I loved that it was within walking distance of the square and that they offer a evening reception. Breakfast was top notch, please be aware of the signs that tell you the busiest breakfast times. I went early and no issue with finding seating or having plenty of options. My friends went later and said they had a hard time finding seating. I loved that they have a baggage check because we had taken the train into the city and scheduled a walking tour. The elevators are always busy so if you don't want to wait ask for a lower floor and you can take the stairs. We stayed on the 9th floor so often took the stairs down but waiting for an elevator to go up.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a nice experience here with some minor quirks that keep it from making it a five star. We checked in at 6:45 and our room wasn’t ready. We were in a hurry to make our dinner reservation. They did upgrade us to a higher floor with a great view of the Empire State Building which was nice. The room keys caused us some trouble with the elevators and getting into the room which was annoying. The room was nice but had a long corridor leading to the king size bed which was wedged tightly into a small space. Bed was comfy and the large tv mounted on the wall was awesome. Room hvac was a little quirky Room was very quiet. Counter space in the bathroom was minimal but the shower was very nice and the bathroom actually had a door on it. Outlets in the room were also minimal. Didn’t have the breakfast. They stored our bags for us after we checked out which was convenient. Everyone was very nice here. Overall an enjoyable stay! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: So when we arrived it was a cluster. So many people waiting for their room. I pre checked into my room prior to arrival stating we wanted to check in at 4:00(which is their check in time). We sat around waiting with a lot of other people. I went to see at 4:05 if room was ready and was told not yet. We had to be somewhere to be and we were looking forward to showering first. At 445 room still not ready. We had to change in the bathroom in the lobby and leave our luggage. When we got back that night our luggage was in our room, which was nice. The next day breakfast was busy but the food was good and the staff was good with getting food out quickly. The elevators are a nightmare. Several times we walked down from the 11th floor due to the extreme wait times. We got king sized bed w couch. Bed was very comfy but with the couch pulled out the room was very tight with 3 of us. I got a bottle of wine I figured it was prob. 20.00 bc it was nyc after all. I had it charged to my room. It ended up being 35.00. I almost fell over and to top it off it was a 4.99 bottle when I looked it up on line. The staff were very friendly however I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Very nice hotel, in a great location and very friendly and accommodating staff. This location was not like a normal Embassy Suites because the room was much smaller. But you are in NYC and shouldn’t be in your room that much anyway Great breakfast and enjoyed happy hour.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall loved the location and the WiFi.Hated the elevators. Best to avoid at all costs the hell that is breakfast and go to the Dunkin’ Donuts or food stand right outside front door.The air conditioner keeps shutting off which is uber frustrating and it gets really hot and stuffy at night if you don’t go and trigger the AC sensor every two hours.Most annoying thing was the room type we reserved was a balcony which they emailed us in the morning and said is not available but they could get us another room.The room was very clean and nicely laid out and spacious for NYC with a sofa bed.View amazing of Empire State Building and Freedom Tower.Room was not ready until 4:45 which was frustrating as we are Diamond members and they didn’t have our room type as reserved - we were tired and hoped to get into room at check in time of 4 for a nap.We might stay here again as the location was great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: First, the location is perfect - u can walk to Times Square and other touristy spots. Good restaurants and entertainment all-around. Hotel looks clean and new. Please don’t expect to check in early even if your a Hilton Diamond Member -your room won’t be ready. Had a problem with the hot water in my room on the first morning of my stay. Called front desk and was told they were working on it. Only 3 elevators for over 36 floors of guests, please be patient and expect to wait. Breakfast was also a pig show as there weren’t enough tables and silverware for all the guests in the hotel. The air conditioning in the hotel room wouldn’t stay on as it kept cutting off on this 90 degree day. As others have indicated, if you are assigned to a room with out a pull out couch, it’s a lot smaller than a cruise ship cabin.I’m giving a 3-Star based on location -Will not be back to this Embassy Suites the next time I’m in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Halways and rooms claustrophobic. We didnt stay there though we had a reservation. Very tall and narrow building. Felt like a fire trap. Staff was helpful in cacelling our reservation. Pay a little more and sleep comfortably.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We booked a room with a balcony and It was extraordinary. I would request that type of room again. Loved everything about this hotel. It was an upgrade compared to the Hampton I’ve stayed at in times square. Worth the extra money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed 3 nights. We are regular users of Embassy Suites and found the room smaller than we expected. But it’s a big city and it was fine. The room was modern and clean but we had a problem with the temperature of the water in the shower it was always hot except when I wanted to use it! They did apologise and reduced the room cost. Breakfast and happy hour was standard Embassy Suites quality although the eating area was too small for the number of guests EAT EARLY! Also the 3 elevators struggled with the volume of guests. Would I stay there again...yes.... staff tried... it’s not 5* in price and it’s in a great location. Management please fix the water temperature.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I have stayed in numerous hotels in NYC and none of them offer the amenities provided by the Embassy Suites at such a great cost. Our room was spacious, modern, and clean. The breakfast was complimentary, delicious, and accommodating. Our bed was comfy and the extra space for our suitcases was even better. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Completely met the expected standard of the hotel chain. Friendly and thoughtful staff. We stayed a week and they recognized and greeted us each time. Convenient to training location and centrally located to all we hoped to visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I've stayed at a few Hilton properties in NYC and by far this was my favorite. The hotel staff was exceptional! All very personable and professional and went above and beyond to accommodate our requests. The rooms were very clean and the complimentary breakfast was great. Good Wi-Fi connection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great stay with family and friends. The location was great. We had a terrific view of the Empire State Building out our window. The window also opened which was a nice surprise. The location is very convenient to the subway. Take advantage of Bryant Park (two blocks away) in the evening as the park is a wonderful setting in the city. You cannot beat the complementary breakfast and evening reception. It gets a bit crowded,but the value is unbelievable in NYC. They are still working on a 3rd floor lounge that includes an outdoor space. It looks like it will be great addition to the hotel. Not sure when it will open. This hotel will be our first choice on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were told we were able to check in at 3pm over the phone when we booked the hotel, when we arrived at the hotel we were then told it was 4pm. Which wasn’t much of an issue as we had planned on touring the city in the meantime. Our flight arrived at 11am and we had been walking around NYC for about 6 hours and really wanted to take a shower before we heading out for the rest of the night. We arrived back at the hotel at 4:45pm in aspirations of giving them a little more time to get the room ready for us. When we attempted to check in at this time, we couldn't because "the room was ready but had yet to be inspected." Normally this wouldn't have been a problem but we had already purchased (days in advance) Top of the Rock reservation tickets at Rockefeller for 5:15 – 5:30pm @ $40 apiece. We mentioned to the staff that we had these tickets and would like to get to our room as soon as possible, if only to just take a quick shower. The staff worker behind the counter couldn’t have cared less about our urgency and offered absolutely no resolution to the problem what-so-ever. (Cab, a different room, etc.) We were asked to wait in the lobby and that our room should be ready in “about 15 minutes.” It was at this time that we realized that we were not the only frustrated guest in the lobby waiting for a room. There must have been at least 10 other guest in the lobby waiting alongside us. Getting back down to Rockefeller was at least a 20 minute walk from the hotel, which meant it was highly unlikely that we could make it on time at that point. We tried to call Rockefeller (multiple times) but no one would answer and it states pretty clearly on the tickets that they do not offer any refunds. My fiancé actually attempted to change in the restroom down in the lobby with hopes that it would save time. By the time that the hotel had our room ready (5:15ish – 30 minutes later) there was no possibility of us making it to the reservation on time. We again tried to speak with the staff behind the check in counter about our frustration once the room was ready and again they stared at us as if saying nothing would just make us leave. After a moment of nothing a woman then said, “we wanted to make sure you had the Street side view that you requested.”We couldn’t have cared less about a room with a view. We just needed to quickly shower so we could get to our reservation. Had they asked us if we would be alright with a room that didn’t have a street-view. We would have gladly taken it, if it meant we could have made it to our reservation on time.This is hands down some of the worst customer service I have ever endured. At that point we had given them almost 2 hours (we were initially told check-in was 3pm over the phone) to ready the room. We in no way expected them to move mountains, however, we did expect them to be understanding and respectful of our time as we had been of theirs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The mid-town embassy suites is comfortable and very clean. It is close to broadway and many theatres are in easy walking distance. The included breakfast and happy hour are convenient perks. The breakfast is surprisingly good with options for omelettes and many other items. As with many Manhattan hotels the elevators are small and slow. In the future we would choose a low floor to allow for use of the stairs. On balance a good hotel conveniently located near the Empire State Building and the theatre district.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I want to thank Craig Brereton. Reservations were made at this hotel because the web site we viewed stated there was valet parking. They don’t offer the parking and it didn’t look like we were going to be able to get two rooms on the same floor. Craig saw that we were disappointed and wanted to make our trip and visit happy. He did some great Maneuvering and got us rooms next to each other and helped us find parking for the weekend. Thank you Craig.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This brand new hotel in Midtown Manhattan was a great find. By NYC standards, the rooms are fairly large, spotless, well decorated, and modern. The flat screen tv was huge for a hotel room as well. The lobby bar is very cozy, and a touch upscale, and the complimentary breakfast was more than generous, with plenty of quality selections, and even an omelette station. The hotel’s location is great, with Times Square and Broadway just a short walk away. Above all, the staff shined the brightest in my eyes. Every single employee we encountered was extremely friendly, helpful, and professional. The only thing I felt needed improvement was the complimentary evening snack selection. There was very little food, that wasn’t so great. I plan on staying at this property on my next visit to NYC, and do recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Called a few times before arriving, always friendly and professional, had questions about parking -I drove.Arrived a little early they held our bags till our room was ready. Very courteous and friendly desk. Rooms are small but nice and new, very comfortable king size bed.Full cooked breakfast in mourning, very nice happy hour 5-7 in the afternoon.For first time in NYC they were helpful about getting around, where to eat, etc Always a smile and greeting apon leaving or arriving. Would definitely recommend.I want to give the breakfast and happy hour staff a shout out, they can't be beat

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We just returned from a fun weekend in NYC, made even better by the staff and experience at the Embassy Suites Midtown Manhattan. The staff were all busy and yet friendly, with a quick check-in, very nice and hardworking bartenders, and efficient wait and cleaning staff as well. Small things also turned out well - I forgot my toothbrush and was given a name-brand replacement rather than the cardboard types normally provided - I asked if there was complimentary coffee in the lobby and though there was on the 4th floor the manager gave me some premium, non-free coffee from the lobby instead, and other similar incidents.The most noteworthy 'problem', however, had nothing to do with the staff but perhaps the Embassy headquarters instead - the entire 'Suite' was smaller than most (non-NYC!) hotels rooms I've stayed in. The entire space was comprised of a comfortable king-size bed with a very-high backed couch pressed up almost next to it. On the other side of the false barrier was what seemed like a 2-foot wide aisle that comprised the other half of the 'suite'. As it was just my wife and I we kind of laughed it off - but as we used to travel with kids, and have relatives who seek out Embassy Suites for their family of 5, this would be a not-funny turn of events. Perhaps all the 'suites' are not arranged similarly - you should ask before booking your large family at this hotel.
user_name:
DaJoos
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel overnight as a combo mini-vaca wedding trip to New York. We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at a few Embassy Suites. The hotel was great as far as the room goes up to Hilton standards. I was disappointed at the fact that I could not get a shower cap and was told they were out of stock and I could go across the street to Duane Reade to purchase one. The evening reception was so crowded that you could barely move and the only snacks were hummus and chips, if there were other choices I never saw them. The staff at the bar was wonderful serving a delicious sangria but there was simply not enough space to accommodate the amount of people that were there. The breakfast was great but also in the same space, difficult to accommodate everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I can't say enough about our stay at the Embassy Suites on 37th Street in New York City. This hotel has it all! The location is ideal. It is close to the Theater District, fashion district, and train station. This hotel offers a made-to-order that was fantastic. The cook who prepared by delicious egg white omelet each morning was delightful. All of the staff in this hotel go out of their way to be pleasant, welcoming, and helpful. If all of this isn't enough, they have a complimentary 2 hour cocktail reception each night, that includes light snacks as well. Where else would one find this? The rooms are comfortable. Ours was partitioned with a king bed on one side and a pull out couch and desk on the other. Each side had its own TV. The mattress was very comfortable as were the pillows. This is my new go-to place to stay in New York. Thank you to everyone who made our stay so pleasant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is in within walking distance of all the tourist attractions with the Herald Square subway convenient for Battery Park and Liberty Island cruises.We booked a balcony room which was at the back of the hotel with stunning views of the Empire State building and at night over the Easter holiday we even enjoyed a light show.We do recommend the balcony rooms which give a sense of space and in the summer would be wonderful.Comfortable beds, controllable air con, and windows which could be opened all meant that we had a great night's sleep.We checked in perhaps half an hour early which was no problem and the room was ready.The cleaners were nice but the room cleaning was a bit haphazard and could be at any time but it always got done.Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and subtle changes to the menu through out the week. The happy hour is great and there was nothing better than a couple of glasses of red wine and some nibbles after a day's sightseeing.It gets busy towards the end of the week, even busier at the weekend and was absolutely rammed over the Easter Weekend with reception working really hard and always helpful.Breakfast likewise is very busy towards the end of the week and for two days half the area was closed off for an HR conference with guests almost fighting over the remaining seating or forming long queues, breakfast in hand at the three lifts to get back to their room which brings the overall rating to average.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The Embassy Suites Midtown is a conveniently located, clean, new hotel. We were able to easily walk to Times Square and many other locations. The room was very clean and comfortable, but small (although that seems typical in NYC). The sitting area is quite small and not easily usable for more than one person. The bed was comfortable, and the blackout curtains helped us sleep in and relax. The breakfast offered lots of choices including an omelet station. The staff were all friendly, but the bar staff was especially so. The only complaint I have was that the elevator was extremely slow. Good choice--I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Brand new, free made to order breakfast, free happy hour 5-7 PM, great location ( 5 blocks from Times Square ! What more could you ask for ? Oh and the price is reasonable for NYC ! rooms are small for an Embassy Suite , but very nice!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Booked and confirmed for king balcony with view but instead got king no balcony with view of rooftop smoking area and water tanks. Checked in at front desk at 4:30p only to be told that my room is no longer available (check-in starts at 4pm) and was given to someone else bc it was "my fault"!? I showed him( I wont mention his name) my confirmed email and then he proceeded to say " well, I don't know how you changed it but you did" And when I asked him to show me how i " changed it" by handing him my phone with Hilton app. He replied "oh, well I don't know anything about the Hilton app.". And he was, from his name tag, "head of front desk"! It was an unbelievable accusational game by the front desk leaving me feeling like I had just booked this room through hotwire.com! And I have booked over a hundred forty rooms in the last 8 months with this app. So then I asked on two separate occasions in between my conversation with customer service if I'm stuck with this room and his reply was an absolute yes.So when I wrote out my concerns to Hilton, this property, Embassy Suites gave their own version " The director of front office informed guest of this and guest became irate". Irate?? I CHALLENGE THIS PROPERTY TO PROVIDE THE VIDEO OF ME BECOMING "IRATE". NOW this front desk "lead" person is stooping to LIES about ME in an attempt to cover up HIS misdoings! And all this at the DIAMOND member level! Conditions of this room: the work desk was in the middle of the room behind a 5-foot wall blocking all natural light. The desk chair is nothing more then a wrapped lawn chair that is totally uncomfortable to sit in with a TV hanging directly above it. The clocks are STILL an hour behind(3 weeks after daylight savings). Then. 2 hours later returning to hotel, my digital key failed to work for the first time since joining Hilton Honors with 140 nights in last 8 months. So was the desk messing with me now...oh yes. Worst property experience.This property TOTALLY unprofessional. I canceled my following night and are going elsewhere. 1 Stars bc I did the king bed. Staff stooping to lies about guest interactions to cover their misdoings. Despicable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location of the Embassy Suites Midtown, which opened in January 2018, is convenient to Times Square, Madison Square Gardens and the Herald Square subway station. The hotel has a nice breakfast buffet featuring omelettes made to order, cold and hot cereal, hot buffet items, fruit and yogurt. The breakfast pastries on the weekdays were disappointing -- not prepared fresh each day. On a busy Saturday, we had a better chance of getting freshly baked breakfast pastries. The hotel also offers complimentary drinks with some light appetizers in the evenings.The name of the hotel is deceiving. The rooms are definitely NOT suites. Our hotel room was so small there was not a dresser for storing clothes. When we called the reception desk, we were told that there were drawers under the bed. Also, the very small clothes closet was located in the bathroom and had room for a maximum of 10 hangers -- OK for one person but not that good for two people. The room safe was a decent size and was large enough to store a laptop computer.The hotel is new and clean and in a good location. The rooms are quite small but that is probably typical for newer properties in Manhattan. Just don't be fooled by the hotel name. It is not a suites hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Convenient location walking distance from Times Square and Madison square garden. Nice, clean hotel. My only compliant is that we were promised a room at 2:30 and had to wait until 5:30 to get into the room. We had dinner reservations at six so it was cutting it close.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice brand spanking new Embassy Suites in Midtown Manhattan. Great location right near Macys flagship store and easy walk to Penn Station/MSG, Times Square and Empire State Building. Subway stop just a block away. Easy parking just behind the hotel for $40 a night.Rooms were small which is typical for NYC chain properties, not your typical Suite. Our room had a nice view of the ESB. Bed was very comfortable and the room was clean as you would expect with a new property.Managers evening reception was in a very tight space, very crowded, but there was a good selection of liquor and the bartenders were fast, efficient, friendly and generous with the alcohol.Morning free breakfast was excellent, we enjoyed the egg ordering system, made it very convenient to order your eggs and not have to stand around.Check in could have been more efficient, seems like the staff is still trying to get the hang of things. That said, all in all a very nice stay, we will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Booked with points. Great location with easy access to the Garden and Time's Square.The room was smaller than expected but was clean and comfortable. Blackout curtains made for some excellent sleep! Tom and Jonathan in the bar were excellent. Remembered our names from first introduction as well as our normal drinks. Entire staff was engaging and friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Room was comfortable and staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were smaller than expected. Closet space was limited but drawer space provided. Complimentary breakfast was very good. Excellent location - few blocks from Macy’s, Times Square, Empire State bldg and close to subway stop.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Brand new, excellent staff,clean rooms,great happy hour and breakfast. Rooms are smaller but still offer 2 rooms! This is a very nice place close to Times Square but far enough away!!! I would really recommend this hotel as it is one of the best for its price, Not far from the hidden gem, BASSO56! Great spot like EMbassy!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Overall a great choice. Excellent location. Breakfast and evening reception were nice but small space and often no seats. Few issues with housekeeping but it's new hotel so I am assuming these will be worked out soon. Front desk staff were helpful. I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great new hotel in Midtown with suites which is hard to find in New York. Perfect location for those who would prefer to avoid the craziness of times Square. Fantastic staff and big, updated, clean rooms!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Embassy suite midtown Manhattan I called before I booked and asked about the king suite room because we would need to use the pull out sofa. I was told the size of the sofa bed was a full size. I was traveling with two teenagers a ten year old and myself. I called the front on our walk fro penn station I spoke to Sandra who was super helpful w directions. We arrived around 9:30am. Our room wasn’t ready but they kept our bags. This is complimentary. We went out to explore the city. Arriving back at the hotel. The check in was quick and easy Off to managers reception. They offered soda basic drinks. The bartenders were super nice. The food was very simple. Hummus and bread. Normally the embassy suites offer a bit more Our room was modern there was a refrigerator, microwave and sofa bed in the living room There was a king size bed in the bedroom. The back of the sofa was high and offered a room divider. But you are in one room. The bathroom was small. It housed the shower, vanity and toilet. There were two televisions. We needed extra pillows and Armando at the front desk was very helpful. With the bathroom housing the vanity and shower. This wasn’t convenient for four people. But we made it work. The hotel has a small gym. Nice and new The breakfast in the morning was very amazing. Everyone works really hard the make fresh food and omelettes. They even give you to go containers if needed. The hotel isn’t in Times Square but a ten minute walk. We normally stay in that area but would stay here again. Loved the team of people working there. I read about the slow elevators and would agree during busier times they get slow but overall it wasn’t a problem. Hats off to embassy suites. Keep up the good work and take care of your hotel. And thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I normally stay at the Hilton Midtown, but took a risk on the Embassy Suites since it was less expensive. The rooms are small but efficient. The sitting space isn't terrifically useful, however if you are in NYC on vacation and want to bring back food, it would be convenient. Street noise is minimal. Where the Embassy Suites really shines is their staff - everyone was friendly and welcoming. Its also very nice to be outside the chaos of Times Square, but still well located on the Southern edge of midtown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This is a brand-new property, open only a few months. It's sleek, clean, and modern, and very efficient. There were three in our party so we had a King-bed suite. The room is small, so when the cushions are removed from the sofa bed at night there's very little room to move around and it's impossible to use the desk or the TV. But it’s thoughtfully arranged to maximize the use of the space available. We were very pleasantly surprised by how peacefully quiet our room was. One night we were too tired to go out so we had dinner in the “Heist” lounge off the lobby. The menu is short but interesting and we had a very nice meal for a reasonable price The things we enjoyed most about this place were its location, price, quiet, cleanliness, ample free breakfast buffet, and - most of all - the highly helpful and efficient staff. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: From check-in to check-out, this hotel was amazing and it starts with the employees! I have never met a happier and friendlier group of people that really seem to enjoy their jobs, each other and customers. It was refreshing and such a pleasure to be around such positive energy!The rooms are amazing too. I was there for work with my family and the studio room was perfect for us, they make the best use of a small space! My daughter loved the separate space and having her own TV in the room and its a bonus that everything is so new.Back to the employees, they were so welcoming to my daughter and did so many nice things that made her feel special throughout our stay. We appreciate this so much and this will be the only hotel we stay at in NYC, I don't think anything can compare!!!
user_name:
debragwu
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We booked this hotel for its location, mid Manhattan, close to Empire the Empire State Building and most importantly Macy’s. We have stayed at Hilton suites previously so had expectations as to what to expect. On the plus side we were not disappointed with the location, central and good walking distance to broadway. The hotel is new and the rooms are pristine as is the hotel. The customer service was excellent. It is however a small hotel (6 rooms per floor over 35 floors) the lifts became very congested at times (breakfast and complementary afternoon drinks) as did the restaurant area trying to cope with the demand of breakfast and complementary drinks. It was however Easter the hotel was full and possibly the first time since opening the staff worked very hard but struggled. Our room (3308)had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building it was well equipped even including a small microwave but it was small. Ok for two people for a couple of days but storage space was limited and the bathroom had a great shower but the room again was small. The wardrobe was next to the toilet which we found strange.There is a small bar/restaurant on the ground floor, again small and can get cramped cramped, drinks are reasonably priced but we did not enjoy the food, ( a flat bread) it was not cooked even on the second attempt, the manger was very understanding and did not charge us, teething problems but great customer service.Overall a great hotel in great location, fantastic hard working staff and worthy of a visit for a few days if in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I love new hotels and this one did not disappoint. I am sure that I will return when the opportunity comes up. Can't wait to try out the Skylawn when the weather gets warm enough. Cool views from the room as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Awesome stay in NYC. Room was small but comfortable. Clean room no odor no bugs no noise. The view was facing a side street no skylines just business restaurants below. Location was close to macys Broadway time square and got lost on the subway. Got lost because someone at the desk gave us wrong directions on how to get to soho..South of Houston area. We walked for miles exploring but eventually found Chinatown canal street vintage stores fashion district etc we found it on our own. Not a easy walk from hotel so if you don't like walking for miles catch a subway.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Excellent customer service, the team at this hotel are fantastic. Excellent location a quick 7 minute walk to Time Square. Wonderful views of the Empire State Building. Computers in the lobby for guests to print. Will stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great place to stay if you are visiting midtown. It is also only a short taxi ride uptown. Visit Greenwich Village SOHO flower district and more. Taxi ride uptown is about $10.00 plus trip. It is easy to get around

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights while in the city and were very happy with the stay. The location is perfect, can walk or access the subway anywhere you want to go and accommodations are clean (although small). The staff in every aspect were AMAZING, especially the night front desk team who was always helpful when we ran into some issues with our room being changed before arrival. We had a couple of glitches, but hopefully as the property matures these will be things of the past. All in all a great find.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Just got back a week ago after spending 4 days/3 nights. Really nice hotel. Great location, friendly staff and clean. Compact rooms are different than the usual Embassy Suites, but well manageable considering we spent very little time in the room. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Yes, they have the Manager’s reception. Yes, they have the made to order breakfast. Love both. The rooms are smaller than other Embassy Suites. Much smaller. There is no separate bedroom. I knew this from other reviews. They were not exaggerating and neither am I. The work desk had just barely enough room for my laptop and notepad. I did not open the sofa bed, but it might fit a 12 year old. I banged my shins a couple of times on the hard bed frame walking around the room. The service was outstanding. Housekeeping service was during a 90 minute timeframe that I requested. The chef at breakfast was accommodating to special orders and the happy hour bartenders were attentive and friendly. If you can live with the smaller room, you will be happy here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Close to everything in NYC and wonderful staff. The evening reception had good snacks and drinks. The breakfast was awesome ate omelets every day, had fruit, baked goods and plenty of meats to choose from.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed there for 1 night with my family in March.I have been to several other hotels in this area but I am sure this is one of the best for its price. All of the staffs were very friendly. The room is spacious compared to the other hotels in Manhattan. TV, shower are all clean / new.If I had chance to go back, I will certainly go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had in NYC! We just returned home from a family trip and the hotel was excellent! The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, the room was perfect and comfortable, and the made to order breakfast was delicious. Plus, there is a reception every day that is a welcome treat after a long day of sightseeing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We decided to stay away from Times Square and really glad we did. This hotel was very clean and the employees were nice at all times. They would always acknowledge you with a smile as you entered and exited the hotel. Check in was quick and easy. I did not get adjoining rooms as I requested but they were next to each other. The hotel was sold out the first night so it would have been hard to move us. I was assured they would work on it the next morning but I did not bother to check with them since we were already comfortably settled in and I knew they were packed. I am sure they would have accommodated us had I pushed the issue. I thought I may have book too far from Times Square and all the action but I was completely wrong. The hotel is near Empire State Building and actually we could see it from our room. We walked everywhere at the persistence of my 20 year old daughter but everything was blocks way from each other. If we did not want to walk we would take the subway. Getting around was not an issue at all.Breakfast was nice offering a variety of options if you wanted to eat at the hotel. The afternoon wine/spirits/snacks was a great way to take a break after a long day of shopping/walking/site-seeing before hitting the streets again for the evening.I wish I could remember everyone's names as everyone should be recognized because they were all so kind and helpful. We had a lovely conversation with the manager one night. Craig was so kind and had a wonderful personality as well. He was headed out the door one night (going home) but stopped to acknowledge us and we ended up talking and laughing with him a bit. Lastly, we had a late flight out so I was given a late check out of 1:00. At that time we were able to put our luggage in a locked room for safe keeping until it was time to leave. A nice young man helped us take our luggage to our awaiting ride.For the price you pay you can't go wrong with this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This hotel has a lot of strong points:1. Location- a quick walk to the 34th/Herald Square subway station. This allowed us to easily navigate to other parts of town. It is around the corner from the Empire State Building and walking distance to Times Square.2. Room- we had a "suite" with a vie on the top (39th) floor. The suite is one room with a king sized bed separated by a high backed couch that folds out to a pretty good sized bed.
