This was perfect for one adult and two teens (one teen slept with me and the other took the foldout). 2 adults and one kid (or maybe two smaller kids) would also be fine. I don't think we would have enjoyed the room as much with two adults and two teens.3. Storage- space is tight, but if you utilize the drawers under the king bed (which store the foldout blanket/pillow), the small closet, and the nooks under the bedside shelves, then it is perfect. If you are more than 2 people traveling with larger than carry on suitcases, you may have trouble finding space for your luggage (regular king room likely has more open space than the suite).4. View- Wow! The window is not floor to ceiling, so the view is really only accessed by standing next to the window- but a high floor facing downtown will provide a stupendous view of the Empire State Building; the downtown skyline is in the distance. It may be that all rooms on the downtown facing side have the smaller windows. Floor to ceiling windows are supposedly not available (per front desk) in the suites. Uptown views are also nice (based on view that direction from elevators).5. Amenities- free daily breakfast was decent, with a variety of options. Evening reception from 5-7 is nice, though the snacks provided are pretty marginal (veggies and dip, maybe trail mix or soft pretzel bites, small cookies one night)- but most people seem to be there for the free drink. I didn't look at or use the fitness center, but there is one. The fridge and microwave in room were handy.We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New Hilton property in Midtown. The service staff is top notch. By far the best front desk crew I have experienced in NYC. Housekeeping and dining facility staff were also great. Breakfast and evening receptions are good when not too crowed.Some room for improvement: 1. The room uses floor instead of carpet, and the floor looks dusty and felt sticky at some points, which surprised me knowing that the hotel is really knew. 2. The elevator requires room key, but the sensor is not very good, and caused quite some inconvenience. 3. When operating at capacity, breakfast and reception is just too messy. Although I understand the staff is already trying their best, it still didn't feel great. Overall, would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC and want to stay in Midtown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I enjoyed my recent two night stay at this new Embassy Suites. Not exactly sure why they branded it an ES since the rooms are small and not exactly suites...I was upgraded to the largest room they have which was divided into two parts by a tall piece of furniture but the whole room couldn’t have been 300 square feet. With all the stuff they’ve jammed into the room it feels a bit cramped. But everything was new and well thought out - lots of power outlets and lights where you need them, etc. The bathroom was small but had a great standalone shower. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. I had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building from my window. Really, I still can’t believe how much of the building I could see. The evening reception was disappointing. Sure, there was complementary beer and wine but there was a $5 up charge for anything other than draft Bud Light. Eeks. The snacks were just some bagged snack mixes and celery sticks (or carrots, I don’t remember). Better than nothing, sure, but just barely. Breakfast was very good. There is a unique omelette ordering system utilizing iPads attached to the wall. The omelette I had was made quickly and was quite tasty. Lots of other hot and cold items available on the buffet. I went very early and was the only person there both days but the breakfast room is tight so I imagine it gets very crowded. The lobby water feature is pretty cool but the elevators are pretty slow, especially around the happy hour. The location is great, at least for me. Lots of restaurants near by and very close to the ESB where I work when in NYC.All in all, I enjoyed the Embassy Suites and would definitely stay there again. Rooms are small by ES standards but are well stocked and comfortable. Everything was brand new when I was there which made it just that much nicer. Give it a shot!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The hotel is brand new and you can certainly tell. Everything is new and clean. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful and acknowledged us every time we came and went and asked if we needed anything. It is handy to have breakfast, though it is pretty crowded and the food is average. It is on the 4th floor. Nice feature. We did not take advantage of the evening reception but it is located there too.The room was tight for 3 people, but we expected that for Manhattan. Our son slept on the extra couch and was able to fit on it without folding it out. In the shower you have to point the shower head toward the shower wall and not toward the doors. The shower doors do not hold in water and we had to make sure we had towels down in front of the doors. The room was nice and clean though and as quiet as it could be considering the location.We had a nice stay. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Central location. Good walking distance to many places like time square, bus terminal, shopping. Broadway shows. Minutes from the Empire State Building. Otherwise, uber is cheap to get around. Great selection included in the conplimentary breakfast. It was like, “wow”.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I am heartbroken I only had a one night stay. Three-night minimum should be the standard. No cutting corners here y'all, all the bells and whistles were pulled out for this brand new NYC Embassy Suites.I had a studio suite, every item had its place. Perfectly decorated with plenty of room to maneuver about. That's always a plus for NYC hotel rooms. Count it all joy!I was only there a short while and not able to take advantage of all the amenities, but what a lovely property. I did order room service, and noticed, there were no enormous fees for delivery. I don't believe it was a mistake. I appreciate that.I will be back! Me:1st stay here1 night stay12yr Hilton Honors Man100 nights per year

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: It’s nice and new. Breakfast and happy hour are outstanding. Location is convenient. Room is a little tight for family of 3. The sofa bed is actually quite comfy. I would hope the window is slightly bigger for the View. Over all it was a nice staying.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Convenient location, brand new, plenty of outlets (but some are already loose and won’t hold the plug), small but well-used space, sleek modern feel in bed and bath. Breakfast was good - made to order eggs (use touch screen to order), bacon, sausage (pork or chicken), potatoes, pancakes, baked goods, yogurt, fruit, cereal, coffee and juices. Lots of seating room (two seating areas). Evening reception had mixed drinks, wine, beer, and finger foods. Dominique welcomed us when we arrived at 3:30 (check-in at 4) on a Sunday. There is no reserved space for load/unload in front of the hotel. When we pulled up, there was a space and we parked. No one from the hotel came out to greet us, give us a cart, help with directing us - even though there were several employees watching us from inside. My husband went in to ask about the procedure and someone came out to help with our bags and explain parking. Parking is around the corner on the next block - not too far. We had requested chocolate covered strawberries and cookies in the room for our anniversary. Our particular room was not ready yet, so Dominique went up to switch out “amenities” to a different room. While Dominique and other hosts were pleasant, it took over an hour to get into our room. Then the amenities were in the fridge in plastic boxes or on a plastic cover plate - not exactly what I had imagined. She did comp us the amenities and added another item for free as well. We left the room at 10:30am the next day only to come back to an unclean room at nearly midnight. The front desk did send up fresh towels. The next day the room was cleaned, but the hallways were not well vacuumed. The elevators are a bit tedious. Only 3 for over 30 floors. Going back up from breakfast was time consuming. For safety you can also only select floors that have breakfast and your room. Also, before getting your car to leave, you must have the claim ticket stamped by the hotel. All in all it was a great place to lay our head at night. Not noisy at all. The windows open a smidge for fresh air and we could see the Empire State Building and Macy’s at Herald Square from our room. I hope the hotel works out the kinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We were in NYC for the Big East Basketball tournament, so this was a great location to Madison Square Garden. A new property, it was very inviting, good service, clean rooms, nice included breakfast & evening drinks. Lobby bar small but very nice and great bartender.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This remarkable property provided everything a visitor would anticipate from the exceptional customer service to the amenities on site....the property is a lot smaller from my favorite at Hughes Landing in Texas yet it met every expectation. I will say the staff and the team of impeccable associates represent the Hilton brand well as they all exemplified commitment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Man the location is close to everything, the staff is awesome. Day and night staff was welcoming . Its a Mariah Carey look alike working there check in was fast. Clean rooms,comfortable beds,the maid on rhe 34 floor was God sent,she was awesome. I loved the bartenders at the 5-7free drink thing on the 4th floor. Spoke Multi language also. Only thing was you had to use a key eveytime u got on the elevators to make them move. And this is the only embassy suites ive been to that wasnt seprate living and sleeping area. Rooms were kinda small but made up for it in the view and the windows were big and it was just a view to die for. Room service never brought me my last order but i didnt get charged so no harm. Food was round 30 bucks room service . Loved it would go back. Considering i was snowed in the first night it was great. Breakfast was ok. I'm not the omlette type and that was the high light of their breakfast, but sometimes they added small pancakes to the menu.its super cute how its set up but kinda small. But very functional. Pics are view from their big windows.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here on our weekend getaway and had a great experience. The hotel must be recently renovated as everything is very clean and modern. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Had quick check in and out and I could also use my phone as a digital key and check in advance. Free breakfast was spectacular and perfect location for all midtown activities!!!! Definitely would stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Good stay after check-in issues. If you're a HH member, beware they will try to charge credit card on account prior to check in even if it’s not your ‘preferred’ card to guarantee reservation. Also, they charge for early check in so plan 4 pm check in. They will hold your bags if you arrive early or they have proper sitting areas for guests to relax. No water at check in. As there are few reviews for this brand new hotel, I will be detailed because if you’re like me, you want more info than ‘hotel was great.’ I booked Studio Suite w/ View high floor for 3 nights for Mom/Tween trip. This is one room divided like a studio apartment w/ bed and sitting area back-to-back. The sofabed had no linens and would have been hassle to deal with in cramped space, not sure where we’d put pillows, etc. so did not use. The king bed takes up most space in bedroom so kept hitting legs on platform to get around when getting up at night. However, the bed was comfortable with good linens and pillows. There was massive TV on wall at end of bed, approx. 50”. We enjoyed watching pay movie for $13. The ‘living area’ has sofabed w/ high back that serves as the ‘wall.’ between bedroom area There is counter w/ two chairs w/ second smaller TV on wall. The couch is only barrier so understand there is no real privacy if someone sleeping on sofabad and be loud if both tvs in use. We were on 27th floor. We did have view but out of small windows, odd design choice for new build. You have to stand at window to look up to see the ESB and down to Herald Square. One window opens slightly which was helpful to check weather. We heard normal city noise but nothing disruptive. We did not hear any other guests. Room has small closet, tiny refrigerator and micro, one of those two cup coffee makers, large safe and full-length mirror. I was thinking they should put up some hooks on wall for extra storage. The bathroom was small w/ walk-in shower, good counter space. I hated the smell and quality of the Neutrogena products but that is subjective. I liked that bathroom was away from sleeping area. Housekeeping is still work in progress. Our room was not touched upon return late afternoon first day. Front desk was rude when I asked why room not cleaned. I felt was legitimate question since we needed towels, trash emptied, etc. A sweet woman was sent up some 20 minutes later who spoke zero English so we had difficult time communicating. I gave her tip and room was attended on timely basis following days. You have to scan key card to use elevator to access all floors except when going down to lobby. The front desk fails to tell you this at check in so prepare to have key ready at all times. I'm usually not a big fan of chain hotel breakfast buffets but Embassy's was pretty great. They had everything you’d want including fruit, bagels, croissants, hot items and made-to-order eggs. The only thing missing was waffle maker. They need to get proper signage in place because nobody knew what direction buffet moved or where to order the eggs without asking. The coffee area also needs tweaking for better flow. The touch screen to order eggs is super easy (it’s on wall opposite cook) – I suggest bypassing entering your name/room info, it’s not necessary and time consuming. Just hit buttons for what you want and hit ORDER twice and they’ll call out your order when ready. They did run out and not replace items if within 30 minutes of end so best to go early (ends at 10 on weekdays, 10:30 weekends). There was never enough seating so we took food up to room (I saw some people w/ take-out boxes but never found them). It was my understanding hotel is not at full capacity so imagine breakfast will be hectic when hotel is full. Happy Hour w/ open bar from 5-7 was great surprise! The snacks offered looked basic so avoided so not to ruin appetite for dinner. I usually stopped in and grabbed glass of wine for room but many were hanging out, enjoying cocktails. Don’t forget to tip bartenders. This area of NYC is not prettiest but is very central to get up and downtown. Madison Square Garden/Penn Station and Bryant Park no more than 10 min walk and Times Square/Broadway 10 min. Macy's is two blocks away as is subway. We grabbed taxis with ease on corner of 6th/37th, don’t believe bellmen hail taxis. The hotel is on quiet side street. We had arrival driver from JFK pick us up to return. I'm not sure if hotel offers airport transport so plan ahead if needed. Bottom line is this is nice new hotel option understanding this is a ‘citified’ Embassy Suites and you don’t need proper suite or room w/ double/queen beds.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Wonderful hotel in a great location with good design and amazing breakfast and a very friendly omelet chef. The only thing I am confused about is who designed the software for the omelet station tablets?! You need a PhD to figure it out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Booked this Hilton property because of its proximity to NY Penn Station. No problem pulling our suitcase from the train station a short walk to this hotel. This was the quietest hotel room I ever had in NYC! Never heard street traffic. New, clean rooms. Delightful breakfast. We were also able to walk to/from the theater district for a show. Agree that the room is small, but it was cozy and all that we needed for a weekend in the city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Great Location for walking to all the top locations to visit including shopping for food and items you may have forgot to pack. !!! Very clean property. The breakfast in the morning was more than the average items to pick from. We will visit again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Flawless service from check-in to check-out.The room was a bit smaller than expected but nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Good water pressure in the batch room which is not always the case in hotels.Breakfast was good and varied. Personally I would have preferred some fresh baked breads.Lounge from 5pm-7pm was something we really appreciated.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had an 8 night stay it was fabulous Staff were great from Reception to restaurant. Special mention.to Denise on front desk and Gabriel. Room was lovely with great view and cleaned every day this is a new hotel so everything is modern and New would definitely go back again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New nice hotel but wow the suite for 3 was so tight, when u open the bed u have to hide all these huge pillows in closet etc,which don't all fit plus the table on wheels etc. and you can't use the desk at all, very very cramped! Hard for 3! The breakfast is great although they ran out of many items 1/2 before breakfast was over like oatmeal, yogurt etc and they told us sorry we r out! Not Good if your going to have breakfast till certain time have it fully stocked! Happy Hour is very nice, bartenders were great!Our room for 3 had pull out bed which when we opened like I said is so cramped but they had no sheets, no bedding anywhere in room for it so had to call down and they only brought up sheet, one pillow and very thin blanket.We called down next night and asked for 2 blankets, they never came, called again hour later, no one ever brought them, went to desk the next night to ask for them and this time soon after we got a knock on door and they apologized they were out of blankets and gave us 2 sheets, like what??? Huge hotel chain and out of blankets??? Inexcusable!  The bathroom shower door doesn't close all the way and water just would pour out on the bathroom floor, plus the shower dripped all the time & nothing was ever done about it. Overall, nice location if you want Midtown and clean hotel but would have liked better service and more room for 3 people.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: EXCELLENT customer service from check in to check out. Was greeted by staff from the moment we got out of the cab, checking in, and every time we entered the property in the afternoons/evenings. Brand new hotel with the usual "opening pains" but nothing major or significant. Rooms are tight which you expect in NYC, but sufficient, very comfortable, well appointed, and modern. Breakfast/eating area seating is limited for the size of hotel it is and got crowded with nowhere to sit at times. Choices at breakfast were great - made to order eggs, omelettes, etc. Staff did a great job keeping food out and area cleaned up. Drink choices during complimentary cocktail hour were great, but the food offerings were disappointing (carrot & celery sticks, tortilla chips/bottled salsa). Very enjoyable stay, convenient location near 5th Avenue, Herald Square, Times Square and theatre district. Would definitely stay there again!! Two thumbs up!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Everything about this hotel was great. Free cocktail hour from 5-7, free breakfast buffet (the omelet station was awesome), and the service was wonderful. Hotel is centrally located - close to Penn Station, Bryant Park, the theatre district, etc. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: For a recently opened hotel, the service was exceptional - exceptional even for one with a very experienced staff. The staff encountered some minor issues, but dealt with them quickly with grace and humor - can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: EXCELLENT customer service from check in to check out. Was greeted by all staff i encountered. No ice machine on my floor. One of the staff that happened to be on my floor greeted me and offered to go get the ice for me and brought it back to my room so that i could relax. Was welcomed back each time I came back into the hotel. A few "opening pains" but nothing that significantly detracted from our experience. The spaces are tight in the rooms and in the breakfast area. Chef making omlettes and other staff there very friendly and hospitable. We made a suggestion and something was implemented the very nexy day. Bar in closet in first room we had was cast too low. The promptly moved us to another room.Very enjoyable stay, convenient location between Herald Square an Times Square. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We decided to try this new Embassy Suites located on 37th street between 5th and 6th avenue, midtown manhattan. Our room had a very good view on the 35th floor. Room was small but very comfy. Service was outstanding, bedding was very good, breakfast was good. Everyone is ready to please you. Bathroom was impeccable, but small. I highly recommend this brand new gem. Centrally located and a walking distance to everything from shopping to shows. Thank you for our great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed here for a few days on business and would definitely come back to stay for a personal or business trip. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were nice, location was great. One of the better breakfast buffets I've enjoyed at an Embassy Suite. Only inconvenience was having to use your key card in the elevator whereas you can use your phone as your key to your room, since you need a key card you might as well always just use a key and skip the mobile keycard.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The property fine - small rooms when compared to other Embassy Suites hotel but that's expected in NYC. Breakfast and reception were nice. I am a loyal Hilton member (silver) and was staying 3 nights last week for business. I got to the hotel early (10:30) and was charged $75 (later reduced to $50) for an early check-in fee. After complaining multiple times, they refused to cancel the fee - even when I indicated that I will never stay at their hotels again. Which I won't - there are too many other amazing places to stay in the city that don't charge if you get there early. So if you expect that you're going to want to get in your room before the 4:00 check-in, expect to pay. Poor customer focus - way to lose a loyal over $50!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: absolutely brilliant stay. very close to maceys, times square and other great shopping stops. the staff were amazing and the chef made great omelettes every morning that we stayed.its a new hotel and the decor was great and well looked after.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: They hadn’t been open that long, but everything was working as it should have been. Segundo did an outstanding job with drinks at the manager’s reception. The rest of the staff was excellent. Parking was easy enough, and just a shot walk. Rooms were clean. Will pick this hotel again. 34th floor room had a great view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Nice, new hotel with helpful staff and good amenities. Free made to order breakfast and evening reception are a nice touch. Gym facilities are good as well. Rooms are nicely appointed and well kept by housekeeping
user_name:
Oliver K
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary. From beginning to end, the hotel was magnificent. The staff, hospitality, and quality were superb! We will definitely stay here again! Furthermore, everyone was polite!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Enjoyed our weekend stay at Embassy Suites. All the personnel we encountered in the hotel was friendly and helpful. Checkin was a breeze. We had a great room on the 34th with a view of the Empire State Bldg and Herald Square. The room was small but comfortable for the three of us. There was a great selection at breakfast. It was the best organized experience I've had ordering an omelette at a breakfast buffet. The complimentary drinks in the evening gave us a nice relaxing break before heading out to dinner. The location could not have been any better, a very short walk to the subway and walking distance to Times Square. A great place to stay while visiting NYC!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: The location was perfect. Easy half mile walk from Port Authority and great for shopping, dinning, client visit, etc. I din't get a chance to take part in the complimentary breakfast but when I went to get coffee it looked fantastic. My room had a nice layout and didn't feel cramped. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: From check in to check out, this hotel is faultless. At check in we were greeted by friendly and helpful front of house team. Our room wasn't yet ready (we had arrived a bit early) but we were offered coffee and given a "check in" bag each which contained water, popcorn and chocolate. Our room, a one bed king on the 30th floor, was a perfect base. Slightly larger than other "king" rooms I have stayed at in NYC. The bed was comfortable, the TV had a wide choice of channels and all in HD, the bathroom was big, the shower hot and good water pressure, microwave, coffee machine and a fridge. The buffet breakfast has it all covered, whether you want hot or cold, they have it covered and the selection changes daily, we stayed five nights and never got bored. It was a little busy at the weekend but during the week it was a lot quieter. Managers reception in the evening was well presented with house red / white and Bud and Bud lite all included. We ordered room service one evening which was good and came within twenty minutes. We also had the filet steak at the Heist one evening which I highly recommend. Location is great, 2 blocks from Subway, 5 minutes walk to Penn Station / MSG. Overall, staff couldn't do enough, all were friendly and helpful, great location, superb rooms, great dining. When I am next in NYC I will be coming back here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Such a great stay at the brand new Embassy Suites in midtown Manhattan! From the moment my husband and I arrived we felt like we were guests- we were assisted with our luggage to our room on the 23rd floor and the view was incredible. We were looking directly at the Empire State Building and Herald Square. Very clean and quiet hotel. Lobby is gorgeous with a beautiful eclectic fountain. Free complimentary breakfast each morning was delicious! Evening social each night with complimentary beverages and snacks. This hotel is in such a great location- walking distance to Times Square and Midtown shopping. Dunkin’ Donuts next door and plenty of options for dining nearby. Safe area and very attentive and friendly staff from the moment we arrived. This will be our hotel when we visit NYC!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: My wife and I were celebrating her birthday and went to New York for the weekend. We were both impressed with this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the complimentary breakfast and evening social were great and the view from our room was awesome!My only complaint is that there were hairs all over the bathroom and room when we checked in. Other than that, the room was very clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Hotel has only been open a few weeks - everything was clean and new. The staff was very attentive, friendly and aimed to please. The breakfast buffet was well stocked and had great fresh and locally made pastries. The location of the hotel was good for doing the regular tourist things - about 3 blocks from Macy’s and 4 from the center of Times Square. The location was nice and quiet too. My only complaint-which is minor-is the light snack description for the complimentary happy hour was no exaggeration! They only served carrot, celery sticks, tortilla chips, salsa and some kind of cheese dip. Overall, we plan to stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: `Everything was bad since checking in experience till i got into a dirty room. was trying to be outplayed by front desk. somehow it was solved. never staying at hilton. floor had dust. toilet had spot.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Outstanding hotel for location and value in Mid Town Manhattan. Incredible staff with extra friendly approach made us feel as if we have known them for years. From front desk to bartenders - absolutely great! Definitely will go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Stayed a total of 4 nights and was very well taken care of by hotel staff. Premise was clean with free breakfast daily and evening reception. A special shoutout to Marybeth and Sheila who went through great lengths to make my stay safe and comfortable. From warm milk and cookies to coax a snooze, friendly local tips for visitors, ground transport arrangement to the ensuring of physical safety of hotel grounds, Marybeth and Sheila delivered with their ever cheerful demeanor. Highly recommend a stay, and a chat with these awesome staff of Hilton hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: We had a great stay. The location is convenient - close to subways and walking distance to a number of sights. The rooms are cozy, but well appointed. The breakfast spread is impressive, especially the made-to-order omelettes. However, the real highlight is the staff. They are friendly, enthusiastic and clearly proud of their new hotel. Looking forward to our next trip to New York.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: Perfectly located, brand new hotel. Free breakfast and evening reception. Wonderful staff who will do anyhting to make your stay perfect. Rooms good size and nicely decorated. The only thing we lacked was a handheld shower, but we know that is not standard in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: New hotel, opened last week. Very modern, sleek design. Staff was great. Room decent size for NYC. Bathroom was very nice, bright. Evening reception and breakfast were great as all Embassy Suites. I’ll definitely stay here next time I’m in NYC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was amazing and ALL had smiles in their faces, which was greatly appreciated after a long day! They genuinely LOVE working there. It is now the only hotel in New York I want to stay at!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This place just open 6 days ago. Front desk staff are all smiley and friendly. Made us feel truly welcome.Great view from the 29th floor, looking at the Empire State Building. My room, though small, had all the amenities of an Embassy Suites. I am the first guest to stay in the room I was given.(By the way, this is the 119th different ES property on my continuing list of ES Stays.)Up too early to have breakfast, had to head to the airport. I'll follow up my review when I return in 4 days. Meantime, my overall review, this is a great, new hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites by Hilton New York Manhattan Times Square
review_body: This Embassy Suites just opened a few days ago. The hotel staff were all welcoming and eager to help. The studio room made good use of the space with a partial divider between the bed and living room area with the sofa bed. There were two televisions in the room, one for the living room area and one across from the bed. The room includes a mini refrigerator and microwave and coffeemaker. While pretty compact, the bathroom has a decent amount of counter space. The stay included an evening reception from 5-7pm (even on the weekends) and a buffett breakfast in the morning, including made-to-order omelets. Overall, I had a pleasant stay.
